story:
Short Summary

Since I came to live at the beautiful Coast of Kenya in 1980 I have been wondering why poverty is so prominent in an environment rich in natural resources: the sun, sea, land, trees, and many young energetic people who could make the best out of these resources. What was missing was awareness, knowledge, skills and exposure to the many opportunities available world wide. So we started KWETU training centre for sustainable development in 1997, which has meanwhile trained thousands of people along the Coast in beekeeping to protect mangrove forests, development of herbal products from neem, aloe vera and moringa, methods of sustainable agriculture and of course mariculture (fish, prawns, oyster farming).

We want to establish KWETU as centre of excellence where people can get inspired by appropriate technology and knowledge to improve their livelihoods without destroying their natural environment. 

Our first Eco Festival on 14th June will promote these ideas through a multitude of creative and educational activities. The festival will also be a platform to showcase what eco-friendly products, services and projects are available at the Coast.  

What We Need & What You Get

We aim at raising 15.000 US$ with this campaign to upgrade our resource centre with internet and computers for students to reach out to the wider world. We want to improve our processing facilities for honey and other by- products e.g. propolis and we want to get quality packaging and certification for all our herbal products so that we can access the global market. 

This means you will soon be able to purchase KWETU health products in your local markets. 

The Impact

In the last 15 years we have trained thousands of women, youth and farmers in small scale agribusinesses. Unfortunately the local market is limited and producers find it increasingly difficult to sell their products. KWETU has thus decided to avail marketing services for the people we trained. We will do the quality control, packaging, certification and sales to the national and international consumers.

Giving direct access to a wider market will ensure that producers reap the maximum benefit from their natural resources.

Risks & Challenges

In the past years we have faced and overcome many challenges but we are confident that the approach we want to take is viable and we know that we can build on the support of the many networks we have been partnering with. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support KWETU in our noble cause - not just money. We can use your expertise as volunteer and of course your networks which can open many more doors, we haven't even thought about. First of all - spread the word, share the video "KWETU works" and ask your family, friends, partners, colleagues to support our cause thus making a huge change to the lives of many rural people at the Kenyan Coast.

story:
Rising From the Dust!

You have known us as Ludo O'Dillo's--then the Dusty Swan--now we are The Twisted Swan Celtic Pub!  

That's right--the Dusty Swan is dead--LONG LIVE THE SWAN!  The TWISTED Swan, that is!  Different owner--same great vibe.  You'll see some changes--the Swan has a new paint job, some new interior touches--but you'll know her by her dusty heart, beating true and welcoming you back to the same great place you know from the past six years.  We have a new owner--Duncan "Hoggle" Macleod--and you'll see a few new faces--but you'll see a lot of old familiar faces as well.  So help us return to the playa for another great year of friends and fellowship in the Best Little Pub on the Playa!

Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is to help our new owner, Hoggle (Duncan Macleod) raise enough funds to make all that is the Swan possible once again.  He has purchased the infrastructure that is the Swan, but there are some upgrades and repairs that need to be funded, beer and whiskey to be purchased, and he has to get it all out to the playa via a rental truck.  

This is our largest funding amount so far--but we think with your help we can meet our goal.  Every year this gets just a bit more pricey to get everything out to the playa to serve 68K of our closest friends--but we have faith that we can ALL make it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you just can't spare the cash to help us at this point--that's ok!  You CAN still help!  Spread the word about our pub--and our campaign!  Be one of our cheerleaders!  You'll have our eternal thanks!  And we'll pour you a pint to slack your thirst when you visit us at Burning Man 2015!

story:
We are a small family of big nature - lovers! Three years ago we made our dream come true - in the canyon of the river Tara, the 2nd deepest canyon in the world, we created our own little heaven - a rafting camp, built out of wood and stone and surrounded by the untouched nature.


After three years of preparation and hard work, at the moment we all waited for – the moment of the roll out, our dream turned into a nightmare: our family business got burned to the ground. The fire was planted deliberately, as the official investigation has confirmed. We were devastated! Everything we worked so hard for, all our efforts, struggles and achievements and all those years we put into the project – all got destroyed in one single night by an arsonist.

However, we have decided not to give up, to rise from the ashes and give it all one more try. But to do that, we need your help and support. Our goal is to reach $50,000 to pay for the costs of rebuilding the main house and to buy materials like timber and stone for woodwork and joinery, restaurant and kitchen facilities and basic equipment for rooms and bathrooms, as well as to cover the expenses of the water supply and electricity.

As a sign of gratitude for your support, we would like to give something back to you. That is why we are offering you and your family and friends a free stay at our camp, where you can eat, hike and raft for a duration of a weekend, a whole week or an entire vacation, and charge yourself with positive energy that will keep you running for a long time.

If we don't reach our goal, the funds we raise will be used to help offset the cost of rebuilding the camp and so, we would really appreciate whatever help you can offer.

In case we surpass our goal, the extra money will go towards an insurance licence so that we can make sure that the facility is protected from a similar sort of loss in the future.

Thank you for your interest in this project. If you can't contribute money at this time, please consider sharing our story to your friends so we can reach as many people as possible. THANK YOU!

office@raftingresort.com

story:
Short Summary

  • I am Miss Cassandra Creant and I have been involved with the BDSM lifestyle for over 20 years. Recently, I again became an independent Dominatrix and would like to open a small play studio in the San Francisco Bay Area East Bay, but I need your help.
  • As an erotic service provider,  it is tantamount I provide my clients and play partners with a safe, clean, and very discreet space where we can have fun to explore consensual BDSM adventures. 
  • With your generous support, I will be able to procure and equip a wonderful place to ply my craft and hire other Ladies of Darkness and Light for the entertainment and erotic needs of adults interested in BDSM.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Opening a place like this doesn't come cheap , especially in the SF Bay Area where rents are the highest in the USA! Originally, I imagined an old southern mansion type place with ceiling fans, mint juleps and rooms themed to take the guest to another place and time. That idea is still a wonderful motivator but, alas, would require an enormous amount of start up capital ($500k+). So I am asking for a starter amount of $10,000 to procure a smaller location, promote with online advertisement, purchase furniture for the lounge, and equip two to three rooms with things a proper 'house of fantasy' should have: furnishings, spanking horses, St Andrew's crosses, suspension bars, medical equipment, light fixtures, security system, plenty of sexy toys, sanitation supplies, towels, etc. 
  • If you  help me build my starter dream house, you will have access to a new and wonderful BDSM adventure! In addition, for donations of $200-$1,000, you will receive special session discounts, free upgrades, and the warm fuzzy feeling of helping to create a wonderful, exciting place to play!
  • If the initial starter goal is not reached, what money is donated will be put in a managed savings account and kept safe until I am able to build the amount to the full $10k+ mark!

The Impact

  • Building the lair is important for the fulfillment of adults missing pieces in their lives; those who desire a place to transport to another world away from the hustle and bustle of their real world, even for just a little while.
  • Being an independent Domme is a very rewarding profession, and I've done quite well financially. However, my expert special attention will be significantly enhanced with a wonderful, private, secure destination for guests to relax, get tied up, and unwind with me and other beautiful Ladies of Darkness and Light! 
  • If we have had the pleasure of getting to each other, you know I am sincere, honest, wicked, devilish, industrious, and above all, dedicated to my craft. Please help make my dream come true!

Risks & Challenges

  • I have been a successful Pro Domme and small business owner for quite a while and I know what it takes to open and run a successful business. With the right funding, the right place, and the right people, I can create a wonderful BDSM play space for consenting adults, but it takes money and long hours!
  • I am dedicated to having a safe, secure, FUN, and discreet play ground for my wonderful guests. I have enlisted the help  of professionals in the know about legal issues, building procurement, and financial expectations. Help make Miss Creant's Lair a reality! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to help financially, please tell your kinky friends and online contacts about my campaign. 
  • Use the Indegogo share tools to help me get the word out!

I have been a successful Pro Domme and small business owner for quite a while and I know what it takes to open and run a successful business. With the right funding, the right place, and the right people, I can create a wonderful BDSM play space for consenting adults, but it takes money and long hours! I am dedicated to having a safe, secure, FUN, and discreet play ground for my wonderful guests. I have enlisted the help  of professionals in the know about legal issues, building procurement, and financial expectations. Help make Miss Creant's Lair a reality!     Other Ways You Can Help 
If you are unable to help financially, please tell your kinky friends and online contacts about my campaign.  Use the Indegogo share tools to help me get the word out!

story:
WHEN JESUS CHRIST FED 5,000 PEOPLE ON THAT MIRACULOUS DAY HE BEGAN WITH FIVE BARLEY LOAVES AND TWO FISH BORROWED FROM A YOUNG BOY.  JESUS TOOK THE BREAD AND FISH, GAVE THANKS, AND DISTRIBUTED TO OTHERS AS MUCH AS THEY WANTED.  John 6: 9-11 

We are humbly asking for your prayers and $25 in financial support.  We understand that not everyone can afford $25.00, and if you are not able to contribute financially we kindly ask that you use your social networking resources to help us to get the word out on this mission of love and hope. Please consider helping us in this journey and extend a loving and helping hand.  At Feeding the 5,000, we recognize this is "charitable giving" but we prefer to view it as "responsible giving to the world we all share together."  

All contributions are tax deductible.




A 2014 study by the Colorado Children’s Campaign indicates that our community’s child poverty rate is at a staggering 38% and climbing. Our families far exceed the state average in public assistance and the proportion of single-parent families with children below poverty is over 34%. The median family income is significantly lower than the state average and people in every direction are hurting and in need of help. Your help can make a difference in the lives of many people, young and old!


The Pueblo Cooperative Care Center serves over 41,000 low-income families and individuals each year. Our services are provided free and without bias regarding sex, race, age, veteran status, religion, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, disability or marital status.  Our clients always come first as they face the storms of everyday life, and our support is provided in an atmosphere of kindness, love and an offer of hope. Individuals in need of food, clothing, medical prescriptions, transportation, or personal hygiene items can come to the Center Monday’s through Friday’s and all services are provided at NO COST to those we serve.



In 2014 we served 41,767 people with food, 74,987 individuals with clothing and countless others with medication prescription services and transportation. The Center has been an integral component of the community’s public and emergency services to the poor and has a long-standing reputation of impeccable integrity and excellent stewardship which guide the Center’s path to long-term success.

Feeding the 5,000 is a collaborative Christian community campaign which raised over 70,000 pounds of food and over $5,000 in donations in 2014, its inaugural year.  Founded by Rev. Tony Ashworth, Feeding the 5,000 is supported by individuals, churches and businesses and our needs have substantially increased and outside support is now warranted.  This year we have over 300 volunteers organized for our annual food drive, and while we have a goal of 100,000 pounds of food, it just isn't enough to meet our demands! 

If we have 5,000 individuals support this cause with a donation of $25.00 each, Feeding the 5,000 will successfully raise $125,000 to provide increased benefits to those with critical needs.  If you cannot contribute financially we will be hosting our annual food drive on September 11-13, 2015 and food donations can be made at local and national grocery retailers in Pueblo, CO. Food, clothing and financial contributions can always be sent directly to the Cooperative Care Center located at 326 W. 8th Street in Pueblo, CO 81003. 


 

THINK,  PRAY,  TAKE ACTION,  MAKE A DIFFERENCE!   Thank You!

story:
Our Story

Back in 2012 six young Ukrainian students came back from their exchange year in the U.S., looked at once flourishing villages across their home country now falling into decay, and enthusiastically said: “We have to do something about it!”

And a great storm started (khm, brainstorm, I mean). Each of them proposed to organize either a clean-up, or an active citizenship campaign, or a Free Willy mission (do orca whales even swim in the Black Sea?!)… but then a great idea was born.


The organizing team decided to help tackle social problems in the Ukrainian society… by traveling to rural communities and

  • cleaning parks and riversides from trash;
  • painting playgrounds;
  • renovating museums and other historic sights;
  • building infrastructure;

  • educating youth about opportunities;
  • promoting community service;
  • engaging different social groups.
All of that involved
  • 1 bus;
  • 25 volunteers of various ethnic background;
  • 7 days of travel;
  • across 7 small towns and villages.
We have organized 3 life-changing and community helping tours in 20 Ukrainian villages so far.


― Dude, I guess the locals liked what you did for them.

― I can tell!

― But hey, where did you get the money?

― We persuaded our partners and supporters that it would work, and were awarded FLEX alumni grant and financial aid from the U.S. Embassy in Ukraine. We also built valuable partnerships with local and national NGOs which provided us with some in-kind support.

― Sounds cool!

― All of that was more than enough for transportation, materials, and simple food, as we didn’t stay in hotels but at local schools using our sleeping bags.

However, this year all hardships and numerous challenges in Ukraine made it nearly impossible for us to receive funding, and we turned to IndieGoGo to invite our backers to become a part of Help and Travel history.

― Ok, folks, tell me how you're going to spend the money!

We aim to raise an amount of $2,500, which will cover:

  • renting a bus with a driver for 7 days;
  • gas for the entire journey (around 1000 miles);
  • part of food expenses for 25 volunteers on board;
  • materials for work at locations such as paint, gloves, trash bags, brushes, etc.;
  • overnight stay in hostel for Day 0 at starting location.

― Alright, I like the idea. Can I get anything if I support?

Though we are on a tight budget, we want to award you for your support! Every dollar matters, therefore dig in the perks list and choose the one you want!

― So is this “Help and Travel” going to happen, even if it doesn’t receive full funding?

Yes, we decided to carry on with the initiative, regardless of which amount we are able to raise. However, if we gather more than our initial goal, that means you will back the Project for the next year as well! We are making it happen despite the war in our country.

Help us unlock the potential of rural communities. Help and Travel with us!

As featured on:

      American Councils                       The Bradley Herald                               In.CK.ua

story:
Short Summary

We are the Seattle chapter of Sunday Assembly, a secular community whose mission is to "live better, help often, and wonder more."  Since September 2014, our monthly gatherings in Seattle bring people together to hear inspiring, thought-provoking ideas that will help enrich our lives and our community.  Sunday Assemblers hear from a variety of speakers on a wide range of topics, from mindfulness to foster care to community involvement.  At each service we listen, we learn, we sing, we meet new people, we drink coffee and eat cookies, and we leave feeling empowered to make the world a better, more compassionate place.

Seattle's chapter of Sunday Assembly has been up and running for a few months, but we need to keep it running!  All of our organizers are volunteers, and all our expenses are paid for with donations.  We are still a new organization just getting our feet underneath us, and your financial support helps us tremendously!

What We Need 

Our aim is to raise $2,500 to help cover our operating costs for the next year, which includes:

 1. Facility rental: $150 per month

Our number one goal is simply to be able to come together, and to do that we need somewhere to hold our meetings.  We'd like to know that our new venue can be our home for the rest of 2015 and into the future.  You can help us make that happen!


2.  Non-profit (501c3) status for our organization: $450
We are not yet registered as a non-profit, and achieving 5013c status will help us keep our costs down.  


3.  Maintaining an online presence on Meetup.com: $180 per year

Meetup.com is where most people find out about us.  We publicize our meetings, organize our "Smoups" (small groups) like book club and game night, and let people know about local events such as book talks.  


4. Coffee and refreshments: $20 per month

Since we meet on Sunday mornings, coffee is a must!  We also provide cookies and other snacks at each service.

5. Arts & crafts supplies for our Kid's Corner: $10 per month

Some of our attendees have small children, and the activities in our Kid's Corner help keep the little ones happy.  :)


What You Get
As a thank you for donating to our campaign, we've got some perks!

  • By donating $20 or more, you can choose to receive a postcard sized magnet printed with our Sunday Assembly Seattle logo.  We know your fridge will look just a little cooler (pun intended!) with this magnet stuck on it:


  • By donating $50 or more, you can choose to receive the magnet plus a ceramic mug printed with our Sunday Assembly Seattle logo.  Sip the beverage of your choice in style!


  • By donating $100 or more, you can choose to receive the magnet, the ceramic mug, and a deluxe tote bag printed with our Sunday Assembly Seattle logo.  Avoid those 5¢ bag fees by carrying this lovely tote on your next shopping trip. 



The Impact

We at Sunday Assembly Seattle believe it's important for members of our community to come together on a regular basis to "live better, help often, and wonder more" -- as our mission states -- without a deity as the central focus.  By donating to our campaign, you are helping ensure that people in Seattle have a space to gather, learn about the world and the people around us, make new friends, and celebrate the one life we know we have.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate today, you can still help!  

  • Spread the word about our campaign by posting this link on social media or emailing a friend.  We encourage you to use the Indiegogo share tools are at the upper left of this page.
  • Be a part of our growing secular community by attending Sunday Assembly Seattle on the 4th Sunday of each month, or find a location near you. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Our family of 5 has been living in the same rental property for the past 7 years, in fact our 2 youngest daughters (5 & 6 years old) were both born while living here.

For the past 4 years, we have noticed black mould in the wall behind the top floor bathtub.  We contacted the owner of the house and told her that it needed to be fixed so she brought over a handyman who replaced drywall.

A year later, same problem.  After several phone calls, she brought a different handyman and the wall was drywalled over again.  I insisted that she needs to have the repairman look deeper for a cause so that the problem doesn't recur.  She begged poverty and said that was the best she could do.

The mould came back.  

We have been insisting to the owner that the issue needs to be properly resolved for the past 2 and a half years.  She says that she can't afford to get it fixed.

Last September, my husband lost his job of 8 years after suffering a stress-triggered nervous breakdown. 

We started looking for a home to move into once our eldest finished high school (graduated with honours and awards this June!)  and found a lovely place in a small town 2 hours from where we currently live.  It's less expensive on a monthly basis, has a public school immediately across the road, has a great yard for the girls to run and play in, and the small town has lots of potential for us to grow a business and finally thrive.

We are working on getting through all of the stuff in our house; sorting out what needs to be donated, trashed and kept.  It is not easy for me, seeing as I am on permanent disability, suffering from Fibromyalgia and SEID but I do what I can.  My husband has been doing all of the heavy lifting.

This past Tuesday, June 30th my husband suffered a stroke.  After 3 days in the hospital and a large battery of tests he is back home now with strict orders to follow from the doctors including RELAX and DON'T LIFT ANYTHING.

We had planned on doing the move all by ourselves with a UHaul but now that looks like it isn't an option.  The biggest challenge for us right now is to keep my husband's stress level down so that he doesn't have a recurrent or worse issue.

Please help us move our girls out of this house into our new place by helping us to pay professional packers/movers/disposers!

We are awaiting final estimates as this all happened so suddenly however our best guess currently for costs is:


$2500 packing/unpacking

$2500 moving (including insurances)

$1000 disposal and incidentals


Any help will help!!  If we do not reach the total amount of $6000, we will put the amount raised towards helping us get the move done.


Thank you everyone.

story:
Hi!

Raising Money to Start a Company while we are in college!!!

We are starting a flip flop sandal company!  Designs are already in process and we are close to making molds and having samples made.  Any one who donates will receive a buy one get one free lifetime promotion.  The sandals will retail around $14.00.  We are planning on donating a % of profits to help with climate change. 

Our goal is to help fund our college tuition and start our own company.  By graduation we hope to have a thriving company and run it with our employees interests at heart.  We want to create an incredible atmosphere where our people and families come first. Currently attending UCLA and recently admitted to Pepperdine, we have roots in Malibu and Hilo Hawaii.

Our business plan is well thought out  and our product unique.  We are at the forefront of the California Beach Lifestyle and with the help of our friends and family have a strong manufacturing background.

Kings is the name of the mens flip flop line, Queens is the name of the women's, and Keiki will be the name for the children line of sandals.  Not only are our designs unique, they are also based on the art and science of Chinese foot reflexology.  Our sandals look good and feel terrific on your feet!

We are raising the maximum possible and will have friends and family match our crowdfunding.  The goal is to be able to create molds (which are costly) and have our first samples made.  Minimum orders are large and will take approximately 45 days to produce.  We have a sales force in place ready to carry our Flip Flops into retailers.  The retail introductory order size is small, only 60 pair, and at a wholesale price of $7.00 per sandal the order is only $420.00.  This eliminates most barriers to entry. The sandals will retail at $14.99 which is on par or below our competition for similar quality.


Help us with our DREAMS!!!

XOXOXO

Gigi & Melia

story:
What happened?

On 25th April 2015, Nepal and the people living there have suffered from one of the most catastrophic natural disasters in the history of the country. An earthquake of 7.9 magnitudes with an epicenter nearby the capital Kathmandu caused more than 7000 deaths and thousands of injuries. Many historical monuments, buildings, and artworks were destroyed, putting the country in a complete chaos. Several countries from all across the globe have already started sending help to Nepal in order to help it recover from the disaster. As part of that world, we have the responsibility to be active and help Nepal with whatever we can. Together we can make the difference. 

What is the purpose of the funding? 

While the whole country is in need of some financial help, it is safe to say one individual cannot help 27 million people. Therefore, I am starting this campaign to help three families of my acquaintance, that have lost their property. Since they had all of their saving in the house, which was completely damaged by the earthquake, everything they owned was lost. Currently, they do not have anything to go on with their lives. The $3,000 will be shared among three families equally. The money will be used to help them buy products of basic needs and to begin the construction of the house. Also, if this campaign goes well and the money collected will not be enough, I will start a new campaign to support them. 

Why should you help?

In short, because we are all human beings, it is our duty to help those in need. Natural disasters occur all the time and no one can avoid them. They are part of life. This time it happened in Nepal, but in future it will happen in a different country. As part of the world, we need to put apart all of our differences and help however we can in times of need. Many big organizations have offered help to the country; however, a lot of people will not benefit from that help and among those are people I am trying to help. I am asking for your help on a much smaller scale, but I can ensure that I will be more effective.

How will you know about the help you provided?

I will personally update you about what will be done with the money once the fundraising will be completed. When the money arrives, I will be sending everyone pictures of the families that will receive the money and of items they buy. Also, once the house will be reconstructed, a picture of before and after will be sent as well.

If you have any question regarding this fundraising, you can contact me anytime and I will be more than happy to answer you.

My phone number is 415 866 7838 (USA, SAN FRANCISCO)

Email: ashish.neupane91@gmail.com

website: lizedor.jimdo.com

YouTube: youtube.com/lizedor

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lizedor/151544221543649



If you  are a private donor and want to be updated about the various steps, please provide me your email address.
story_txt: What happened? On 25th April 2015, Nepal and the people living there have suffered from one of the most catastrophic natural disasters in the history of the country. An earthquake of 7.9 magnitudes with an epicenter nearby the capital Kathmandu caused more than 7000 deaths and thousands of injuries. Many historical monuments, buildings, and artworks were destroyed, putting the country in a complete chaos. Several countries from all across the globe have already started sending help to Nepal in order to help it recover from the disaster. As part of that world, we have the responsibility to be active and help Nepal with whatever we can. Together we can make the difference. What is the purpose of the funding? While the whole country is in need of some financial help, it is safe to say one individual cannot help 27 million people. Therefore, I am starting this campaign to help three families of my acquaintance, that have lost their property. Since they had all of their saving in the house, which was completely damaged by the earthquake, everything they owned was lost. Currently, they do not have anything to go on with their lives. The $3,000 will be shared among three families equally. The money will be used to help them buy products of basic needs and to begin the construction of the house. Also, if this campaign goes well and the money collected will not be enough, I will start a new campaign to support them. Why should you help?In short, because we are all human beings, it is our duty to help those in need. Natural disasters occur all the time and no one can avoid them. They are part of life. This time it happened in Nepal, but in future it will happen in a different country. As part of the world, we need to put apart all of our differences and help however we can in times of need. Many big organizations have offered help to the country; however, a lot of people will not benefit from that help and among those are people I am trying to help. I am asking for your help on a much smaller scale, but I can ensure that I will be more effective.How will you know about the help you provided?I will personally update you about what will be done with the money once the fundraising will be completed. When the money arrives, I will be sending everyone pictures of the families that will receive the money and of items they buy. Also, once the house will be reconstructed, a picture of before and after will be sent as well.If you have any question regarding this fundraising, you can contact me anytime and I will be more than happy to answer you.My phone number is 415 866 7838 (USA, SAN FRANCISCO)Email: ashish.neupane91@gmail.comwebsite: lizedor.jimdo.comYouTube: youtube.com/lizedorFacebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lizedor/151544221543649If you  are a private donor and want to be updated about the various steps, please provide me your email address.

story:
Introduction

My name is Leland Scales. I am a graduate student majoring in food studies at Chatham University in the school of sustainability. I am also a resident of Swissvale who believes a community garden will increase community engagement/ involvement as well as create opportunities to teach and uplift children in the community. 

Mission

Swissvale Community Garden’s mission is to provide opportunities for community engagement through gardening to help nourish community relationships as well as the residents of Swissvale and surrounding neighborhoods with the growth of fresh produce

Garden Profile

Swissvale Community Garden will be a community-based initiative that will be managed/ operated by volunteers of the community and overseen by Reach Up non-profit organization. Gardeners will grow various flowers, herbs, and vegetables. Of which some will be donated to the local food pantries, some given to volunteers, and the remaining items will be sold at the local farmers market at a nominal price. We also plan to hold gardening workshops for children to teach them that with hard work and determination even the smallest seed can grow into to something larger than life. 

Market Analysis

Swissvale Community Garden’s plan is to serve people of all ages, income ranges, and levels of experience within the Borough of Swissvale. Interest in community gardens continues to increase as people become more adamant about the quality, safety, and accessibility of fresh produce.

The most significant challenges for getting the Swissvale Community Garden started are lack of funds for initial costs for the start-up and gaining access to available vacant land in the community which may take some time. Ultimately, a temporary plot for the purposes of getting the community garden started may be an option until such a time that a permanent space is available.

Use of funds

All moneys received from this will go towards purchasing all of the tools, seeds, soil, raised bed components, irrigation materials, fencing, safe and sustainable pest control and so on. Thank you all for your help and support.

story:
The Grill-Top Indoor BBQ grill

is a simple, safe and portable innovation which promotes

healthier cooking and will change the way you think about grilling!


Best of all, it’s an all year grilling solution!


 

INPEX 2015
GOLD MEDAL WINNER
Inventors International Gold Medal Merit & Excellence Award!


Grill-Top was selected by the ERA review panel at INPEX 2015 and will be showcased at the ERA D2C convention in Las Vegas in October 2015!
Only 37 of 300+ inventors are selected.



Problem with other indoor grills……

    • Do you ever notice that other popular indoors grills really don’t cook the same as an outdoor grill?
    • Is the food missing the smoky flavors of a good outdoor BBQ?

    • Have you used a stove grill pan that creates a smoky mess?

    • That’s because they can’t BBQ food without setting off smoke alarms. Not to mention, they are messy when cooking and are hard to clean.

      Solution……

      The Grill-Top indoor electric BBQ grill is the solution.

      It combines the outdoor smoky grill flavors with indoor safety, convenience and easy clean-up.

      Whether you are.....

      .....Home on a raining day……You can grill !!!

      .....In the snow storm in the middle of winter…..You can grill !!!

      Grill your way on any day!

      Technology
      Similar to outdoor grills, our special “patent pending” technology allows you to properly grill foods at higher temperatures.

      “Cool to the touch”, “heat resistant” hood for safety.


      Smoke Filtering System
       The hood system has a specially designed self-contained smoke filtering system with a removable filter.

      Removable Filter
       Similar to an oven hood, the easy access removable filter allows for easy replacement.


      Healthier Cooking
       Unlike most popular indoor grills, the grease falls directly off the food, through the grill grates, and into a collection tray without touching the grill surface or being absorbed into the food…Just like an outdoor grill.


      The Story
       Founder and inventor, John Donofrio, could not find an indoor grilling solution which was affordable and worked well. “The idea for Grill-Top came from my desire to buy a really good indoor grill.”
      “I wanted an indoor grill that worked just like an outdoor grill without overcooking the food.”
      In the garage, his grill concept was born. He started by making all different types of cardboard cut-outs and designs. He got some materials, drawings and power tools and started creating it. After several different designs, some better than others, he had something that worked. He spent months building different prototypes before coming up with one that worked.


      The Experience
       With John Donofrio’s background in safety and technology, he wanted to make the best possible product by using existing parts. So, he worked with several engineers and came up with what he felt was a great working prototype. He tested it over and over again by making meals for his family. Well, it worked. He finally had the grill he was looking for. Since it worked so well, he decided to share the idea and experience with a few friends.

      The Manufacturing
       So with the help of a local products company, we were able to obtain the materials and parts needed to built it. At the same time we want to offer the best quality product on the market. As we move forward with the final design, we will need to obtain UL Approval to ensure the best possible product. That is where we need your support through contributions to the campaign. If you like the idea and want to be one of first to have this outstanding invention please get involved and support us.

      The Contribution
       The more people that get involved and support our campaign, the faster we will have the product ready for delivery and the faster you will be able to enjoy your own Grill-Top BBQ grill. Please contribute now by pre-ordering your very own Grill-Top BBQ grill. Or, you can choose from a number of other contribution rewards.


      Other Ways you Can Help
       Even if you are unable to contribute, please help us get the word out and make some noise about this amazing new product. Also, please use the Indiegogo share tools which will really help us!


      Campaign, Fulfillment and Delivery
       As we move forward in our campaign we will keep you informed of our process and when the units are ready for delivery. The Grill-Top BBQ grill is truly our favorite kitchen appliance and we are sure you will love it as well.


      The Science
       Why does grilled food taste better?
      Have you ever noticed that a grilled meal gets twice the raves of a non-grilled meal? The reason is that grilled food becomes “caramelized”. That is a big word that means the cooking process concentrates the natural sugars (all food contain sugar naturally) and the high heat browns or “caramelizes” those sugars. It is also know as the “Maillard reaction”

      The Maillard reaction is one of the great miracles of cooking. It is the chemical reaction between amino acids and sugars created by heat responsible for the crust on breads, dark beer, transforming boring beans into coffee and chocolate, and turning the outside of roasted meat into something rich and complex. 99.9% of the time, it is no contest! The grilled food wins the taste test.

      The reason: The grilled food is “caramelized” and the flavor is much more pleasurable and intense.


      Risks & Challenges
       Any new project carries significant risk, but compared to many crowdfunding campaigns our risk profile is extremely low. We have already started assembling our Product Development Grills which is the next step before full production. Additionally, we have many alternative suppliers which will help us with fulfillment and warehousing.

      A successful campaign will allow us to:

      • Offer new features

      • Accelerate new product development

      • Order more inventory

      If you like our grill invention and you wish to support us, please help us minimize the project's risk by selecting a perk that best fits your budget.


      In Conclusion
       Thank you for looking and please help us get this amazing project off the ground.

      Every $1 helps, and telling people really helps too...
      Thank you for taking the time and please feel free to contact us with any questions. 


      Frequently Asked Questions

      Q. How does the Grill-Top BBQ grill work?

      A. Simply start the grill and fan. Wait for the desired temperature and add your meat.

      Q. How much power does it use?

      A. Grill-Top 1100 series and 1400 series both use less than 1500 watts and works with a standard 110v wall outlet.

      Q. How easy is it to clean after grilling?

      A. The grill is really easy to clean. Simply take the removable porcelain coated grill grate and collection tray and wash in the sink. A wire grill brush works the best for the grill grate.

      Q. Can I cook meat to different levels of wellness at the same time?

      A. Yes! Everyone can have their meat just the way they like it. Simply open the grill to remove the food that has reached the desired cooking level, then close the grill to continue cooking the remaining food.

      Q. Can I cook meat that has not been defrosted?

      A. We recommend always defrosting meat before cooking to ensure the proper flavor and temperature.

      Q. Do I need to let the machine pre-heat when grilling a second batch?

      A. No. You simply add more meat to the grill and repeat the cooking process.

      Q. Is the Grill-Top a healthier way to cook meat?

      A. Yes, the Grill-Top grill grates allow the grease to flow off the food through the grill grates and into the collection tray without being absorbed into the food.

      Q. How do I know if the Grill-Top will really work?

      A. We have been working very hard to ensure that we provide the best quality product. We have tested several prototypes and continue to add features and improvements as we get closer to fulfillment. We have been using the product ourselves with family. We fully back our product and are certain that it will work well beyond your expectation.

      Q. I can't wait! When will you ship?

      A. As we get closer to shipping we'll keep supporters updated; currently shipping is slated for Q4 2015. Because it may ship sooner (or take longer), we'll provide schedule updates as we have newer info.

      Q. Do I need to pay taxes on my order?

      A. We are required by law to collect sales tax in states where our business is registered. We are registered in Pennsylvania.

      Q. Will my online payment be secure?

      A. We guarantee that every online transaction you make will be secure. We use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) software, the industry standard, to encrypt all of your personal information. Moreover, we have put in place all of the appropriate physical, electronic and managerial procedures needed to safeguard and help prevent unauthorized access, maintain data security and correctly use the information we collect online.

story:
Thank you for watching our video. Now you understand, we are trying to build a new bridge to our Serenity Island because the other has collapsed. We are very excited to do this together as a team. This is our very first crowd sourcing campaign. All donations are greatly appreciated. We are grateful to be able to offer such a sacred place for peaceful experiences for all who come. 


When the bridge is completed please come for an afternoon to visit the Serenity Island or anytime book a weekend to experience our peaceful grounds, delicious food and our many classes. 


p.s. If you would like to donate please press "Contribute Now".

story:
Short Summary

Dear fellow coffee lovers,

my name is Dietmar Vogelmann, the past 6 years I am living now in Vietnam where I am finally able to follow my passion. COFFEE. I am married to a beautiful Vietnamese women and we have a 2.5 year old little boy. My education is hospitality but my love for coffee, is finally the work i am able to do here. Vietnam is currently the 2nd biggest coffee producer in the world but very little know for its great product. We are here to change this....

Vietnam, a country suffering in the past, is now ready to stand on its own feed. We, foreigner which live here, need to give a helping hand on this (at least every once in a while). In my case, i try to do this in the worlds most consumed beverage, again COFFEE. Vietnam has a great coffee culture, however, due to the lack of education and greedy global players - a lot of coffee consumed by Vietnamese people is "fake" enriched with chemical flavors, coloring and even steroids and soy bean. Farmers Blend Coffee set a mission to bring clean, 100% natural and sustainable coffee to the people here and as a matter of fact, turn around the global image of Vietnamese Coffee.



We need your help to promote and support our idea so that coffee drinkers around the world are able to support Vietnam by enjoying a delicious glass of "ca phe sua da" - Vietnamese Iced Coffee....

What We Need & What You Get

Farmers Blend Coffee was established in November 2014 - we have a full setup of machinery and other equipment. However, we have no more liquidity to raise the bar at the moment. We need 10000 USD more which we like to put in a marketing campaign (we like to produce a movie on Vietnamese Coffee, from crop to cup, how to grow and brew this delicacy etc...incl. living and working conditions of minority people in the highlands etc...) as well as in promotion material, hand outs and the organization of local events such as "Organic Markets" etc. to promote our product and sustainable coffee / products in general in Vietnam. At the moment we are one of the only Coffee Roasters in Vietnam which is certified by the Rainforest Alliance. We source our coffee directly from local farms in the central highlands and have a great network of awesome people growing coffee to support family and make their living in a difficult environment. Big players such as Nes****, Star**** and other control the market and therefore the prices and the wages of local farmers. Obviously this is kept to a minimum.

By supporting & funding our campaign and to get things done we offer a few perks for all people funding our idea.


All funds above 100 USD get a full set of Vietnamese Coffee which includes

2kg of Vietnamese Coffee Blend; 2Kg of Italian Espresso Blend; a traditional Vietnamese Coffee Phin as well a the delicious sweetened condense milk used here to brew a great summer beverage "Ca phe Sua Da"

All funds from 50 to 99 USD will receive:

1 Kg of Vietnamese Coffee incl. traditional Vietnamese Coffee Phin and 1 can of sweetened condense milk.



If we do not reach our goal of 10.000 USD we will use the funds to produce the movie only. To, at least, get the word out and to promote Vietnamese Coffee culture and the long tail of procedures, working- & living conditions on a coffee farm in Central Vietnam and to open peoples mind on how the integrate processes are to produce quality coffee. We hope with a movie like this that we are able to challenge peoples minds and habits on discounted cheap mass-production coffee which makes local people suffer and barley makes an income for local farmers.

The Impact

the impact you will have by funding our campaign will be massive. First you support a young ambitious company trying to change to coffee world and challenges the status quo. 

Second, you support sustainability in the world most traded commodity, you would make a personal impact to local farmers lives and their living conditions.

Third, once the movie is finished, you will be surprised on the outcome and how much work actually goes into a normal cup of coffee which you likely drink every day. Hopefully it will make you re-think your ideology and habits on your coffee consumption.

Risks & Challenges

Vietnam is still a developing county, years of war and suffering - corruption is everywhere. To reach our goal, we will not spend any money on corruption - which, from our experience, can make things a lot more difficult. However, being in Vietnam a long time now, we are very familiar with the official procedures and know how to handle difficult situations.
Another Challenge to overcome is the educational part of Vietnamese People. As I mention before, Vietnamese coffee is often "fake", this being said, Vietnamese are used to this taste and enjoy it. We realize that city people e.g. from Saigon or Hanoi are more open for real coffee as they have a better exposure to it. Countryside population still needs training. However, we also realize that time is on our side, we had the opportunity with many Vietnamese already to change them into real coffee drinkers. We always take one step at a time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support our idea financial, no problem, we appreciate any kind of support. Spread the word on you FB page, invite people to like Farmers Blend Coffee Fan Page, keep your community updated. You can still make a difference. As more people will follow and support this way, as more likely it will be to get things moving in the right direction. WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT.....

By supporting & funding our campaign and to get things done we offer a few perks for all people funding our idea.



All funds above 100 USD get a full set of Vietnamese Coffee which includes
2kg of Vietnamese Coffee Blend; 2Kg of Italian Espresso Blend; a traditional Vietnamese Coffee Phin as well a the delicious sweetened condense milk used here to brew a great summer beverage "Ca phe Sua Da"
All funds from 50 to 99 USD will receive:
1 Kg of Vietnamese Coffee incl. traditional Vietnamese Coffee Phin and 1 can of sweetened condense milk.



If we do not reach our goal of 10.000 USD we will use the funds to produce the movie only. To, at least, get the word out and to promote Vietnamese Coffee culture and the long tail of procedures, working- & living conditions on a coffee farm in Central Vietnam and to open peoples mind on how the integrate processes are to produce quality coffee. We hope with a movie like this that we are able to challenge peoples minds and habits on discounted cheap mass-production coffee which makes local people suffer and barley makes an income for local farmers.
  The Impact
the impact you will have by funding our campaign will be massive. First you support a young ambitious company trying to change to coffee world and challenges the status quo. 
Second, you support sustainability in the world most traded commodity, you would make a personal impact to local farmers lives and their living conditions.
Third, once the movie is finished, you will be surprised on the outcome and how much work actually goes into a normal cup of coffee which you likely drink every day. Hopefully it will make you re-think your ideology and habits on your coffee consumption.
  Risks & ChallengesVietnam is still a developing county, years of war and suffering - corruption is everywhere. To reach our goal, we will not spend any money on corruption - which, from our experience, can make things a lot more difficult. However, being in Vietnam a long time now, we are very familiar with the official procedures and know how to handle difficult situations. Another Challenge to overcome is the educational part of Vietnamese People. As I mention before, Vietnamese coffee is often "fake", this being said, Vietnamese are used to this taste and enjoy it. We realize that city people e.g. from Saigon or Hanoi are more open for real coffee as they have a better exposure to it. Countryside population still needs training. However, we also realize that time is on our side, we had the opportunity with many Vietnamese already to change them into real coffee drinkers. We always take one step at a time.
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't support our idea financial, no problem, we appreciate any kind of support. Spread the word on you FB page, invite people to like Farmers Blend Coffee Fan Page, keep your community updated. You can still make a difference. As more people will follow and support this way, as more likely it will be to get things moving in the right direction. WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT.....

story:
"Jag vill nu starta mitt livs viktigaste fight. Fighten mot utanförskap. Open house är att förverkliga en gammal dröm om att hjälpa ungdomar, hjälp oss genom att donera här till höger"
(For English, scroll down)

Armand Krajnc

•Världsmästare i Boxning
•Svart bälte i karate
•Mästarnas mästare SVT

Armand Krajncs vision

Armand Krajnc är inte enbart världsmästare i boxning, Mästarnas mästare i SVT 2010, utan har även under alla år jobbat med ungdomar och utanförskap. Armand når ungdomar och är en bra förebild.
Hans vision är ett ”Fryshus” i Ystad där alla ungdomar i åldern 13-99 är välkomna. En öppen verksamhet med bra vuxna förebilder som ger av sin tid och där ungdomarna ges möjlighet till en aktiv och meningsfylld fritid.
Med löfte om samverkan och mentorskap från Ungdomens Hus ser vi stora möjligheter att vara ett komplement till Ungdomens hus då vi inriktar oss på en något äldre åldersgrupp.
Huset kan fyllas med aktiviteter som boxning, klättervägg, motionsträning för seniorer, kids, dans och musik!


Lägg till boule för seniorer, cafe, biljard, dart, bordtennis och schack för ungdomar. Men samtidigt ska det vara ett ställe där man också bara kan ”vara” utan krav på fasta tider att hålla, eller krav på att prestera inom idrott eller annat. Ett ställe där det finns möjlighet till vuxenkontakt och det även ges möjlighet att knyta kontakter med jämngamla.
På sin väg genom idrotten har Armand stött på alla sorters ungdomar från alla samhällsskikt och funnit att de alla behöver samma stöd oavsett bakgrund, nämligen närvarande vuxna rollfigurer.


Samhällsnytta

Samhället håller på att dräneras på mänskliga resurser och med enorma samhällskostnader som följd. Forskning visar att statistiskt så passar 12% av varje åldersgrupp inte in i vårt samhälle. För Ystad, Simrishamn och Tomelilla innebär det att 71 unga människor går förlorade varje år till en samhällskostnad på närmare en miljard per år. www.Utanforskapetspris.se
Samhällsekonomiskt räcker det med att man lyckas stötta en av dessa 71 ungdomar så har samhället sparar mer än vad det kostar att driva Open House Österlen under ett år.


Vi är på god väg!

Med kommunerna, sponsorer och stödmedlemmar är vi på god väg, men vi ser gärna att antalet stödmedlemmar ökar. Genom att få in kapital kan vi snabbare få igång verksamheten och vidareutveckla dess aktiviteter samt säkerställa framtida verksamhet. 


Hjälp oss, för det här handlar om oss. 

Genom att donera, blir du en del av vår verksamhet och hjälper våra ungdomar. Dessutom kommer vi erbjuda er en rad olika belöningar, baserat på ert engagemang! Klicka på valfri donationsnivå eller på contribute knappen. Kolla in belöningarna under perks, till höger på sidan. 


Andra sätt att hjälpa oss

  • Hjälp oss sprida kampanjen via social media
  • Dela kampanjen genom indiegogos delningsverktyg.
  • Prata med vänner och bekanta, förklara vilken nytta vi kan göra tillsammans.

English:


"Now I want to start my life's most important fight. The fight against exclusion. Open House is to realize an old dream of helping young people, help us by donating to the right"

Armand Krajnc

• World Champion in Boxing

• Black belt in karate

• Masters champion SVT

Armand Krajncs Vision

Armand Krajnc is not only a world champion in boxing, Masters champion in SVT in 2010, but also during all the years working with young people and their exclusion from society. Armand reaches young people and is a good role model.

His vision is of a ”Youth house" in Ystad where all young people aged 13-99 are welcome. An open facility with good adult role models who give of their time and where young people are given the opportunity for an active and meaningful leisure.

The house can be filled with activities like boxing, climbing wall, fitness training for seniors, kids, dance and music!

Add boules for seniors, cafe, billiards, darts, table tennis and chess for youngsters. But at the same time it should be a place where you also can just "be" without the need for fixed times to keep, or the requirement to perform in sports or other. A place where there is opportunity for adult contact, and also given the opportunity to network with their peers.

On through out his career Armand has encountered all sorts of young people and found that they all need the same support regardless of background, namely the present adult characters.

Impact on society

The community is being drained of human resources and the enormous social costs. Research shows that statistically its 12% of each age group that is excluded from our society. For Ystad, Simrishamn and Tomelilla it means that 71 young people are lost each year to a cost to society of nearly one billion per year. www.Utanforskapetspris.se

Economically, it is enough to manage to support one of these 71 young people so that society saves more than it costs to run the Open House Österlen in a year.

We are well on the way!

With municipalities, sponsors and supporting members, we are well on our way, but we prefer that the number of support members increases. By getting the capital, we can quickly get up and running and further develop its activities and ensure future growth.

Help us, this is about us.

By donating, you become a part of our network and help our young people. In addition, we offer you a wide range of rewards, based on your dedication! Click on any donation level or at the Contribute button. Check out the rewards for perks, right of the page.

Other ways to help us

Help us spread the campaign via social media

Share campaign indiegogos sharing tools.

Talk to friends and acquaintances, explain what benefit we can do together.

story:
[For the Activist/Risk-free Fixed Funding edition of this campaign, visit the following url: http://bit.ly/1KXMbtO ... but if you really want some funds to reach Aboriginal causes in Australia, no matter what, this is the place!]

Let's buy a heap of land, and give it back to Indigenous mobs

Here's an idea. Pretty soon an set of enormous tracts of private land are coming up for sale in Australia. The largest private, non-monarchical, non-state landholding on earth is up for sale. At the moment the properties are cattle farms. Let's buy them, and give them back to the Aboriginal people of Australia. 
Read about the land here: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3129235/The-largest-private-land-holding-earth-three-quarters-size-ENGLAND-150-people-live-sale-family-Sir-Sidney-Kidman-penniless-runaway-Australia-s-greatest-pastoralist.html 
My name's Hugo, and I'm originally from the UK. I've been living in Melbourne for 8 of the happiest years of my life. I love Australia with a passion, and every day I thank my lucky stars that I get to live here. 
One thing I wish were different here is a better deal all round for Aboriginal people. And I really believe things are going to get better in the future with a concerted effort from everyone in the country, and overseas. There have been great strides in Native Title and all sorts of fantastic programmes across the country, but the situation for many Aboriginal people, and many of their cultures, is quite dire, so I think it would be great to do even more, and quickly. 
That's why I think the 23,000km² of cattle farms that is coming up for sale should be bought and given back to the Aboriginal people of the areas where the land is located. And given back completely free of charge. Handed over, in every respect, title and deed, to the descendants of the people who so carefully tended to and lived in harmony with this land for so many millennia until the arrival of my ancestors a couple of hundred years ago.
The properties are all being sold together and the asking price is $325,000,000. So, here's the idea: everyone in the world, chip in a few bucks, and let's be the winning bidders at the auction (I've set the campaign at 340mill so that we can elevate the bid if necessary, and afford to pay for perks and Indiegogo fees). Then, when we buy the properties, we give them back to the indigenous folk of the area where they're located, and they look after them forever after.
What We Need & What You Get

It's pretty simple, guys: we need over $325,000,000 (let's say 340 to be safe), to buy this massive amount of land. When we've got it, we'll smash down the winning bid at the property auction and then hand over the land to the relevant aboriginal elders. 

We'll sort out some rad rewards for donors, like souvenir t-shirts and stickers. But mainly the reward for donors is to know that your dollars went some way towards altering the course of history. That after 200 years of colonisation, the whole world got together and chipped in to buy a heap of beautiful Australian land, and give it to Aboriginal folk.

We can keep it out of the hands of mining companies, and give the Indigenous mobs the chance to take care of massive stretches of the continent again. 

If we don't reach full amount, that's all good, we'll put the money towards Aboriginal health and education services nationwide. And if there's enough money, we'll buy any amount of land we can, somewhere in the country and give that back to the rightful owners

The Impact

Who knows where this campaign will go. We've all seen massive crowdfunding successes for Cat-based card games, and potato salad making. And recently a guy from London caused some great ruckus by crowdfunding to bypass the political/banking system and bail out Greece in their time of need. We've seen headlines generated through this means. So, if this campaign serves to raise awareness that Aboriginal people in Australia deserve a better deal, then that will be a great result. And, who knows, maybe there are enough 3.4 million people in the world with $100 to spare to actually make this happen for real.

Risks & Challenges

There's heaps of challenges with this, of course, and as comments come in, I'll add to them and try to address them.

Chief among them may be:

1. How will the 'rightful' owners of each tract of land be found and decided upon? That's a big one. It will involve a heap of research and is a huge challenge. But if it leads to a greater understanding of the existence of the myriad nations that we collectively lump together as 'Aboriginal Australians', that too will be a win.

2. What happens if you don't get enough money, or don't get the winning bid? Oh, ye of little faith! Well, that's all good. Any and all funds, apart from Indiegogo fees and reward costs, will go to Aboriginal Health and Education services. And on the off-chance there's enough to buy some land, somewhere in the country, we'll buy it, and hand it over to the relevant Aboriginal elders.

3. How can we trust you with our money? That's a good one too. I pledge to be completely transparent in all dealings with whatever amount of money is raised. Of course, you don't really know me, so any promises I make will ring hollow. In full awareness of that, I'd like to state that helping out the Indigenous people of Australia in some way like this is one of my greatest dreams, and would be fulfilment of an ambition I've held ever since arriving in this great country, and learning something about the situation here. To be able to carry it out would be a much greater reward than any financial one.

More to be added as they come in. Critiques and questions are welcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! As I said above, a huge part of this is in raising awareness of the needs of Indigenous folk in Australia. A lot of people feel threatened about this kind of discourse, as if giving a fair deal to Aboriginal people would somehow detract from their own standard of living. I couldn't disagree more firmly with that, but it's a debate for another time, because in the case of this particular land, it's for sale: the current owners want to move on, so no one would be affected by giving it back to the original owners. So, let's buy it, and give it back to the Indigenous mobs.

story:
Have you ever experienced something that totally changed your life?
We have.

In 2010 we had our first volunteering experience in a poor Country.
In Tanzania we met Berit, born in Norway, living in the USA and now adopted by this small village in the rural Africa, Ilula, 280 miles west of Dar es Salaam, far from everything.
The Ilula Orphan Program (IOP) founded by Berit was much more than what we could expect to find: local committed people working hard to improve themselves, looking for strategies to better their own life - with the necessary help from abroad, yes - but strongly determinate to find their own way to escape poverty, to empower the community and to be the key players of this incredible story!

Back in Italy nothing could be the same as before: we had to do something, we firmly wanted to be part of that wonderful story.

Why water.
Very often people ask "What do they need most?"
We usually reply with a provocation..."you mean, apart from money?"
But in fact there is something that we really couldn't realize before, and that now, instead, is very clear to us: "water is life" is true, and it's not only for the life of your body but for your life as a whole.
Health depends on water, school depends on water, income depends on water...
Too many people still don't know that thousands of children every day DIE because of water-related diseases, much more than malaria, TBC, HIV or whatever.
Too many people still don't know that so many children don't go to school because they have to fetch water, every day.
Too many people still don't know that women in poor countries spend an average of 4 hours a day to fetch water, walking miles and miles, and cannot use that time to produce food for their families.

Access to safe water, that is what they need.


Listening ...
Last August we went to visit some sponsored students at Ikuvala Primary School.
There we met George, teacher and IOP Sponsor Program coordinator, who told us about the critical situation of water in the school, as there are no sources of clean water nearby.
Every day 1.600 children come to school carrying a small tank with at least 2 liters of water, mostly collected in the rainy river  (in the dry season by digging in the riverbed).
The school is equipped with latrines: next to them there are two large cement tanks where kids pour the water: there they will wash their hands after using the toilets and, if they are thirsty, that will be the only water they can drink.

...and then acting!

Be part of the project: we need you!

Together, we will build a rainwater harvesting system at Ikuvala.
They have big buildings and big roofs: our idea is to build something they are used to, something they can easily manage and maintain. We will:
- replace the rusty parts of the roof
- reinforce a wall that cannot support the weight of the gutters with water
- gutter 170 meters
- build a 50.000 liters tank

Parents and teachers will be part of a water committee to maintain, administer and take general care of the system and - most important - children will be involved in a deep training about the importance of water and good hygiene practices.

The total cost is about 22.000 USD.
The community will contribute with non-skilled labor for a total amount of 2.000 USD: we can add the difference!

When the system is ready - hopefully within December - we will have
a big party: the Hand Washing Day will  be the first step
toward a healthy better life!

where there is nothing today...

you will see smiles very soon!
story_txt:
Have you ever experienced something that totally changed your life?We have.In 2010 we had our first volunteering experience in a poor Country.In Tanzania we met Berit, born in Norway, living in the USA and now adopted by this small village in the rural Africa, Ilula, 280 miles west of Dar es Salaam, far from everything.The Ilula Orphan Program (IOP) founded by Berit was much more than what we could expect to find: local committed people working hard to improve themselves, looking for strategies to better their own life - with the necessary help from abroad, yes - but strongly determinate to find their own way to escape poverty, to empower the community and to be the key players of this incredible story!
Back in Italy nothing could be the same as before: we had to do something, we firmly wanted to be part of that wonderful story.Why water. Very often people ask "What do they need most?" We usually reply with a provocation..."you mean, apart from money?"But in fact there is something that we really couldn't realize before, and that now, instead, is very clear to us: "water is life" is true, and it's not only for the life of your body but for your life as a whole. Health depends on water, school depends on water, income depends on water...Too many people still don't know that thousands of children every day DIE because of water-related diseases, much more than malaria, TBC, HIV or whatever.Too many people still don't know that so many children don't go to school because they have to fetch water, every day.Too many people still don't know that women in poor countries spend an average of 4 hours a day to fetch water, walking miles and miles, and cannot use that time to produce food for their families.Access to safe water, that is what they need.
Listening ...Last August we went to visit some sponsored students at Ikuvala Primary School. There we met George, teacher and IOP Sponsor Program coordinator, who told us about the critical situation of water in the school, as there are no sources of clean water nearby. Every day 1.600 children come to school carrying a small tank with at least 2 liters of water, mostly collected in the rainy river  (in the dry season by digging in the riverbed). The school is equipped with latrines: next to them there are two large cement tanks where kids pour the water: there they will wash their hands after using the toilets and, if they are thirsty, that will be the only water they can drink.
...and then acting!
Be part of the project: we need you!
Together, we will build a rainwater harvesting system at Ikuvala.They have big buildings and big roofs: our idea is to build something they are used to, something they can easily manage and maintain. We will:- replace the rusty parts of the roof- reinforce a wall that cannot support the weight of the gutters with water- gutter 170 meters - build a 50.000 liters tank
Parents and teachers will be part of a water committee to maintain, administer and take general care of the system and - most important - children will be involved in a deep training about the importance of water and good hygiene practices.
The total cost is about 22.000 USD.The community will contribute with non-skilled labor for a total amount of 2.000 USD: we can add the difference!
When the system is ready - hopefully within December - we will have a big party: the Hand Washing Day will  be the first step toward a healthy better life!

where there is nothing today...


you will see smiles very soon!

story:
Alsalamalikum wa’rahmat Allah ta’ala wa barakatu.
May God’s Peace and Blessings be with you.

Dear family, friends, social media friends and good citizens of the world,

This Ramadan, a Muslim community in need is requesting your help to build a Masjid (Mosque). The facility will serve as a place of worship, a Madrasa for children and adults as well as a nursery school for young children to learn secular subjects such as mathematics, sciences, languages, fiqh and Quran.

Kch. Village is located in the northeast region of Tanga, Tanzania. Even though Islam predominates and is widely practiced in the region, I was surprised to discover only one small Masjid that serves the entire Muslim population. Current Masjid consists of two separate rooms (side for men and side for women). There is a washing station outside for wudu, however no toilets. During congregational prayers most people end up praying outside on dirt ground, as space is very small. This community comprises six sub-villages and a growing population of 16,000 inhabitants.

Many of you already know that I have been living and working in this community for over a year. For those who are not familiar, I am a Peace Corps community-based health worker in Tanzania. A 27months commitment to this community. Aside from integrating into my community through language, culture and traditions, I also collaborate closely with community members, local and national government to prioritize, improve and promote primary health care, HIV prevention and healthy behavior among community members, out of school youth, students, teachers, service providers and community groups as well as help community find resources to address their needs.

Being the first Muslim American Peace Corps Volunteer in this community, I was saddened by the state of Muslims here. While people are genuine, kind and grateful for the small offerings, I knew that we as privileged Muslims need to do more for our struggling brothers and sisters in developing nations.

The masjid is the heart of any Muslim community. Providing much more than a place of worship. This masjid will offer education and a base from which essential community services are delivered. Building a Masjid will increase education for young Muslim children in a developing country; encourage young men and women to become involved. Foster brotherhood/sisterhood, promote daw’ah, increase collaboration between the various Muslim communities and aim to improve the living conditions of Muslims in rural Tanzania. 

You know how wonderful it is to be able to go to the mosque regularly, and this Ramadan you can help give your brothers and sisters in Tanzania the same experience.

The first and foremost duty performed by the Messenger of Allah SallAllahu 'alayhi wasallamupon entering Madinah was to build a Masjid. He said, 'Whosoever builds a house (masjid) for the pleasure of Allah, whether it be small or large, Allah builds for him a house in Paradise.'- At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Khuzaymah, Ibn Hibban. We all have a responsibility to our people, to all people and humanity. 

Community members are requesting $21,000 to construct the following:

  • Masjid, a place for worship and congregational prayers
  • Madrasa, an Islamic school to teach Quran, fiqh, and Islamic studies 
  • Nursery school, a day school for young children to learn secular subjects such as mathematics, sciences, etc.

The needs are so great in this community and as privileged Muslims (alhmedulilah) we can do so much more to help. Earn continuous deeds (sadaqa jariya) as duas and prayers made at this masjid will be attributed to all supports. If you are unable to support financially, please help by spreading the word through your networks and asking everyone you love to donate. No amount is too small and the community will be truly grateful. You can even donate multiple times if you would like!

I want to challenge all of us to raise $21,000 in 30 days ‘God willing.’

Keep in mind, as a United States Peace Corps Volunteer, I am absolutely unable to receive any donations (so please, don’t send funds to me directly). This platform was created to link community leaders/members with you all directly. The community has established a committee that will oversea the construction process (with my support, of course).

Thank you all for your support. Ramadan Kareem!
