story:
Summary

We seek your support to run a one-year focused intervention for people who stammer (PWS) in India of all ages to strengthen self-help groups, create & distribute self-help resources, organize workshops/conferences and enrich current therapeutic practices. 


If you live in India: 

If you have an Indian bank account, please support the campaign here: https://milaap.org/campaigns/stammer - as funds in rupees can go directly to our Indian registered Section 25 non-profit bank account. If you live outside India, please support the campaign on Indiegogo! 


Who? 
The Indian Stammering Association   

The Indian Stammering Association or TISA is an empowered self-help movement for and by people who stammer.  If you are a person who stammers in India, you are already a member of TISA. It is completely volunteer run.  

TISA was founded by Dr. Sachin, a community health consultant, working in the Indian voluntary sector since 1993. Learn more about him on Stutter Talk. TISA's core-group members are Jai Prakash Sunda, Harish Usgaonker, Virendra Shirse, Amitsingh Kushwah, Vishal Gupta and Dhruv Gupta. TISA's leaders are the self-help group coordinators listed here. 

Started in 2008, TISA's purpose is to collect and disseminate relevant, correct and unbiased information for people who stammer and their families, friends and society in general. It promotes a self help group movement, where PWS learn to help each other and themselves in the ancient Indian spirit: “This Self is to be achieved through self effort!” 

TISA has held 4 National Conferences, over 30 communication workshops, and has many self-help groups around the country that meet at least once a week for 2-3 hours. It has a widely accessed blog, private Facebook group that has grown from 200 to almost 2000 members in just a year, and many whatsapp groups.

Speak: Stammering Foundation     

Speak: Stammering Foundation aims to connect and strengthen the stammering eco-system in South Asia through interventions (like this one on Indiegogo). The foundation envisions a society where stammering is understood and stammerers feel and are empowered to boldly choose their dream life. The foundation is an Indian-registered Section 25 non-profit organization (like 501(c)(3) in the U.S.) and is an Unltd Investee. It was founded by Dhruv Gupta. Learn more about him on Stutter Talk. 

Started in 2014, Speak: Stammering Foundation has collaborated with TISA on the FRIENDS Mumbai Convention and two SLP workshops.

 

What? 

What is stammering?

Stammering (or stuttering) is apparent in about 1% of all people, in India that is more than 12.5 million,  1.25 crore, Indians. Among children, under 14 years, the proportion is higher: ~  5%. It is a developmental disorder and therefore, as children grow up, some children (more girls) recover on their own and the sex ratio changes from 1:1 among children, to 1 women to 4 men, among adults. While not fatal per se, it affects all major dimensions of life: education, professional training, relationships, employment & promotion, and contribution to society. Finally, it leads to “loss of self” - a deep existential suffering, spanning large part of life of many stammerers: Who am I? A stammerer or a normal person? 

Poorly understood and rarely discussed, this particular suffering has often led to mocking, discrimination and media distortions.


When?

A one-year focused intervention starting August 2015 to August 2016. 


Where?

India

While Europe and North America have had many initiatives to support people who stutter, in India this movement has been sluggish, largely due to lack of awareness (that something can be done) and lack of resources. 

Many western countries cover stammering under some disability act but not in India. For example, the U.S.A. has a American Disability Act, which covers any discrimination based on stuttering. 

How?

Goal

A society which understands stammering and related issues and accommodates needs of adults who stammer and children/teens who stammer with sensitivity and equity; 

AND

a community of people who stammer (both women and men) who are capable of helping themselves and are empowered to work towards creation of such a society.

Objectives
Four objectives for this one-year intervention, Aug 2015-Aug 2016:

1. Self-Help Groups
To initiate and strengthen self-help groups in India.

2. Resources: creation and distribution
To create and distribute free (or at cost) resources - one-pagers, books, and videos - for self-help groups, children, parents, teachers and SLPs.

3. Social Events
To create and sustain enabling social spaces and structures for young girls/women and boys/men who stammer, and their families.

4. Speech-language pathologists (SLPs)
To influence and enrich current therapeutic practices in public hospitals. 

Activities -> Impact
All activities (indicators, method of verification and impact) will be verified by a third-party - UnLtd India, an incubator for social entrepreneurs. Printing quotes are based on 170 GSM paper from Print Stop, identified as a competitive printing supplier - recycled paper will always be preferred. 

1. Self-Help Groups
To initiate and strengthen self-help groups in India.


2. Resources: creation and distribution

To create and distribute free (or at cost) resources - manuals, books, and videos - for self-help groups, children, parents, teachers and SLPs.

Links: Apna Haat Jagannath, Izabella, Seven Stories


3. Social Events 

To create and sustain enabling social spaces and structures for young girls/women and boys/men who stammer, and their families.


4. Speech-language pathologists (SLPs)

To influence and enrich current therapeutic practices in public hospitals. 



5. Support Roles

To support the above activities; Human Resource, Filming/Editing and Legal.

Total


Links: UnLtd India


Track Record

Online: Facebook Page/Group, Blog 

SHGs: Blog Entries from SHGs, List of Self-Help Groups around the country

Communication Workshop: Blog entries from Communication Workshops


National Conference/Get Togethers:

1st National Conference/Get Together of TISA at Bhubaneswar, Orissa in 2011



2nd National Conference/Get Together of TISA at Coorg, Banaglore in 2012

 

3rd National Conference/Get Together of TISA at New Delhi in 2013


4th National Conference/Get Together of TISA at Khandala (near Pune) in 2014


FRIENDS: Convention for Children/Teens who Stammer, Families, SLPs:

Mumbai, May 23-24: Photos on Facebook, Blog Post 1, Blog Post 2 


Media

Women who pause by Times of India

A helping hand to beat speech fright by Times of India

Get Vocal about stammering by Mid-Day 

Self help group for those who stammer by Deccan Herald

No more pauses by The Indian Express

Stammering a genetic disorder: Expert by Times of India

Self-help group for speech problem by The Telegraph 

Streaming Syllables by Outlook India

Golmaal 3 sued! by Hindustan Times

At no loss for words by The Hindu

Stuck in a Stutter? by Live Mint

Podcast of Indian people who stammer on Stammerfreely

Podcasts on Stutter Talk



Perks

Apna Haat Jaganaath - self-help manual for adults who stammer


Izabella - first story book in Hindi for children who stammer


Stammer Freely T-Shirt - each time you wear this Tee, be inspired by the stammering self-help movement and have a story to share.

Front: "Keep Calm and Stammer Freely"


Back: TISA Logo with Transfluencer

Mumbai SHG strutting their Stammer Freely Tees


Blessings from:

In alphabetical order


          

FRIENDS: The National Association of Young People Who Stutter


 

Hello I Stutter


International Stuttering Association


Samagra



        

SAY: The Stuttering Association for the Young


   

Somaiya Vidyavihar    Somaiya Trust  


 

The Stuttering Foundation


UnLtd India, Speak: Stammering Foundation on UnLtd


Questions/Suggestions?

Feel free to post a comment with any questions/suggestions.

story:
Check out the trash in streets of LA in the video I have uploaded!! This is why on Monday I start Keep Clean Squad on my own since the city did not respond!! ​The streets of Central LA are in big need of our help. There is an excess of trash in our streets and over-flowing trash bins. It is a health issue to children, adults and our pets. Our goal is to provide a healthy, clean and safe environment to the community with our efforts in community clean up. We also want to raise awareness to the general public in doing the right thing, which is throwing trash only in trash bins.

Yesterday I tried contacting Curren D. Price Jr. and his secretary sent me to the cities Field Deputy Mike Castillo. His secretary sent me to his email, which I sent him a detailed message about my concerns, my project and the assistance I needed from the city. Then I called Mark Ridley's office and his secretary sent me to the Mayor Eric Garcetti. His secretary finally sent me to his direct line but I got a voicemail. I left him a detailed message about my community health concern in the excess of trash in the streets and overflowing bins and how I'm starting this project to begin cleaning. I still haven't received a response. Then I contacted the Green & Clean Corp Program because I really need the support to be provided with supplies to clean, a truck to load the trash and for the truck to take the waste to the correct location to dispose. Since I was NOT able to reach anyone not even to advise me where to dump the trash: I will buy the supplies myself out of pocket and with the help I can get from YOU! I will use my own vehicle to load as much trash as I can and if I really have no options in disposing of the waste in the correct location I will bring all the trash I collect to my home and wait till Friday for my garbage disposal to come pick it up!! I am determine to begin Keep Clean Squad this Monday June 8th at 11am. We are meeting on the corner of Central & Washington!! I need volunteers to come out and help clean and donors to help me buy the supplies (transportation for trash to dumpster, trash bags, gloves, picker uppers, hand sanitizer...etc) to clean and at least waters for my volunteers. I want to clean 1-2hrs each time we come out to begin with. I want Keep Clean Squad to come out at least twice a month to the streets of LA and be of service! Let's do this!! Let's help keep our communities clean and safe for our children, adults and pets. Let's also build awareness for the community to make a conscientious decision into disposing of their trash only into waste bins and not into our streets. Because we ALL matter!! 562-688-7195 LALA <3

I will use my own vehicle to load as much trash as I can and if I really have no options in disposing of the waste in the correct location I will bring all the trash I collect to my home and wait till Friday for my garbage disposal to come pick it up!! I am determine to begin Keep Clean Squad this Monday June 8th at 11am. We are meeting on the corner of Central & Washington!! I need volunteers to come out and help clean and donors to help me buy the supplies (transportation for trash to dumpster, trash bags, gloves, picker uppers, hand sanitizer...etc) to clean and at least waters for my volunteers. I want to clean 1-2hrs each time we come out to begin with. I want Keep Clean Squad to come out at least twice a month to the streets of LA and be of service! Let's do this!! Let's help keep our communities clean and safe for our children, adults and pets. Let's also build awareness for the community to make a conscientious decision into disposing of their trash only into waste bins and not into our streets. Because we ALL matter!! 562-688-7195 LALA <3

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Joseph Salamanca and I've been working in the restaurant industry since I was 16. I'm also going to California State University at San Marcos studying to get my B.S. in Global Business Management with a track in Entrepreneurship.

The campaign you will be helping is going towards my new Mystery Shopping company that will serve those in the Cannabis industry. This is important to me because the problem is the industry is more focused on the products and less focused on the consumer. In restaurants you can have great food and an inviting atmosphere. However, without exceptional customer service how can a restaurant ultimately succeed?

Your contribution is your voice, join the Cannabis movement and  Mystery Patient's mission to set a standard for Patient Service in the Medical Marijuana industry here in California and soon the Nation.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will go towards the following:

  • Your perks for you to show off! 
  • Trial Mystery Shops with Potential Clients--We will be traveling all over Southern California and we are not requiring Clients to reimburse our Mystery Patients. Product will be collected and then donated to patients in need.
  • Advertising--We will be running ads in local Cannabis magazines.
  • Marketing--Clothing, Hats, and other accessories will be purchased for our representatives to wear. They will post onto social media sites, attend local festivals and other events. More marketing material will also be purchased, banners, brochures, business cards, brand development.

Your perks!

  1. Mystery Patient Slap Sticker to put on anything anywhere!
  2. Mystery Patient T-Shirt to wear anywhere anytime!
  3. Mystey Patient Hat to wear for all the hat wearers! Wear it forwards, or wear it backwards! Mystery Patient is going to be in front, so let people behind you see that!
  4. Some of the packages even land your name or your business's name on our www.MysteryPatientLLC.com website!

The funds will be allocated accordingly if our goal is not reached!

The Impact

The Mystery Patient concept was conceived earlier this year. We were established the week of 4/20/15. One of the biggest misconception is that Mystery Patient is merely another review service. That we are not. We do not present subjective information, rather we present objective, quantifiable, and unbiased information for internal users to use so that they may take necessary actions to strive for the highest quality service possible.

In California, the real winner is the patient. It may be my business, but the patient receives the ultimate benefit. Your contribution is helping achieve this benefit for the patient. Customer Service is still important in any business. We cannot ignore the fact that the Cannabis industry is blooming into what it truly deserves to be. And the industry has yet to see a business not focused on the product.

I've met many people in my life who are finding great relief in Medical Marijuana. These people are going into dispensaries and calling delivery services not knowing what to expect. One may know what usually goes down, but there is no universal standard. I want nothing more than for patients all over California to know a they will have a great experience whenever picking up medicine.

Soon once California has been covered we will begin to move into neighboring states with Medical Marijuana laws. There are plans to move into states like Colorado and Washington. But hey, Rome wasn't built...

Risks & Challenges

Since we have been established one of my biggest challenge is getting people to believe in what I believe in. Many are quick to believe that I'm a private investigator going in with a mic under my shirt and a camera on my glasses. I'm not a spy. I don't think any of the staff is stealing. While a collective has the option of a Mystery Patient returning an item to experience a "Return." We are not there as private investigators. We are there to assess the experience so that owners may evaluate performance. For example, if a patient expects to receive 7 grams of flower and goes home and what was received was 8 grams. The report does not state "great experience, I was given more than I was supposed to. Our report states 7 grams of flower was acquired, 8 grams was what it had weighed out too. Mystery Patient is gathering information, not pointing a finger and wagging it.

I've worked in the restaurant industry for many years and I have built a genuine passion for providing customer service. When there was an upset guest I did whatever it took to make sure the guest left happy. I'm not going to give up on the patient. Just because the response so far is mixed, does not mean this challenge will not be overcome. Mystery Patient is new, and just like Cannabis itself, it will take time to grow.

My plan to solve this challenge is to never stop believing in the mission that I personally created. I will see this company all the way to the top. If and when California and the rest of the Nation begin to move towards legalization, Mystery Patient will be ready to launch as the #1 Mystery Shopping Company for the Cannabis Industry. Join me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word! Tell people about the new service that will disrupt the entire industry! Check us out on Instagram and Facebook. Use the #MysteryPatient . And use the Indiegogo Share tools! However you help, please know one thing.

That I'm very grateful for your support in my endeavors and for joining the movement to set a standard for Patient Service in the Cannabis Industry.

story: Desde que comenzamos nuestra carrera nos convertimos en portavoces de la juventud. Hoy, teniendo presente que muchos de esos jóvenes que nos siguen atienden nuestras peticiones, les solicitamos que se unan a nuestro esfuerzo por ayudar a las personas con Síndrome Down. Sus sueños y deseos de triunfar son tan válidos como los nuestros. Ayúdanos a poner nuestro granito de arena para que estas personas sigan contando con un lugar en donde se trabaja para que ellos logren una integración efectiva y productiva a las estructuras educativas, sociales y económicas del país. Cualquier aportación es bienvenida. Muchas bendiciones a todos.

story:
Hello, we are John and Southparkfan and we are raising money to fund a new venture. Collectively, we have around 5 years of experience in the industry. We've worked on several open source projects together and separately from a small wiki farm a few months ago (as volunteer staff) to volunteering with operation tasks with large teams like the Wikimedia Foundation. Over the years we've developed an understanding and grasp for how the industry grows and how quickly it adapts to new technology. We wish to start Miraheze, a totally open, free and community ran wiki farm which provides a place for everyone in the world to host their own projects with no strings attached. Multiple wiki farms exists out in the world but none make a serious commitment to providing a service where no secret sauces are used and every single aspect is open and changeable by any community member. This is why we believe this campaign can help us build something truly innovative to show the world, with your help.

Where will funds go?

This campaign's funds will be used solely to fund the technical implementation and running of the project including (but not limited to):

  • purchasing of the domain name for Miraheze;

  • purchasing servers that will run core services for the wiki like MediaWiki and MariaDB;

  • purchasing servers that will enhance the services provided as a whole like mail, Redis and monitoring hosts;

  • and purchasing servers that will run open source software that allow us to run independent of any proprietary services such as DNS recursors.

All financial information will be kept public and accountable which may then be scrutinized by any stakeholder in the project.

What can I do to help?

We're hoping to create a project where every single aspect is publicly available and changeable - so you can help in any way you feel you can to leverage your experience to help us move forward in this ever-changing industry. This ranges from improving our technical infrastructure with running configs to developing or improving open source extensions so they better meet the needs of the community. The possibilities are literally endless with our promise of openness. Or if you aren't into the technical side of things, why not transverse the community and help fight against vandalism or supporting people in how their wiki develops and how they use the software?

Any questions left?

We love questions! You are welcome to email us at campaign[at]miraheze.org (or, if you use IRC, join us in #miraheze at irc.freenode.net!), and we will answer your questions as fast as possible. It's our goal to make sure the community has an answer on all questions they have.

story:
• The Northwest Civil Law Group (NCLG) is a Washington State law firm and its mission is to provide legal services to underrepresented middle class individuals and small businesses in the state of Washington on a sliding-scale fee basis or at reduced rate flat fees (depending on the matter).
  • Access to affordable legal services is a pervasive and serious challenge in Washington.
  • Without access to the legal system, individual rights are seriously jeopardized and small businesses take on unnecessary risks.
  • NCLG serves individuals earning between 125% - 600% of the federal poverty limit and small businesses with fewer than 20 employees and less than $3 million in gross annual revenue. 
  • Unfortunately, starting a law firm is expensive.  NCLG needs to raise money in order to begin operation in order to pay for initial costs such as the 501c3 application, utilities, insurance, office supplies, and an office to put those office supplies in.
  • After these initial fundraising efforts, NCLG intends to be a self-financed and self-sustained operation.

  • Thank you ahead of time for your contributions!
  • Contact us if you are a middle class individual or a small business and have a legal matter.  We would love to help!
  • Call us at 206-851-4403
*** Contributions to NCLG do not initiate an attorney-client relationship.
***NCLG will be a 501c3 nonprofit law firm as soon as funds are raised for the initial application fees.

story:
Funds raised will be used to purchase proper equipment, secure dockage and classroom space for a Basic Keelboat Sailing School in this popular vacation destination. Mainsail School will take the direction of becoming a full range school offering Basic Keelboat thru Ocean Passage Making courses in a fun and exciting setting. Building confidence with the education to fulfill your dreams of independence under sail and opening a new world for you to explore.
This will be the sixth sailing education venue I've been involved with and I just want to continue teaching sailing.

story:
Hi,

My name is Jacob Kruger. I lost my sight in a bike accident about 10 years ago.

I am still a biker, and webmaster of my bike club, and have ridden a motorbike 3 times since getting out of hospital. Twice on parts of Phakisa raceway race track, and once just out in the open, on an off-road bike, and all 3 times with sighted friends just guiding me around, I did all of the riding myself, and obviously wore decent protective gear.

A biker at heart. "Once a biker, always a biker!"

I am a computer programmer and do web hosting.  I program making use of following technologies: PHP, MySQL, javascript/jQuery, HTML and Python.

Currently I assist other blind people with one on one computer training and support as well as overcoming obstacles in the everyday world at times introducing them to new products and technologies that can make their day to day life easier.

Why do I need your help

In South Africa the blind market size is relatively small so the prices are very high and many products are out of reach of the average blind person due to cost of specialized items even though they are cost effective.

I want to promote both awareness and availability of various products for the blind on a cost effective scale to the South African market and set-up a small training center catering only for the blind.

Currently I assist my blind brothers and sisters with a key focus area on assistive technology and software training as we are always relying on sighted people to assist us with technology.

I am only able to give one on one training due to a  lack of funds to grow the training center. 

With transport being an issue for us blind people in South Africa, many of the blind people can only make certain times of the day

My approach to training other people to use software, or technology, or to help them with general problem solving has never been to just tell them a direct answer, but rather to provide them with guidelines, help them with the problem solving parts of process, but, preferably help them to figure it out in their own way.

My 30 years experience in computers and hands on knowledge with  the difficulties in getting cost effective everyday items to my blind brothers and sisters, 

"I will use the donations I receive to source, import or develop everyday products that blind people can actually afford as well as giving them computer software training."

I am hoping that my vision for this project may help blind people help
themselves, so they can be self-sufficient, productive members of
society.

story:
---Version Française plus bas---


How It All Started

I started getting a lot of Facebook messages from friends, and friends of friends, asking me: “Hey, I saw you live in Bangkok and I’m coming to Thailand soon. Do you have any recommendations for nice places to visit? Something off the beaten track?”

Through these messages, I realized that there was a real demand in people wanting to travel and feel like a local rather than like a tourist. Travellers want to connect with someone who is living in the place they visit– whether that person is a local or an expat.

I happened to have a lot of contacts of locals and expats who already knew the city very well, are friendly and had some time to spare. I figured they’d love to share their passion and earn some extra money! So I started thinking about how I could connect travellers with locals via a platform.

Our Concept

Fed up with the classic tour operators telling you when and where to go and how long to stay when you are on holidays?

What you want is to run away from the tourist traps and:

  • Escape from inflexible group tours and get to know what is behind the endless clichés?
  • Discover new horizons and a different angle of the local culture without getting stuck in a crowded bus full of tourists?
  • Explore unique local spots and alternative places with passionate locals, at a reasonable price?

If the answers to these questions is YESSSSSS! Very Local Trip is what you need!

Our ambition is to redefine the concept of travelling.


Very Local Trip is an innovative collaborative platform that brings together travellers seeking unique/local experiences and "local friends" looking to make additional income by providing their own customized local experiences and friendly companionship.

More and more travellers are looking for authenticity during their holidays or stays in countries that they sometimes visit for the first time. The best way to know a country is to discover it with local people by going off the beaten tracks of traditional tourism. Do you want to try Muay Thai with a local for 2 hours in Bangkok? Or just spend the day visiting the city with a local who will show you his/her favorite and secret places?

These are only some of the services proposed on Verylocaltrip.com.


How It Works


Here is one of the many experiences we offer:

2 days / 1 night immersive village trip in Sakon Nakhon, the 'City of Indigo'. A real Thai experience. 

Book your local trip now and support a local community project on verylocaltrip.com.


Travellers already trust us.


What We Need 

Until now, we were financing ourselves. Now it’s time to take Very Local Trip to the next level and to make people hear about us all around the world.  That’s why we need you!

IT development:

It has been a year since the first launch of the website, and a month since it has been modified to a more functional and practical version. Verylocaltrip.com still remains a very basic website and would benefit from some advanced improvements. We thus need to hire an IT expert to improve it. We also need this IT expert to develop a smartphone application in order to be able to reach you better and respond to your needs. This is currently our main need and therefore most of your donations will serve this matter => 12000 $

Communication and marketing:

We have not invested one single penny in communication yet. But to gain visibility and make Very Local Trip known worldwide, it is time to start. We want to focus on digital communication but for that, we need some funds. We will need communication and marketing to raise awareness about our concept to travellers as well as locals. => 1900 $

With Very Local Trip, we are ready to disrupt the global travel scene, and we hope you can participate. Let’s rebuild together the authenticity of meeting different people and sharing our culture and knowledge all over the world.

A quick explanation of our crowdfunding strategy: We are setting a reasonable target (13900 $) to outline what we need the most of all. But the fact is that we need more money to further develop all the projects we have mentioned above. So please don’t think that we won't need your help anymore once we reached the target. It is only the first step of many others to come!

The further development of our project would consist of:

  • Attracting key talents to work with us 
  • Participate in travel and tourism exhibitions related to collaborative tourism and economy in order to increase our visibility (example: TBEX Trade Fair in Bangkok for 700 $)
  • Organizing meetings with our whole local community in order to strengthen it
  • Organizing local events about collaborative tourism
  • Renting a more decent working space 
  • Paying furniture and office expenses


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you can contribute to our project. But you can still help us by talking about our project around you or just sharing this page with the Indiegogo sharing tools. Sharing the following message would help us a lot.

 "Very Local Trip is going to change the way you travel. Share, like, support their campaign and become an active member of the collaborative economy! #letsdisrupttheglobaltravelscene #verylocaltrip"


What's In It For You ?

Our range of rewards:


Our Team 

Currently composed of 12 individuals, the team is a real melting-pot of ethnicities: covering the Philippines, Japan, Canada, France, Russia, New Zealand, Spain and USA, our team brings a strong international energy with a very large scope of vision and open-mindedness as well as a big global outreach.


Thank you a lot for your help. We are so happy and really grateful!


---Version Française---


Comment Tout A Commencé

En habitant à Bangkok, j'ai souvent commencé à recevoir des messages sur Facebook de la part d'amis, ou d'amis d'amis me demandant "Hey, je vois que tu vis à Bangkok et j'arrive bientôt en Thaïlande. Tu connaîtrais pas des endroits sympas à visiter, en dehors des sentiers battus?"

Généralement, les gens n'aiment pas voyager comme des "touristes" mais plutôt comme des locaux. J'ai réalisé qu'il y avait une opportunité ici parce que beaucoup de voyageurs veulent rencontrer quelqu'un qui vit localement et qui a une bonne expérience de l'endroit - soit un local, soit un expat.

Je connaissais aussi beaucoup de locaux et d'expats qui connaissent très bien la ville, qui sont sympas et qui ont du temps libre. Je me suis dit qu'ils aimeraient sûrement partager leur passion et gagner un peu d'argent. J'ai donc commencé à réfléchir à un moyen de connecter les voyageurs aux locaux via une plateforme. 

Notre Concept

Marre des tours opérateurs classiques vous disant où, quand, pour combien de temps partir en vacances ? 

Vous voulez éviter les pièges à touristes et :

  • Vous échapper des tours en groupe peu conciliants et découvrir ce qu'il se cache derrière tous les clichés ?
  • Découvir de nouveaux horizons et un point de vue différent des cultures locales sans avoir à rester coincé dans un bus plein de touristes ?
  • Explorer des endroits locaux uniques avec des locaux passionnés, à un prix raisonnable ?

Si votre réponse est OUIIIIIIIIIIII, Very Local Trip est ce qu'il vous faut !

Notre ambition est de redéfinir le concept même de voyage.


Very Local Trip est une plateforme collaborative innovante qui met en relation des voyageurs - désirant voyager vraiment différemment - avec des locaux partout dans le monde !

De plus en plus de voyageurs recherchent l’authenticité lors de leurs vacances ou séjour dans un pays qu’ils visitent parfois pour la première fois. Le meilleur moyen de connaitre un pays est de le découvrir avec les locaux en sortant des sentiers battus du tourisme traditionnel. Vous souhaitez vous essayez à la Boxe Thai avec un local pendant 2h à Bangkok ? Ou tout simplement passer la journée à visiter la ville avec un local qui vous montre ses endroits préférés ? Ce sont les services qui sont proposés sur verylocaltrip.com.

Chez Very Local Trip, nous sommes convaincus que l'économie collaborative va continuer à se développer rapidement et va modifier en profondeur le paysage économique mondial, mais également les habitudes de consommation grâce à la volonté de ces individus qui désirent se rapprocher, s'entraider et trouver une alternative à la consommation de masse.


Voici un exemple d'expérience que nous offrons :

2 jours / 1 nuit d'immersion à Sakon Nakhon, la 'Ville de l'Indigo' en Thaïlande. Une véritable expérience locale.

Réservez dès maintenant et supportez un projet de communauté locale sur verylocaltrip.com 


Des voyageurs croient déjà en nous.


Ce Dont Nous Avons Besoin

Jusqu'à maintenant, nous nous auto-financions. Il est désormais temps de nous développer et de faire connaître Very Local Trip tout autour du Monde. C'est pourquoi nous avons besoin de vous !

Développement informatique :

Un an après avoir lancé notre site web et un mois après avoir lancé une version plus fonctionnelle et pratique, verylocaltrip.com est toujours très basique et bénéficierait de quelques améliorations avancées. Nous avons donc besoin d'engager un expert en informatique pour améliorer le site web. Nous avons aussi besoin de cet expert pour créer une application pour smartphone afin d'être plus proches de vous et plus aptes à répondre à vos besoins. C'est ce dont nous avons le plus besoin et c'est donc là-dedans que la plupart de vos donations iront.  => 12000 $

Communication et marketing :

Nous n'avons toujours pas déboursé un centime pour la communication. Mais pour gagner de la visibilité et rendre Very Local Trip connu autour du monde, il est temps de s'y mettre. Nous voulons nous focaliser sur la communication numérique mais pour cela, il nous faut des fonds. Nous allons avoir besoin de communication et de marketing afin d'attirer des voyageurs intéressés par notre concept ainsi que des locaux désireux de rejoindre une telle communauté mais n'en ayant toujours pas entendu parler. => 1900 $

Avec Very Local Trip, nous sommes prêts à perturber la scène globale du voyage et nous comptons sur vous pour y participer. Redonnons vie à l'authenticité de rencontrer des personnes différentes et de partager notre culture partout où nous allons.

Une brève explication de notre stratégie de crowdfunding : Nous avons défini un objectif raisonnable (13900 $) afin de mettre en valeur ce dont nous avons absolument besoin maintenant. En fait, nous avons besoin de plus d'argent pour développer davantage les projets mentionnés ci-dessus. Donc, s'il vous plait ne pensez pas que nous n'avons plus besoin de votre aide si nous avons déjà dépassé notre objectif. Ce n'est que la première étape d'une longue série. 

Le développement additionnel de nos projets consistera à :

  • Attirer des talents clés à travailler avec nous
  • Participer à des salons et exhibitions en rapport avec le tourisme et l'économie collaborative afin d'augmenter notre visibilité (exemple : l'exposition commerciale TBEX à Bangkok pour 700 $)
  • Organiser des rencontres avec toute notre communauté de locaux afin de renforcer les liens
  • Organiser des événements locaux à propos du tourisme collaboratif
  • Louer un endroit de travail plus convenable
  • Payer les frais de bureau, de fournitures, de transports, etc...


D'Autres Moyens De Nous Aider

Nous comprenons que vous ne pouvez pas tous contribuer à notre projet. Mais vous pouvez tout de même nous aider en parlant de Very Local Trip et de notre campagne de crowdfunding autour de vous. Partager cette page ou le message suivant nous aiderait énormément. 

"Very Local Trip va changer votre façon de voyager. Partagez, likez, soutenez leur campagne et devenez un membre actif de l'économie collaborative ! #letsdisrupttheglobaltravelscene #verylocaltrip"


Ce Que Vous Avez à y Gagner ?

Notre gamme de contreparties:


Notre Équipe

Composée de 12 membres, l’équipe Very Local Trip est un véritable “melting-pot” de cultures: en passant par les Philippines, le Japon, le Canada, la France, la Russie, la Nouvelle-Zélande, les Etats-Unis et l’Espagne, notre équipe est très dynamique et internationale avec une large et riche vision du monde.

Merci infiniment pour vos donations. Nous sommes vraiment heureux et très reconnaissants !
story_txt:
---Version Française plus bas---

How It All StartedI started getting a lot of Facebook messages from friends, and friends of friends, asking me: “Hey, I saw you live in Bangkok and I’m coming to Thailand soon. Do you have any recommendations for nice places to visit? Something off the beaten track?”Through these messages, I realized that there was a real demand in people wanting to travel and feel like a local rather than like a tourist. Travellers want to connect with someone who is living in the place they visit– whether that person is a local or an expat.I happened to have a lot of contacts of locals and expats who already knew the city very well, are friendly and had some time to spare. I figured they’d love to share their passion and earn some extra money! So I started thinking about how I could connect travellers with locals via a platform.
Our Concept
Fed up with the classic tour operators telling you when and where to go and how long to stay when you are on holidays?What you want is to run away from the tourist traps and:

Escape from inflexible group tours and get to know what is behind the endless clichés?


Discover new horizons and a different angle of the local culture without getting stuck in a crowded bus full of tourists?


Explore unique local spots and alternative places with passionate locals, at a reasonable price?

If the answers to these questions is YESSSSSS! Very Local Trip is what you need!Our ambition is to redefine the concept of travelling.Very Local Trip is an innovative collaborative platform that brings together travellers seeking unique/local experiences and "local friends" looking to make additional income by providing their own customized local experiences and friendly companionship.More and more travellers are looking for authenticity during their holidays or stays in countries that they sometimes visit for the first time. The best way to know a country is to discover it with local people by going off the beaten tracks of traditional tourism. Do you want to try Muay Thai with a local for 2 hours in Bangkok? Or just spend the day visiting the city with a local who will show you his/her favorite and secret places?These are only some of the services proposed on Verylocaltrip.com.How It WorksHere is one of the many experiences we offer:2 days / 1 night immersive village trip in Sakon Nakhon, the 'City of Indigo'. A real Thai experience. Book your local trip now and support a local community project on verylocaltrip.com.Travellers already trust us.What We Need Until now, we were financing ourselves. Now it’s time to take Very Local Trip to the next level and to make people hear about us all around the world.  That’s why we need you!IT development:It has been a year since the first launch of the website, and a month since it has been modified to a more functional and practical version. Verylocaltrip.com still remains a very basic website and would benefit from some advanced improvements. We thus need to hire an IT expert to improve it. We also need this IT expert to develop a smartphone application in order to be able to reach you better and respond to your needs. This is currently our main need and therefore most of your donations will serve this matter => 12000 $Communication and marketing:We have not invested one single penny in communication yet. But to gain visibility and make Very Local Trip known worldwide, it is time to start. We want to focus on digital communication but for that, we need some funds. We will need communication and marketing to raise awareness about our concept to travellers as well as locals. => 1900 $With Very Local Trip, we are ready to disrupt the global travel scene, and we hope you can participate. Let’s rebuild together the authenticity of meeting different people and sharing our culture and knowledge all over the world.A quick explanation of our crowdfunding strategy: We are setting a reasonable target (13900 $) to outline what we need the most of all. But the fact is that we need more money to further develop all the projects we have mentioned above. So please don’t think that we won't need your help anymore once we reached the target. It is only the first step of many others to come!The further development of our project would consist of:
Attracting key talents to work with us 
Participate in travel and tourism exhibitions related to collaborative tourism and economy in order to increase our visibility (example: TBEX Trade Fair in Bangkok for 700 $)
Organizing meetings with our whole local community in order to strengthen it
Organizing local events about collaborative tourism
Renting a more decent working space 
Paying furniture and office expenses
Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that not all of you can contribute to our project. But you can still help us by talking about our project around you or just sharing this page with the Indiegogo sharing tools. Sharing the following message would help us a lot. "Very Local Trip is going to change the way you travel. Share, like, support their campaign and become an active member of the collaborative economy! #letsdisrupttheglobaltravelscene #verylocaltrip"What's In It For You ?Our range of rewards:




Our Team Currently composed of 12 individuals, the team is a real melting-pot of ethnicities: covering the Philippines, Japan, Canada, France, Russia, New Zealand, Spain and USA, our team brings a strong international energy with a very large scope of vision and open-mindedness as well as a big global outreach.






Thank you a lot for your help. We are so happy and really grateful!---Version Française---Comment Tout A CommencéEn habitant à Bangkok, j'ai souvent commencé à recevoir des messages sur Facebook de la part d'amis, ou d'amis d'amis me demandant "Hey, je vois que tu vis à Bangkok et j'arrive bientôt en Thaïlande. Tu connaîtrais pas des endroits sympas à visiter, en dehors des sentiers battus?"Généralement, les gens n'aiment pas voyager comme des "touristes" mais plutôt comme des locaux. J'ai réalisé qu'il y avait une opportunité ici parce que beaucoup de voyageurs veulent rencontrer quelqu'un qui vit localement et qui a une bonne expérience de l'endroit - soit un local, soit un expat.Je connaissais aussi beaucoup de locaux et d'expats qui connaissent très bien la ville, qui sont sympas et qui ont du temps libre. Je me suis dit qu'ils aimeraient sûrement partager leur passion et gagner un peu d'argent. J'ai donc commencé à réfléchir à un moyen de connecter les voyageurs aux locaux via une plateforme. Notre ConceptMarre des tours opérateurs classiques vous disant où, quand, pour combien de temps partir en vacances ? Vous voulez éviter les pièges à touristes et :
Vous échapper des tours en groupe peu conciliants et découvrir ce qu'il se cache derrière tous les clichés ?

Découvir de nouveaux horizons et un point de vue différent des cultures locales sans avoir à rester coincé dans un bus plein de touristes ?

Nous avons aussi besoin de cet expert pour créer une application pour smartphone afin d'être plus proches de vous et plus aptes à répondre à vos besoins. Mais pour gagner de la visibilité et rendre Very Local Trip connu autour du monde, il est temps de s'y mettre. Nous voulons nous focaliser sur la communication numérique mais pour cela, il nous faut des fonds. Nous allons avoir besoin de communication et de marketing afin d'attirer des voyageurs intéressés par notre concept ainsi que des locaux désireux de rejoindre une telle communauté mais n'en ayant toujours pas entendu parler. => 1900 $Avec Very Local Trip, nous sommes prêts à perturber la scène globale du voyage et nous comptons sur vous pour y participer. En fait, nous avons besoin de plus d'argent pour développer davantage les projets mentionnés ci-dessus. story:
Hey everybody! Thank you for taking your time to read about my vision and mission!

I’m Joy the founder of the non-profit organization Pendo Kenia e.V. I am starting this campaign to kindly ask for your support to raise money to take care of almost 1000 orphaned and neglected children in our organization and to start a sustainable community business.


I founded the organization in Germany to support my father’s non-profit organization "Forum for Orphans Malindi"  in Kenya. Since years of witnessing his love, care and spirited tenacity to help children, he truly is a beacon of inspiration for me. Since 2003 he has established schools and helped orphaned and deprived children be educated and catered for. Over this period his organization took care of more than 2500 children.

In 2011 I founded Pendo Kenia to support his great work and be there in alliance with him. Together we have made great progress with 9 primary schools, which are all in the rural areas aiming to give the children the education, attentiveness of love and confidence that their absolute needs are met. But after all those years and hard work there is still a lot do. There are schools which are structurally not safe or damaged and need to be renovated, Children in need of special healthcare and communities which still need water pipes, just to name a few.


To have nine permanent primary school buildings with washrooms and toilets plus one boarding secondary school for our older children.

Supporting the surrounding community with clean water initiatives, sustainable farming practices and the knowledge they need to live independent lives.

These goals have become more than a dream for me. It is my plan – my personal life mission.

Having worked hard I was able to raise over 60.000 euros in the last four years while being a student and after a full-time-employee like the most of us. We could do alot and everytime when I travel there I am happy to see that were making a change slowly by slowly. Therefore we still need to work harder as there is so much to do and so much to improve on!


 

For the past few years, I knew that without consistent dedication and time for Pendo Kenia we would need years to reach our goals.

 Our aim is to save a life or make it at least worthwhile to live!

So I can´t say: Okay let´s do it step by step and see where we are going, as our help would come too late and the children would suffer. I need to work harder to give those children their future back!

Thats why I have established a sustainable plan for the surrounding communities, the teachers and the organization to finally get an income and make it easier for all of us to be independent and work on our goals . In 2016 we plan to start a sustainable community Moringa, Neem and vegetable farm business by educating the community in permaculture and other sustainable ways to be independent.

To get to this point I will need the support from you. The money I am asking for will allow me to get everything started in one year. Most of all it will give me the time to search for partners, do the project management, fly to Kenya to start the Farm and to educate the communities about permaculture and our business.


The money I am asking for is calculated as the following:

Living Costs for one year 18.000 Euro

Permaculture Workshops in Kenya 150 Euro * 14 Farmers 2.100 Euro

Four flights to Kenya = 2.500 Euros

I know this kind of campaign is a little bit different. Every single donation we got in the last years was for the children. Everything you are donating in future for our school projects goes 100% to our children and schools . But as an organziation and for the teachers and communities we have to change something and start a business so that we can survive as well. I want Pendo Kenia to be here forever as I really love what I am doing and I can see how it helps and changes a lot. 

I quit my job because there is so much to do and once I started I realized that I can't do anything else anymore. The "time" you are donating will make it possible for Pendo Kenia, the teachers of our schools and the communities to start a business together and to have a income next year so that we all can continue concentrating on the children. So from next year we will have a income for the people who are working for the wellbeing of the children. Other donations apart fom this campaign will like always just be there for the schools and their environment. We will have a business and we will have the non-profit organization. And the business will make it possible for us to really do the non-profit work.

You can now imagine how important this campaign is for us!



I will work as hard as I can to change lives.  I appreciate every single donation to support me to support the wellbeing of those children and community.

For more information’s about our organization or me please check out our website www.pendo-kenia.org or get in contact with me j.reiche@pendo-kenia.org , it’s always my pleasure to interact with people from all parts of the world. You can also find us on Facebook. And if you have any question please don't hesitate to get in contact with us. I am  always happy to talk to you and to share my thoughts and visions with you. On our german website you will find an announcment bar which leads you to the english site!

Thank you all for your time and donating and even if you don’t donate, please follow us and spread our Pendo Love and become part of our story.

story:
About Enerscope SA

Enerscope SA (Pty) Ltd is presently a two man show that has been in the making since October 2013. The company was founded by two highly skilled and technically savvy individuals. We discovered the opportunity in Fortune Magazine and decided to move away from poverty by grabbing the bull by the horns.

We came from nowhere had nothing accept a roof over our heads and only by faith and hard work could we triumph over big established companies. With contributions of family and friends, we are now the local partners of British Energy Saving Technology (BEST). – Proof that the universe is friendly toward the needs of mankind.

Co-founders Malcolm Johnston and, Birgitte Muhldorfer, are now stuck wanting to bring an absolutely unique and dynamic range of energy saving technology to Gauteng South Africa, set to save industry millions of dollars, which in return helps our customers to keep going and secure jobs. The technology is able to reduce the electricity usage for our customers by up to 43%.

What We Need

Every contribution to our Indiegogo campaign helps bring the establishment of Enerscope SA closer to reality. We plan on employing at least 50 people within the next year since this business is an absolute necessity in South Africa where we are experiencing an energy crisis.

“We've had the Eniscope for about a month and I've been able to save 43% of energy costs”  Chief Engineer, Bethune University USA

Any funds raised will go exclusively toward importing, test installations, establishing the business premises and building relationships, by means of Business Mentors. In other words, we aim to leverage of their business network.


We live by the motto:

Every person who becomes rich by competition knocks down

the ladder by which he rises, and keeps others down, but every

person who gets rich by creation opens a way for thousands to

follow  and inspires them to do so.

Wallace D. Wattles


The Impact

We are able to reduce the electricity usage for our customers by up to 43%.

Our results testify

that seeing your live energy consumption disaggregated into its key components empowers companies to cut costs and reduce their carbon footprint.

Visit: https://bestenergysaving.com/features/24-reduction-for-kfc-in-south-africa

We help South Africa:

  • Reduce Carbon Footprint of large electricity users

  • Help the Economy by creating Jobs 

  • Helping companies boost profit and invest in alternative energy

We help South African Companies:

  • Reduces companies carbon footprint and enhances company image

  • Increases companies profits by reducing cost

  • Reduces maintenance, downtime and safety hazards

  • Improves companies staff morale, increasing their productivity

  • Puts company in control of one of our most valuable resources


Risks & Challenges

Funds we have received so far have been spent on Company registration, BEE Certification, Accounting Services, Communication and e-Meetings, Travel and the purchasing and testing of Sample technology as required by BEST in the UK. A decision is then to be made on whether to proceed.

A further +/- R850, 000 ($65, 384) is required in order to purchase the 80% profit opportunity out rightly, since this is where the real financial gain lays.

The additional requested funding of up to R1, 200, 000 ($93, 400) will serve to maintain a positive cash flow in case of the immanent big order. Marketing costs for a specialised product range such as this could run quite high considering an advert (marketing video) would set one back R70, 000 ($5, 400) if properly done.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
About Enerscope SA
Enerscope SA (Pty) Ltd is presently a two man show that has been
in the making since October 2013. The company was founded by two highly skilled
and technically savvy individuals. We discovered the opportunity in Fortune
Magazine and decided to move away from poverty by grabbing the bull by the
horns.
We came from nowhere had nothing accept a roof over our
heads and only by faith and hard work could we triumph over big established companies.
With contributions of family and friends, we are now the local partners of
British Energy Saving Technology (BEST). – Proof that the universe is
friendly toward the needs of mankind. 
Co-founders Malcolm Johnston and, Birgitte Muhldorfer, are now
stuck wanting to bring an absolutely unique and dynamic range of energy saving
technology to Gauteng South Africa, set to save industry millions of dollars, which in return helps our customers to keep going and secure jobs. The
technology is able to reduce the electricity usage for our customers by up to
43%.


What
We Need
Every contribution to our Indiegogo campaign helps bring the
establishment of Enerscope SA closer to reality. We plan on employing at least
50 people within the next year since this business is an absolute necessity in
South Africa where we are experiencing an energy crisis.
“We've had the Eniscope for about a month and I've been
able to save 43% of energy costs”  Chief Engineer, Bethune University USA





Any
funds raised will go exclusively toward importing, test installations,
establishing the business premises and building relationships, by means of
Business Mentors. In other words, we aim to leverage of their business network.

We live by the motto:
Every person who becomes rich by competition
knocks down
the ladder by which he rises, and keeps
others down, but every
person who gets rich by creation opens a way
for thousands to
follow  and inspires them to do so.
Wallace D. Wattles


The
Impact
We are
able to reduce the electricity usage for our customers by up to 43%. 

Our results testify
that seeing your live energy consumption disaggregated into its key components empowers companies to cut costs and reduce their carbon footprint.
Visit: https://bestenergysaving.com/features/24-reduction-for-kfc-in-south-africa
We help
South Africa:

Reduce
Carbon Footprint of large electricity users 



Help the Economy by creating Jobs 

Helping
companies boost profit and invest in alternative energy



We help South African Companies:

Reduces
companies carbon footprint and enhances company image 
Increases
companies profits by reducing cost 
Reduces
maintenance, downtime and safety hazards 
Improves
companies staff morale, increasing their productivity 
Puts
company in control of one of our most valuable resources


Risks
& Challenges
Funds
we have received so far have been spent on Company registration, BEE
Certification, Accounting Services, Communication and e-Meetings, Travel and
the purchasing and testing of Sample technology as required by BEST in the UK.
A decision is then to be made on whether to proceed.
A
further +/- R850, 000 ($65, 384) is required in order to purchase the 80%
profit opportunity out rightly, since this is where the real financial gain
lays.
The
additional requested funding of up to R1, 200, 000 ($93, 400) will serve to
maintain a positive cash flow in case of the immanent big order. Marketing
costs for a specialised product range such as this could run quite high
considering an advert (marketing video) would set one back R70, 000 ($5, 400)
if properly done.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some
people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word
     out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the
     Indiegogo share tools!

And
that's all there is to it.

story:
Switching to an all natural, gluten free, vegan, hypo-allergenic, earth friendly bar of H2H soap means healthier skin for you and healthier lives for children in need.

Known to reduce stress, the scent of citrus pays tribute to the long-lost citrus groves of Orange County where we first started at Chapman University.

Inspired by the natural chaparral of Southern California, blue sage is known for its anti-microbial, anti-fungal and anti-bacterial properties. This revitalizing aroma will cleanse and energize your mind, body, and soul.

With each wash this scent will leave you feeling like you are lathering up on a sun-kissed beach. Inspired by the ocean waves crashing along the cliffs of Big Sur. 

Known for it’s powerful antioxidants, lavender reduces anxiety and improves sleep. This scent was inspired by the lavender Alpine meadows that surround Lake Tahoe.


According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention in the world, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter. Washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programs. However, few companies are working to solve the missing link, soap. 

After seeing the progress we have made over the past year in Kenya and Ghana with 7 different orphanages, 12 new orphanages have reached out for our help. Our goal is to answer their desperate call for assistance. 

When you lather up with a scented bar of all-natural H2H soap, you'll help prevent some of the 1.4 million deaths that occur each year from unsanitary conditions. We are looking to provide 12 orphanages who have asked for our assistance. To do this we need enough materials for over 200 children at each location, along with the tools and training that they need to start their own sustainable soap programs.

H2H’s micro-funding model works. It's been proven at seven unique orphanages over the past year. With the funds from this campaign, our international team will head to 12 new areas where clean living is needed and train local would-be entrepreneurs on the skills needed to create their own home-made bars of soap. Not only do we provide training, we also provide the raw materials and initial six-month inventory to build a local H2H operation, and unlike most micro loan programs, we don't ask for anything to be paid back. 

Our sponsored entrepreneurs are teenage orphans who have just turned 18 and can’t find jobs in areas where unemployment levels can reach 40%, the highest in the world. As legal adults they can’t be financially supported by their orphanage anymore. With no support system to turn to, we give these young people the skills, funds and tools they need to become self-reliant small business owners, bettering themselves and their local communities for years to come.

Soap shouldn't be priced out of reach for people who work hard and just want to stay healthy. The H2H soap that our sponsored entrepreneurs make and sell to their friends and neighbors is 60% cheaper than other soaps offered by large well-known corporations. That means more local citizens can purchase soap, more people can be clean and we can give more support to children without families.


  • To date, Health 2 Humanity has provided over 4,000 bars of bathing soap and 4,000 bars of laundry soap to 7 orphanages throughout Kenya and Ghana.
  • In the orphanages that we work with and the surrounding areas, overall illness is down by approximately 25%.
  • We’re in the business of creating a model of sustainability, because health is the most important gift we can give.We’ve created new employment opportunities in communities that desperately need new jobs.
  • We’ve made clean living more affordable to people whose incomes average less than $1,000 per year.

After seeing the progress we have made over the past year in Kenya and Ghana with 7 different orphanages, 12 new orphanages have reached out for our help. Our goal is to answer their desperate call for assistance.

The funds raised from this campaign will be used to purchase 5,959 liters of coconut oil, 1,982 kilograms of lye, 5,972 liters of purified water, fragrance, packaging and other materials. This will allow us to expand our training efforts to 12 different orphanages allowing us to help not only them but also the struggling communities around them. Each orphanage will be provided with a 6 month supply of materials along with the training necessary and salaries to start their own sustainable soap programs. Thus preventing disease, creating jobs, and keeping the community death and disease rates down the most cost effective way possible – through proper hand hygiene practices.

1. Is the soap hypo-Allergenic, Vegan, Gluten Free, Soy Free, Non-GMO?  

H2H soap is vegan, gluten-Free, soy-Free, hypo-Allergenic, non-Comedogenic, and that's just the start.. H2H only uses food grade oils that are farmed by sustainable growers. Our raw materials are Non-GMO and biodegradable. In addition, our palm oil is sourced from companies that comply with RSPO standards. Our soap uses no animal products and utilizes no animal testing.

2.  Are packaging materials biodegradable or recycled?

All of our packaging sleeves are manufactured on recycled kraft paper, which is 100% biodegradable. How's that for earth-friendly?

3.  Is H2H soap manufactured in a U.S. facility that has best practices?

Our manufacturer (SFIC) has been producing high-quality soap since 1967. SFIC uses the finest ingredients without the use of fillers or adulterants that are often found in other manufacturers. By focusing on small batches, fine ingredients, and caring human attention, we make superior products that are produced in a way that is sustainable both for the environment and American jobs. 

4.  Is H2H affiliated with any organizations doing work in the US or overseas?  

We try to find partners that share our goals of making the world a better place. With that in mind, Think Kindness has been instrumental in supporting us through our early days. In addition, Missions Race and Chapman University Club Association have leant their expertise to getting us in touch with the right individuals. 

5. What scents is H2H soap available in for my perk? 

H2H soap is available in four scents, including Citrus Breeze, Blue Sage & Lemon, Lavender Vanilla and Sea Mist. See above for more details!

6. How do I choose what scent goes with my perk?

Once you've donated, send us an email with your preference of scent! We'll get it matched up and confirm with you via email once the campaign is over!

7. What Orphanages have you helped so far?

Ghana: Remar Home, Trinity Orphanage, VIMA Children Home, Kekeli, New Seed

Kenya: Tumaini Children's Home, Huruma Children's Home

8. I want to carry your soap in our store, how so we contact you?

Please email cefalu@h2hsoap.org with any inquiries.


What are you waiting for? Grab a PERK!!

Live Clean and Give Clean!

story:
BEHIND OUR NAME

The word 'apeepuu ' (pronounced apay-pu) is an African saying. It is what a mother tells her child when she wants the child to climb on her back, so likewise we are asking small businesses across Africa to climb on our website and we will support them (as depicted by our logo).


OUR INSPIRATION

What makes us who we are...

We aspire to be a true reflection of all African mothers...

 



ABOUT US?

www.apeepuu.com is simply an online market place for Africa. 

As a company we have created an online platform for small to medium sized businesses and organizations that are based in Africa.

Our goal is to use the internet's reach to bring together experts and those who need their help.  Apeepuu's unique platform is tailored to make the user's experience as close as possible to a face to face meeting.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

apeepuu.com allows businesses to upload pictures relating to their business, along with a company description, contact details and company video profile or presentation. Doing so will make it easier for people to find them online and it will enable them to reach both the younger customer and the more affluent customer.

We really feel that the platform we have created will be especially beneficial to thousands of start- ups or small - medium sized companies in Africa. Apeepuu aims to put customers from all parts of the world (including other African countries) in contact with the services they require in Africa. We feel like this project is the key that will open doors to many African small companies. It will encourage young people to start up their own businesses and support themselves and their communities. This campaign for us, is everything, we feel like your contribution will help us achieve our goals and fulfill our dreams

WE SUPPORT LOCAL

BUSINESSES


Advertising in Africa can be quite difficult and expensive especially for many start-ups. Prices for ads can be so high, it almost becomes impossible to make returns. We have come up with a perfect solution for start-up businesses to advertise on our website and reach a larger audience. It costs them the equivalent of $20 per month to have an online shop with us, where they can sell their products or advertise their services.  We have many artists who make traditional crafts, e.g. basket weaving, wooden sculptures, painting, textiles, jewelry etc. These people often find it difficult to reach customers and we feel that Apeepuu will bring them into the global market.




WE SUPPORT LOCAL & INTERNATIONAL

CUSTOMERS

We want to give our customers plenty of choice and variety. With your assistance, we will develop Apeepuu so that customers will be able to:

  • Buy events tickets
  • Pay their phone and electricity bill
  • Browse local businesses
  • Order take out
  • Read other customers' reviews and recommendations
  • Buy products such as clothing, jewelry and crafts
  • Make travel arrangements and book accommodation within Africa
  • Find schools and hospitals in their locality
  • Get information about upcoming events
And much more!



WE SUPPORT LOCAL 

MARKETS

Imagine the impact our project would have on many communities across the continent, especially the young people. If many young persons are encouraged to become entrepreneurs of tomorrow, more jobs will be created, unemployment will be reduced, increase in trade stabilizes the economy. With Apeepuu, people can set up an online shop and sell their products and services from their homes, without having to rent a shop or an office. This will make starting a business something that people can do easily and cheaply. With a little initiative, people will be able to create jobs and opportunities for themselves. Here in Botswana, the average pay is $80 per month and it is so difficult for people to pull themselves out of poverty and make a better life. We want people to change their circumstances with Apeepuu.
OUR MISSION

Apeepuu.com is aimed at enabling customers and sellers to connect from anywhere around the world. A heavy emphasis is placed on local small to medium-sized businesses in the private sector in African developing countries .We are also involved in promoting and providing local businesses with the latest technology to reach a larger consumer base and offer products and specials, but to also provide consumers with more choices, savings and online rewards for their loyalty.  

 We are very enthusiastic about the services we provide, and we understand the pressures that come with starting, running or operating a business, hence we have geared ourselves to help make success of the businesses we support now and in the future.



What makes us different?

Here in Botswana, everything is on paper and to find any information you will be searching through either the yellow pages or the local advertising magazine for a very long time. We have no central online database of information. All of the websites that we do have are extremely basic, most of them don't work properly and they are not engaging. Shopping online is not something many people do yet, although most people are very interested in doing it. I really want to change this by exposing people to the kind of online shopping experience that people in other countries engage in daily. I want local businesses to be easily found by customers, for example, if a girl wants to go and get her hair cut then she can go on to Apeepuu and search for the salons in her area, read customer reviews and make an informed decision on where she will spend her money.  Although these things do not make Apeepuu very unique in the global market, we are certainly unique for our continent. We want to bring Africa online.


What Do We Need and Why?

We need to raise $500 000.
10% - Developing an App and Improving the site, e.g. over 50 extension modules will be added to the site, to improve its use and quality, making our website multilingual to benefit everyone no matter where they are.
30% - Advertising and Marketing across Africa. this includes television ads, billboards, telemarketing, social media campaigns, promotional shows and events.
20% - Creating sustainable jobs and outsourcing. One of our long term goals is to have qualified and experienced sales team in each country and also utilize freelancers from around the world. 
25% - acquiring branch offices across the continent. This includes renting / letting out office facilities that would serve as a base for us.
15% - Provide internet services in local areas. 
If our goal is not reached then, depending on how much is raised, we will use the funds firstly to develop and improve the site, then to advertise. If we have any left over then we will try to accomplish other parts of our plan.


The Impact

We would like to think of our project as a means to help reduce the poverty rate in Africa by encouraging people to engage in trading and also reduce the high unemployment rate. Our tagline best describes our mission, we support or help local businesses to best serve international and local customers and thus improving the local market as a whole.
Africa has a lot of potential and resources. Help us to put Africa on the map!


Risks & Challenges

Technology is the future, we all know that. However Africa is made up of mostly developing countries and some people are still yet to catch up with advancing technology, This however does not mean that people are unaware of these changes. We have to be patient as a company and make it our goal to help everyone,  especially young people, to be technology wise by using apeepuu.com.

Another potential challenge is getting people to trust the online payment criteria. This was an issue for many e-commerce sites before people got used to using them, however customers are now more trusting because they know that their transactions and personal information are well protected. Hence we want to take the time to create a similarly trusting system that will reduce the risk of fraud.


Can I Do It?

I am from a family of 12. My parents raised us from selling vegetables on the streets. Even though we come from humble beginnings, all of my sibling have been extremely successful and many have their own businesses. This has encouraged me that I too can reach my goals with hard work and determination.

Other Ways You Can Help

We really appreciate that you took the time to read this, thank you very much. If you could like our Facebook page then we would be very grateful.
