If our goal is not reached then, depending on how much is raised, we will use the funds firstly to develop and improve the site, then to advertise. If we have any left over then we will try to accomplish other parts of our plan.   
The Impact
We would like to think of our project as a means to help reduce the poverty rate in Africa by encouraging people to engage in trading and also reduce the high unemployment rate. Our tagline best describes our mission, we support or help local businesses to best serve international and local customers and thus improving the local market as a whole.
Africa has a lot of potential and resources. Help us to put Africa on the map!


Risks & Challenges
Technology is the future, we all know that. However Africa is made up of mostly developing countries and some people are still yet to catch up with advancing technology, This however does not mean that people are unaware of these changes. We have to be patient as a company and make it our goal to help everyone,  especially young people, to be technology wise by using apeepuu.com.
Another potential challenge is getting people to trust the online payment criteria. This was an issue for many e-commerce sites before people got used to using them, however customers are now more trusting because they know that their transactions and personal information are well protected. Hence we want to take the time to create a similarly trusting system that will reduce the risk of fraud.

Can I Do It?
I am from a family of 12. My parents raised us from selling vegetables on the streets. Even though we come from humble beginnings, all of my sibling have been extremely successful and many have their own businesses. This has encouraged me that I too can reach my goals with hard work and determination.


Other Ways You Can Help
We really appreciate that you took the time to read this, thank you very much. If you could like our Facebook page then we would be very grateful.

story:
Get Hooked on Play at Neverland Beach Resort

Welcome to Neverland Beach, the world’s first play focused, democratically run eco-resort. We’re ready to revolutionize the resort industry and give you an adventurous and beautiful place to play. Located on the stunning beaches of Southern Belize, this is the brain child of me (Kristin Harling) and my family.

*Please note, the setup process of internet on this remote land has proven to be time consuming. We will respond to questions and comments as soon as possible.

I first came to Belize in 1996 as a college student. That's me on the right. I fell in love right away and have been working toward getting back to stay ever since. Over the years we have made a number of friends and connections to assist us in our venture. Six visits later, my husband, Nathan, and I have settled on the gorgeous and peaceful village of Monkey River Town for our family of six.

This is Monkey River, one of the most beautiful places on the earth, teeming with wildlife. It’s a small village of about 250. We feel so blessed to be a part of this sweet, loving, gentle community, and we know you’re going to love it too – just wait until you experience the cooking, the fishing, and the cool boat trips up the river. We promise you will learn and play a LOT!

Our incredible team brings a host of skills to the table. I started and ran a cloth diaper service in the upstate of South Carolina. I also helped start a democratic school near Asheville, NC. Nathan has extensive skills in computers and graphic design. Scott is a successful contractor in addition to being a certified SCUBA dive instructor. Natalie is the world renowned Play Doctor and author of the recently released Just Play with It. Her research on Play is right there on the leading edge. Karen is a certified permaculture designer. She has also done extensive Natural Building work and studies and is currently studying to be a Journeyman so she will officially be able to do everything!

Our community here in Belize is equally impressive. You can meet master drummer and teacher, Emmeth Young, founder of Drums, Not Guns, an organization teaching kids drumming and self-respect to keep them away from gangs and drugs. Jerry Enriquez has been a hero of mine since he was my academic director in 1996. He is currently the Belize Program Director for Ecology Project International, an experiential education organization designed to get kids out in the field with real scientists doing real research. We have a host of connections to master craftsmen and women, as well as local tour guides with intimate knowledge of both the ecology and the culture who are deeply excited to share the rivers, jungles, ancient chocolate making techniques, caves, secret fishing spots, and Mayan ruins with you.

We have just sold everything we own and moved our family to Monkey River Town, Belize. We have put a substantial down payment on a beautiful piece of land right on the white, sandy beach near the village. Now we need your help to get the rest of the down payment and build a resort where we can all play together.

OUR VISION

PLAY

We firmly believe in the value of play. Have you ever been coloring or dancing or playing music and completely lost sense of time, feeling deeply connected to yourself and whoever you’re playing with? This is what we want to foster at Neverland Beach. This is not lip service. We are SERIOUS about play! ;p

How serious, you ask? Well, toys, music and books appear to be about 25% of our budget, which we are pretty sure is a record. Kayaks, water and land trampolines, water polo, water guns, kite boards, SUP, seadoo, waboba (trust us!), a natural pool, an art treehouse with more art supplies than I am interested in listing, a video game treehouse with pretty much every gaming system ever made and more games than I knew existed, a projector and screen for movies, a giant room for said movies and also for playing music/dancing/yoga, a superfly sound system with an extensive music library, a very extensive book library, a basketball court, table tennis, billiards table, volleyball net, Frisbee golf course, an air hockey table, a soccer field (don’t call it that here, though), and a dart board.

Have you ever seen a water trampoline?! This is going to be so much fun!

We wonder why there aren’t more – or any – resorts like this.

This is in addition to options to go on a number of adventures off the property: world class SCUBA diving with certified SCUBA instructor, Scott Harling, world class fishing, birding, drum lessons, and cave, jungle, chocolate making (you won't believe how good this stuff is), river, and mayan ruins tours with local Belizeans with vast knowledge of the land, animals, and traditions. I don’t know of any place in the world this devoted to play. We also intend to have regular playshops with the world renowned Play Doctor. We believe conscious play is not just the most fun way to live but also a spiritual practice and a way to bring joy back to families. Our greatest wish is for you to come here and remember why you love your kids, your spouse, and yourself.  

SUSTAINABILITY

We want people to play all day and be filled with joy and fall in love with each other again. We also want it to be done sustainably. In all the versions of that word. Belize is so incredibly gorgeous, and we want to do everything we can to keep it that way. So we will be completely off the grid, fully supplied by rainwater, with a greywater system and composting toilets. As much food as possible will come from the land, and the whole thing is tied together with a permaculture design.  This does not mean the resort will not be luxurious. We are planning to have elegant hanging beds with 100% organic circular king size mattresses, stylish (and local!) furnishings, and regal steam showers. We believe sustainable and luxurious are not mutually exclusive.

DEMOCRACY

Sustainability includes people too. All employees will be paid living wages and will also have a vote on the Neverland Beach Council. All decisions of running Neverland Beach will be made by this council. We are currently in the process of working out a profit sharing situation with the village.

We believe some of the disastrous failures of the “too big to fail” businesses are a good indicator that perhaps it is time to change the business model to something a little more community based, something a little less top down. So, in addition to the council, we have set up a proposal system where anyone, anywhere can submit a proposal regarding something we could do or change or add. The council will vote on every proposal submitted. Many minds are better than one!

WHAT WE NEED

Our initial goal is what we need to get started. Financing land is both far less common and far more expensive here in Belize than in the US. We have been lucky to get a 2 year owner financing deal, but that means we will need to come up with a lot of money in that short time. We have invested everything from the sale of our home, cars, and business in the US in this adventure. Here’s the breakdown of the initial $161,000:

$33,752 – 1st 6 months of land payments

$30,526 – Kitchen tools, appliances, supplies, and the first year of food, bar, and  

  cleaning items

$25,000 – remainder of down payment

$19,634 – Basic furnishings and linens for both yurts

$14,000 – Legal fees and taxes for land purchase

$10,000 – Initial marketing push

$ 6,000 – Small, simple boat

$ 5,600 – Indiegogo fees

$ 5,000 – Shipping

$ 3,000 – Utilities and gas for the first year

$ 3,000 – Perk fulfillment and shipping

$ 2,585 – Licensing and Permits

$ 2,373 – Lawn mower, chicken supplies, and basic garden and power tools

This leaves us $530 for beer! That should last a good six months!

If we do not reach this goal, we will use what we have to make this work. We are committed to this project. As I mentioned above, we have sold most everything we owned in the US and shipped the rest down here, so we are here to stay. Anyone who knows me will tell you that, once I devote myself to a project, I am in it for the long haul. I’m also known far and wide for my ability to stretch a dollar. This is why those numbers above are so low. I am a profoundly amazing money manager!

The Yurt as it currently looks.

STRETCH GOALS

$341,000 PLAY STRETCH

After the basics for opening up, our next goal is all the toys! After all, this is one thing that REALLY separates us from other resorts! This will include finishing the rec center, building the natural pool, kayaks, water trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf set, treehouses, art supplies, video games and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads of books, table tennis table, air hockey table, billiards table, and dart board. And of course paying to ship all that here will also not be free.  

We will be introducing some new toy perks for this stretch!! I’ll let you wait for the details, but we will have stickers, the most amazing book on play ever written, and a fabulous playshop!

$456,000 OFF THE GRID STRETCH

This will go to the purchase of our solar/wind system, rainwater catchment system, composting toilets, and gray water system. Our ecological commitment is another thing that really sets us apart!

There will be some REALLY COOL new perks for this stretch. Those of you wanting to experience this beautiful place and also learn more about Permaculture and living off the grid will want to pay attention to these perks! There will also be some super fly, eco-friendly toys and deliciousness.

$606,000 LUXURY CABANA STRETCH

When we get to $606,000, we will be able to build the luxury cabana. There is currently a Yurt for you to stay in when you come visit, but it’s kinda small, kinda old, and definitely not luxurious. Using natural building materials and employing the labor of our children and friends will allow us to keep this expense lower ;) It is at this point, though, that we will need to begin hiring permanent staff.

Lowering our building costs means more lovely amenities for your beautiful cabana! Have you ever seen a sauna/steam shower? Check it out:


Then, the hanging bed:

WHAT?! I know, right? You definitely want to stay here. And, yes, we’re putting an organic mattress on that bad boy. Now, close your eyes and feel the breeze, smell the salt, hear the waves! Paradise FOUND!

The stretches here will, of course, be luxury related. You will want the yumminess perk for this goal for sure!!

$701,000 THE NEVERLAND FAMILY GETS A HOUSE!

There is another yurt on the land that we can live in for now, but it is one circular room … and there are six of us. And again, it’s kinda old. SO, we would love to have a little permanent structure that would give each of our kids their own room and an office for the Neverland Beach business. Again, we will be using natural building materials and the labor of our families, friends, and students, so we can keep costs low.

There will be fun and silly, more personal perks added for this stretch.

Here’s the overall budget broken down in a completely different way just to confuse you and also allow us to have fun with pie charts on Excel.

IMPACT

I almost don’t have words for the impact this will have on my family and me. This has been my dream for quite a long time, and I am so deeply grateful for the support of our community in bringing this dream into form. I believe we are going to do really great work at Neverland Beach and that it is going to be a place that brings many people profound joy and healing.

For the country of Belize, I believe another prosperous, truly sustainable resort has a tremendous impact in proving that ecotourism brings in more dollars that stay here in Belize than putting up big hotels and condos. And those dollars have a huge impact on the people of the local communities where, not only will you spend your dollars, but also where we will spend ours. Monkey River Town was once a much larger, thriving town, and we are very excited to be a part of its big comeback with opportunities to make good money, not only fishing, but also doing tours, hosting additional guests, feeding people, and selling beautiful crafts. We are also in the process of working out a profit sharing deal with the village. This is in addition to the profit sharing with our employees. Neverland Beach can make a big impact on Monkey River Town, and Monkey River Town has made a tremendous impact on us.

At the same time, there is very little impact on this ecosystem. Here you have reef, beach, river, mangroves, and islands, all in very close proximity. These are delicate ecosystems, so we are taking great care to ensure this land is just as beautiful for generations to come.

For those who come to visit, we believe the impact will be tremendous. The culture, the land, the water, the animals, the people – it’s all beautiful here. Belize was ranked by National Geographic Traveller as one of the top ten happiest countries in the world. The weather is beautiful. It’s always warm. There’s almost always a breeze. The things you will see here will absolutely blow the top off your imagination. Just the sheer variety of what you can experience is far more than you could ever do in a week or two. You could also very contentedly spend the whole two weeks in a hammock drinking coconut water - with or without rum. On top of that, there is so much opportunity for play and adventure with family and friends. We firmly believe many relationships will be healed here as people play together, surrounded by joy. 

CHALLENGES/RISKS

So, this is the rainforest, which means it rains a good bit. Even during the rainy season, it is often sunny for most of the day. However, the amount of rain can vary and can lengthen construction time.

There are also hurricanes, and though it is very uncommon for a hurricane to hit full force in the southern part of Belize, it is always possible. That would certainly be a setback.

Bureaucracy can be somewhat hairy here at times. It is not insurmountable, but it does require patience, persistence, knowledge, and money.

Anyone who knows me will tell you that I am doggedly persistent. I am beyond committed to this project and will go to the ends of the earth to see it through. We have sold almost everything we own to make our life here, so we will do what needs to be done to make it work.

WHAT YOU GET, AKA PERKS

Here are more detailed descriptions and pictures of our initial perks! Please note that more perks will be released as we hit new stretch goals, so check back often!

$10 TEMPORARY TATTOOS! Let the world know you’re hooked on PLAY with superfly tattoos! Is there a better way to showcase your vibrant pirate love?! Take a shot of rum and grab a washcloth – you’re about to get way cooler! Options are pirates (duh), lizards, dolphins, mermaids, jungle cats, fairies, and sharks.

 

$20 FAIRY DUST! Say it with me, “I do believe in fairies!!” For 20 little dollars we will send you a little bottle of fairy dust to help you remember that you, indeed, know how to fly, that you are, indeed, a magical and miraculous being, and that all your dreams can come true, whether you want to grow up or forever be a child!

$50 HANDMADE JEWELRY! Our lovely and talented daughter Sophie makes gorgeous jewelry. She will make a piece just for you. These also make really lovely gifts. It will be handmade clay pieces and/or beads. Colors and lengths will vary. We promise you will LOVE! Please send a message indicating if you would like a necklace or earrings. There is a limit of 20 on these.

$100 ADD A CHILD! No, we are not giving away children. This is the $100 add-on for children to be used in conjunction with the work trade stays and permaculture and natural building courses.

$150 ONE-HOUR COACHING SESSION WITH THE PLAY DOCTOR! Get an hour with world-renowned play doctor Natalie Kinsey and learn how to play your way to lasting joy!

$200 ONE WEEK STAY WITH WORK TRADE! What?! Seriously?! Yes!!! Come spend a week with us in the current state of the resort for just a tiny bit of money. You’ll also do 20 hours of work trade on the land and/or structures. No special skills required. We’re certain we can find something you can do! This cost is per adult. Children are $100 and are of course not required to work. Please do separate contributions for each adult and the $100 add-on for each child. The lodgings will vary depending on when you come and where we are in the process. You will most likely be staying in the yurt but may or may not have fancy things. We’ll let you know when you schedule so you know what to bring. Breakfast will be provided. You are welcome to buy food and use the kitchen for lunch or have lunch with any number of amazing cooks in Monkey River Town for $5 or $6. Dinner at the resort is $10 per adult. Kids eat free. Again, you’re always welcome to head over to the village to eat as well. A minimum of two people in the yurt per week, so buddy up with someone you like, or take a chance on meeting someone new! Email us to schedule your stay.

Something that needs some work!

$750 ONE WEEK PERMACULTURE WORKSHOP! Come do a one week permaculture workshop with certified Permaculture Designer, Karen Barrett. Karen has studied permaculture and natural building for many years and is now in the process of becoming a certified journeyman. This is the one week “book learning” portion. All meals and materials will be provided. You are welcome to bring a tent or just bring a camping mat and share the floor of the yurt with your fellow students! Please note that, though Karen has completed both Permaculture 1 and Permaculture 2, she is not certified to give you a Permaculture Designer Certificate. Same knowledge, but without the paper.  Please add $100 per child if you need childcare for the week using the $100 ADD A CHILD! perk above. 


$850 ONE WEEK NATURAL BUILDING WORKSHOP! Come learn natural building techniques with Karen and a host of other local builders who’ve been doing natural building the way their ancestors did for thousands of years before them! This is a really awesome opportunity to learn to work with a number of different materials and learn to create a structure that can withstand a number of challenges (rain, humidity, sand, salt, hurricanes, and intense heat). You’ll also get the opportunity to see some of the local natural buildings. AND you get to help build one of our structures!!!!!

As with the Permaculture Workshop, all meals and materials are provided. Lodging is camping (byot!) or on the floor of the yurt with your fellow workshoppers. Please use the $100 ADD A CHILD! perk for each child if you will need childcare for the week. 

Wouldn't this be fun to build?!

$1200 ONE WEEK FOR FOUR IN THE YURT WITH THREE ADVENTURES! Don’t feel like doing work trade on your vacation? We get that! Come stay in the yurt while work is being done at the resort and get a tremendous discount! Furnishings and amenities will vary depending on when you come. This means you may or may not have fancy stuff. Once it gets close to time for you to come, we will let you know what the furnishings situation is so you can plan appropriately. If you are more than 4 in your clan (we get that too!), just do the $100 add-on for each additional child. Breakfast will be provided. You are welcome to buy food and use the kitchen for lunch or eat over in the village with any number of amazing cooks for $5 or $6. Dinner at the resort is $10 per adult. Kids eat free. Again, you’re always welcome to head over to the village or into neighboring towns to eat as well.

This perk also includes 3 adventures! Adventures available will, again, vary depending on what stage of evolution we are in. Possibilities include: Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making facility, Snorkeling at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local guides, Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides, Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer, Emmeth Young. SCUBA will be available for certain weeks but WILL cost extra.

Please email us to schedule your stay and be sure to let us know if you’re wanting to SCUBA dive. 

  

$1500 EARLY BIRD SPECIAL!! ONE WEEK IN THE LUXURY CABANA FOR FOUR WITH THREE ADVENTURES! Are you holding out for the steam showers, whirlpool tub, and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know. We’re excited too! Never again will you see this super duper low price. There will only be three of these, so jump on it before the price goes up! This is seven nights with three adventures for four people.

The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis. Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds, as well as lovely local furnishings and artwork. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom with steam shower and whirlpool tub. The cabana will have a kitchenette with a small fridge, small stove, coffee maker, espresso machine, and soda stream, as well as a small living room area. Add some rocking chairs, hammocks, and your very own beach cabana right on the sand, and you have the perfect paradise.

This includes breakfast. You are welcome to buy food and eat lunch or dinner in your room. Basics will be stocked when you arrive. Dinner at Neverland Beach is $12 per person. You are also welcome to head over to Monkey River Town and eat with any number of amazing cooks over there. For an extra fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.  

This also includes three adventures. Possibilities include: Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local guides, Snorkeling or Diving at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making facility, Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides, Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer, Emmeth Young.

This also includes the vast onsite activities and toys!!! If you didn’t read it above, here’s our toy list: natural pool, kayaks, water trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf, tree houses, art supplies, video games and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads of books, table tennis, air hockey, billiards table, and dart board.


$2000 MIDDLE BIRD SPECIAL! ONE WEEK IN THE LUXURY CABANA FOR 4 WITH 5 ADVENTURES! Did you miss the $1500 level? Don’t feel too bad! It won’t be this low again either, and this one comes with five adventures instead of three! There are only 5 at this contribution level, so don’t delay! 

Are you holding out for the steam showers, whirlpool tub, and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know. We’re excited too!

$2500 THE LATE EARLY BIRD SPECIAL! ONE WEEK IN THE LUXURY CABANA FOR FOUR WITH FIVE ADVENTURES! So, you missed the week for $1500 and the week for $2000? Now you feel kinda sad. We get that. STILL! Even at $2500, it’s a steal for a two bedroom cabana with all the amenities, on site activities and 5 adventures for 4. And it won’t be this low ever again! There are five of these available as well.

Are you holding out for the steam showers, whirlpool tub, and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know. We’re excited too!

The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis. Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds, as well as lovely local furnishings and artwork. For an extra fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.   

This also includes five adventures. The first three lucky, scurvy dogs will get the incredible deal of 14 nights with 12 adventures for $3000. Crazy, you say? Yes, we know, but we are so grateful to those of you who are stepping up in these early days to help us realize this adventure!

Cheer up! $4000 is still a super awesome deal for two weeks in a two-bedroom luxury cabana with 12 adventures and breakfast included. There will only be five of these, so don’t dilly dally!

The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis. Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds as well, as lovely local furnishings and artwork. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom with steam shower and whirlpool tub. The cabana will have a kitchenette with a small fridge, small stove, coffee maker, espresso machine, and soda stream, as well as a small living room area. Add some rocking chairs, hammocks, and your very own beach cabana right on the sand, and you have the perfect paradise.

This includes breakfast. You are welcome to buy food and eat lunch or dinner in your room. Basics will be stocked when you arrive. Dinner at Neverland Beach is $12 per person. You are also welcome to head over to Monkey River Town and eat with any number of amazing cooks over there. There are three restaurants and a bar over there. For an extra fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.   

This also includes 12! adventures. Possibilities include: Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local guides, Snorkeling or Diving at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making facility, Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides, Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer, Emmeth Young.

This also includes the vast onsite activities and toys!!! If you didn’t read it above, here’s our toy list: natural pool, kayaks, water trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf, tree houses, art supplies, video games and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads of books, table tennis, air hockey, billiards table, and dart board.

$5000 LATE BIRD SPECIAL! TWO WEEKS IN THE LUXURY CABANA! 14 NIGHTS WITH 12 ADVENTURES! Well, now you’ve done it! You’ve gone and missed both the early bird and the middle bird specials. It’s a bummer. I agree. Still, it’s a crazy deal that you will never see again! AND we’re gonna have so much fun playing together, so do it! Again, only five of these!

The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis. Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds, as well as lovely local furnishings and artwork. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom with steam shower and whirlpool tub. The cabana will have a kitchenette with a small fridge, small stove, coffee maker, espresso machine, and soda stream, as well as a small living room area. Add some rocking chairs, hammocks, and your very own beach cabana right on the sand, and you have the perfect paradise.

This includes breakfast. You are welcome to buy food and eat lunch or dinner in your room. Basics will be stocked when you arrive. Dinner at Neverland Beach is $12 per person. You are also welcome to head over to Monkey River Town and eat with any number of amazing cooks over there. There are three restaurants and a bar over there. For an extra fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.   

This also includes 12! adventures. Possibilities include: Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local guides, Snorkeling or Diving at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making facility, Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides, Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer, Emmeth Young.

This also includes the vast onsite activities and toys!!! If you didn’t read it above, here’s our toy list: natural pool, kayaks, water trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf, tree houses, art supplies, video games and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads of books, table tennis, air hockey, billiards table, and dart board.

$6000 NEVERLAND WEDDING AND HONEYMOON! Well, it won’t be the first wedding because the Neverland Dad and I never actually had a real wedding, so we get to do it first! It’s still going to be amazing, though! We will provide a minister (or perhaps a scurvy dog boat captain), a bouquet, decorations, chairs, food, and alcohol for you, your spouse-to-be and 10 guests. Please know we are not set up at this time to house that many people, so your guests will need to stay either in Monkey River Town or Placencia. We will also provide boat or vehicle transportation for your guests to the wedding. AND you get one week in the Luxury Cabana with five adventures. See above perks for more info about our cabana, adventures, meal plan, and onsite activities. Your guests are welcome to come play at the resort for the week you are with us! Sounds like a good time, right?!

$15,000 EARLYBIRD!!!!! ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA. SEVEN NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR!: Are you foreseeing wanting to be here for a week every year for the rest of your life? One lucky person will get to do that for $15,000. That gets to be a REALLY incredible deal pretty quickly!

Read through the above perks for more info on our luxury cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There’s only one at this contribution level, so jump on it!

$25,000 ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! SEVEN NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR! (2) So, you missed the $15,000 super ultra mega deal. This is still a super, duper deal. By your seventh visit, you’re breaking even. Everything after that is cake! 

Again, read through the above perks for more info on adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There are two at this contribution level, but still. You should be quick!

$50,000 ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! SEVEN NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR! I know. You missed the super deals. Still! Thirteen years and you are breaking even! AND you’re doing such a wonderful thing helping us in such a huge way to get such an AMAZING project started!

And again, read through above perks on cabana stays for more info on adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There are five at this contribution level, and then there will be no more!

$30,000 EARLYBIRD!!!! TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR FOR AS LONG AS YOU’RE HERE! If you’re more into two weeks of vacation a year, this is your deal! You are getting free vacations after a mere four years.

Read through the above perks for more info on our luxury cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There’s only one at this contribution level, so jump on it!

$50,000 TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR FOR AS LONG AS YOU SHALL LIVE! I know it’s not the earlybird deal, but don’t beat yourself up! There was only one! You’re still getting to free vacation time by year seven, and that’s not so bad!

And again, read through the above perks for individual weeks in the luxury cabanas for more info about our cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There are two at this contribution level. They will be available when the $30,000 deal is gone.

$100,000 TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR SO LONG AS YOU KEEP BREATHING! (5) Since you missed the super deals and we feel bad for you, we’re going to name a building after you. And we will always refer to you as Hook, Pan, or Tinkerbell when you come to visit (mostly your choice, but we may have an opinion here). AND you’re still breaking even after thirteen visits with us (did you know thirteen is considered lucky by the Mayans?).

One last time, read through the above perks for individual weeks in the luxury cabanas for more info about our cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There will be five at this level of contribution. You will never see this deal again!!! These will be available when the $50,000 deals are gone.   

REFERRALS: You really, really, really wanna come play but just don’t have the money? Create an Indiegogo account and refer as many friends as you can possibly think of to our campaign. If the total contributions from people you refer exceeds $3000 and also exceeds everyone else’s referral total, you will get a one week stay for four in the luxury cabana with five adventures. You’re on your own for airfare! Please be sure you are referring people from your Indiegogo account because it doesn’t count otherwise!

THANKS FOR READING ALL THE WAY!
story_txt:
Get Hooked on Play at Neverland Beach Resort
Welcome to Neverland Beach, the world’s first play focused,
democratically run eco-resort. We’re ready to revolutionize the resort industry
and give you an adventurous and beautiful place to play. Located on the
stunning beaches of Southern Belize, this is the brain child of me (Kristin
Harling) and my family.*Please note, the setup process of internet on this remote land has proven to be time consuming. We will respond to questions and comments as soon as possible.

I first came to Belize in 1996 as a college student. That's me on the right. I fell
in love right away and have been working toward getting back to stay ever since.
Over the years we have made a number of friends and connections to assist us in
our venture. Six visits later, my husband, Nathan, and I have settled on the
gorgeous and peaceful village of Monkey River Town for our family of six. This is Monkey River, one of the most beautiful places on the earth, teeming with wildlife. It’s a small village of about 250. We feel so blessed to be a part of this sweet, loving, gentle community, and we know you’re going to love it too – just wait until you experience the cooking, the fishing, and the cool boat trips up the river. We promise you will learn and play a LOT!

Our incredible team brings a host of skills to the table. I
started and ran a cloth diaper service in the upstate of South Carolina. I also
helped start a democratic school near Asheville, NC. Nathan has extensive
skills in computers and graphic design. Scott is a successful contractor in
addition to being a certified SCUBA dive instructor. Natalie is the world
renowned Play Doctor and author of the recently released Just Play with It. Her research on Play is right there on the
leading edge. Karen is a certified permaculture designer. She has also done
extensive Natural Building work and studies and is currently studying to be a
Journeyman so she will officially be able to do everything!
Our community here in Belize is equally impressive. You can
meet master drummer and teacher, Emmeth Young, founder of Drums, Not Guns, an
organization teaching kids drumming and self-respect to keep them away from
gangs and drugs. Jerry Enriquez has been a hero of mine since he was my
academic director in 1996. He is currently the Belize Program Director for
Ecology Project International, an experiential education organization designed
to get kids out in the field with real scientists doing real research. We have
a host of connections to master craftsmen and women, as well as local tour
guides with intimate knowledge of both the ecology and the culture who are
deeply excited to share the rivers, jungles, ancient chocolate making techniques, caves, secret fishing spots, and
Mayan ruins with you. 
We have just sold everything we own and moved our family to
Monkey River Town, Belize. We have put a substantial down payment on a
beautiful piece of land right on the white, sandy beach near the village. Now
we need your help to get the rest of the down payment and build a resort where
we can all play together. 

OUR VISIONPLAY
We firmly believe in the value of play. Have you ever been
coloring or dancing or playing music and completely lost sense of time, feeling deeply connected to yourself and whoever you’re playing
with? This is what we want to foster at Neverland Beach. This is not lip
service. We are SERIOUS about play! ;p
How serious, you ask? Well, toys, music and books appear to
be about 25% of our budget, which we are pretty sure is a record. Kayaks, water
and land trampolines, water polo, water guns, kite boards, SUP, seadoo, waboba
(trust us!), a natural pool, an art treehouse with more art supplies than I am
interested in listing, a video game treehouse with pretty much every gaming
system ever made and more games than I knew existed, a projector and screen for
movies, a giant room for said movies and also for playing music/dancing/yoga, a
superfly sound system with an extensive music library, a very extensive book
library, a basketball court, table tennis, billiards table, volleyball net,
Frisbee golf course, an air hockey table, a soccer field (don’t call it that
here, though), and a dart board. Have you ever seen a water trampoline?! This is going to be so much fun!

We wonder why there aren’t more – or any – resorts like
this. 
This is in addition to options to go on a number of
adventures off the property: world class SCUBA diving with certified SCUBA
instructor, Scott Harling, world class fishing, birding, drum lessons, and
cave, jungle, chocolate making (you won't believe how good this stuff is), river, and mayan ruins tours with local Belizeans with vast knowledge
of the land, animals, and traditions. I don’t know of any place in the world
this devoted to play. We also intend to have regular playshops with the world
renowned Play Doctor. We believe conscious play is not just the most fun way to
live but also a spiritual practice and a way to bring joy back to families. Our
greatest wish is for you to come here and remember why you love your kids, your
spouse, and yourself.  

SUSTAINABILITY
We want people to play all day and be filled with joy and
fall in love with each other again. We also want it to be done sustainably. In
all the versions of that word. Belize is so incredibly gorgeous, and we want to
do everything we can to keep it that way. So we will be completely off the
grid, fully supplied by rainwater, with a greywater system and composting
toilets. As much food as possible will come from the land, and the whole thing
is tied together with a permaculture design.  This does not mean the resort will not be
luxurious. We are planning to have elegant hanging beds with 100% organic
circular king size mattresses, stylish (and local!) furnishings, and regal
steam showers. We believe sustainable and luxurious are not mutually exclusive.
DEMOCRACY
Sustainability includes people too. All employees will be
paid living wages and will also have a vote on the Neverland Beach Council. All
decisions of running Neverland Beach will be made by this council. We are
currently in the process of working out a profit sharing situation with the
village. 
We believe some of the disastrous failures of the “too big
to fail” businesses are a good indicator that perhaps it is time to change the
business model to something a little more community based, something a little
less top down. So, in addition to the council, we have set up a proposal system
where anyone, anywhere can submit a proposal regarding something we could do or
change or add. The council will vote on every proposal submitted. Many minds
are better than one! 
WHAT WE NEED
Our initial goal is what we need to get started. Financing
land is both far less common and far more expensive here in Belize than in the
US. We have been lucky to get a 2 year owner financing deal, but that means we
will need to come up with a lot of money in that short time. We have invested everything from the sale of our home, cars, and business in the US in this adventure. Here’s the
breakdown of the initial $161,000:
$33,752 – 1st 6 months of land payments
$30,526 – Kitchen tools, appliances, supplies, and the first
year of food, bar, and  
  cleaning
items
$25,000 – remainder of down payment
$19,634 – Basic furnishings and linens for both yurts
$14,000 – Legal fees and taxes for land purchase
$10,000 – Initial marketing push
$ 6,000 – Small, simple boat
$ 5,600 – Indiegogo fees
$ 5,000 – Shipping
$ 3,000 – Utilities and gas for the first year
$ 3,000 – Perk fulfillment and shipping
$ 2,585 – Licensing and Permits
$ 2,373 – Lawn mower, chicken supplies, and basic garden and
power tools 
This leaves us $530 for beer! That should last a good six
months!
If we do not reach this goal, we will use what we have to
make this work. We are committed to this project. As I mentioned above, we have
sold most everything we owned in the US and shipped the rest down here, so we
are here to stay. Anyone who knows me will tell you that, once I devote myself
to a project, I am in it for the long haul. I’m also known far and wide for my
ability to stretch a dollar. This is why those numbers above are so low. I am a
profoundly amazing money manager!The Yurt as it currently looks.
STRETCH GOALS
$341,000 PLAY STRETCH
After the basics for opening up, our next goal is all the
toys! After all, this is one thing that REALLY separates us from other resorts!
This will include finishing the rec center, building the natural pool, kayaks,
water trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer
(don’t call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf set, treehouses, art supplies,
video games and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball
court, loads of books, table tennis table, air hockey table, billiards table,
and dart board. And of course paying to ship all that here will also not be
free.  
We will be introducing some new toy perks for this stretch!!
I’ll let you wait for the details, but we will have stickers, the most amazing
book on play ever written, and a fabulous playshop!

$456,000 OFF THE GRID STRETCH
This will go to the purchase of our solar/wind system,
rainwater catchment system, composting toilets, and gray water system. Our
ecological commitment is another thing that really sets us apart!
There will be some REALLY COOL new perks for this stretch.
Those of you wanting to experience this beautiful place and also learn more
about Permaculture and living off the grid will want to pay attention to these
perks! There will also be some super fly, eco-friendly toys and deliciousness.
$606,000 LUXURY CABANA STRETCH
When we get to $606,000, we will be able to build the luxury
cabana. There is currently a Yurt for you to stay in when you come visit, but
it’s kinda small, kinda old, and definitely not luxurious. Using natural
building materials and employing the labor of our children and friends will
allow us to keep this expense lower ;) It is at this point, though, that we will
need to begin hiring permanent staff. 
Lowering our building costs means more lovely amenities for
your beautiful cabana! Have you ever seen a sauna/steam shower? Check it out:

Then, the hanging bed:

WHAT?! I know, right? You definitely want to stay here. And,
yes, we’re putting an organic mattress on that bad boy. Now, close your eyes
and feel the breeze, smell the salt, hear the waves! Paradise FOUND!
The stretches here will, of course, be luxury related. You
will want the yumminess perk for this goal for sure!!
$701,000 THE NEVERLAND FAMILY GETS A HOUSE!
There is another yurt on the land that we can live in for
now, but it is one circular room … and there are six of us. And again, it’s
kinda old. SO, we would love to have a little permanent structure that would
give each of our kids their own room and an office for the Neverland Beach
business. Again, we will be using natural building materials and the labor of
our families, friends, and students, so we can keep costs low. 
There will be fun and silly, more personal perks added for
this stretch. 
Here’s the overall budget broken down in a completely
different way just to confuse you and also allow us to have fun with pie charts
on Excel. 


IMPACT
I almost don’t have words for the impact this will have on
my family and me. This has been my dream for quite a long time, and I am so
deeply grateful for the support of our community in bringing this dream into
form. I believe we are going to do really great work at Neverland Beach and
that it is going to be a place that brings many people profound joy and
healing. 
For the country of Belize, I believe another prosperous,
truly sustainable resort has a tremendous impact in proving that ecotourism
brings in more dollars that stay here in Belize than putting up big hotels and
condos. And those dollars have a huge impact on the people of the local
communities where, not only will you spend your dollars, but also where we will
spend ours. Monkey River Town was once a much larger, thriving town, and we are
very excited to be a part of its big comeback with opportunities to
make good money, not only fishing, but also doing tours, hosting additional
guests, feeding people, and selling beautiful crafts. We are also in the
process of working out a profit sharing deal with the village. This is in
addition to the profit sharing with our employees. Neverland Beach can make a
big impact on Monkey River Town, and Monkey River Town has made a tremendous impact on us.
At the same time, there is very little impact on this
ecosystem. Here you have reef, beach, river, mangroves, and islands, all in
very close proximity. These are delicate ecosystems, so we are taking great
care to ensure this land is just as beautiful for generations to come. 
For those who come to visit, we believe the impact will be
tremendous. The culture, the land, the water, the animals, the people – it’s
all beautiful here. Belize was ranked by National Geographic Traveller as one
of the top ten happiest countries in the world. The weather is beautiful. It’s
always warm. There’s almost always a breeze. The things you will see here will
absolutely blow the top off your imagination. Just the sheer variety of what
you can experience is far more than you could ever do in a week or two. You
could also very contentedly spend the whole two weeks in a hammock drinking
coconut water - with or without rum. On top of that, there is so much opportunity for play and
adventure with family and friends. We firmly believe many relationships will be
healed here as people play together, surrounded by joy.  
CHALLENGES/RISKS 
So, this is the rainforest, which means it rains a good bit.
Even during the rainy season, it is often sunny for most of the day. However,
the amount of rain can vary and can lengthen construction time. 
There are also hurricanes, and though it is very uncommon
for a hurricane to hit full force in the southern part of Belize, it is always
possible. That would certainly be a setback. 
Bureaucracy can be somewhat hairy here at times. It is not
insurmountable, but it does require patience, persistence, knowledge, and
money. 
Anyone who knows me will tell you that I am doggedly
persistent. I am beyond committed to this project and will go to the ends of
the earth to see it through. We have sold almost everything we own to make our
life here, so we will do what needs to be done to make it work. 
WHAT YOU GET, AKA PERKS
Here are more detailed descriptions and pictures of our initial perks! Please note that more perks will
be released as we hit new stretch goals, so check back often!
$10 TEMPORARY TATTOOS! Let the world know you’re hooked on
PLAY with superfly tattoos! Is there a better way to showcase your vibrant
pirate love?! Take a shot of rum and grab a washcloth – you’re about to get way
cooler! Options are pirates (duh), lizards, dolphins, mermaids, jungle cats,
fairies, and sharks. 
$20 FAIRY DUST! Say it with me, “I do believe in fairies!!”
For 20 little dollars we will send you a little bottle of fairy dust to help
you remember that you, indeed, know how to fly, that you are, indeed, a magical
and miraculous being, and that all your dreams can come true, whether you want
to grow up or forever be a child!
$50 HANDMADE JEWELRY! Our lovely and talented daughter
Sophie makes gorgeous jewelry. She will make a piece just for you. These also
make really lovely gifts. It will be handmade clay pieces and/or beads. Colors
and lengths will vary. We promise you will LOVE! Please send a message indicating if you would like a necklace or earrings. There is a limit of 20 on these.
$100 ADD A CHILD! No, we are not giving away children. This is the $100 add-on for children to be
used in conjunction with the work trade stays and permaculture and natural
building courses. 
$150 ONE-HOUR COACHING SESSION WITH THE PLAY DOCTOR! Get an
hour with world-renowned play doctor Natalie Kinsey and learn how to play your
way to lasting joy!
$200 ONE WEEK STAY WITH WORK TRADE! What?! Seriously?!
Yes!!! Come spend a week with us in the current state of the resort for just a
tiny bit of money. You’ll also do 20 hours of work trade on the land and/or
structures. No special skills required. We’re certain we can find something you
can do! This cost is per adult. Children are $100 and are of course not
required to work. Please do separate contributions for each adult and the $100
add-on for each child. The lodgings will vary depending on when you come and
where we are in the process. You will most likely be staying in the yurt but
may or may not have fancy things. We’ll let you know when you schedule so you
know what to bring. Breakfast will be provided. You are welcome to buy food and
use the kitchen for lunch or have lunch with any number of amazing cooks in
Monkey River Town for $5 or $6. Dinner at the resort is $10 per adult. Kids eat
free. Again, you’re always welcome to head over to the village to eat as well. A
minimum of two people in the yurt per week, so buddy up with someone you like,
or take a chance on meeting someone new! Email us to schedule your stay.Something that needs some work!

$750 ONE WEEK PERMACULTURE WORKSHOP! Come do a one week
permaculture workshop with certified Permaculture Designer, Karen Barrett.
Karen has studied permaculture and natural building for many years and is now
in the process of becoming a certified journeyman. This is the one week “book
learning” portion. All meals and materials will be provided. You are welcome to
bring a tent or just bring a camping mat and share the floor of the yurt with
your fellow students! Please note that, though Karen has completed both
Permaculture 1 and Permaculture 2, she is not certified to give you a
Permaculture Designer Certificate. Same knowledge, but without the paper.  Please add $100 per child if you need
childcare for the week using the $100 ADD A CHILD! perk above. 



$850 ONE WEEK NATURAL BUILDING WORKSHOP! Come learn natural
building techniques with Karen and a host of other local builders who’ve been
doing natural building the way their ancestors did for thousands of years
before them! This is a really awesome opportunity to learn to work with a
number of different materials and learn to create a structure that can
withstand a number of challenges (rain, humidity, sand, salt, hurricanes, and
intense heat). You’ll also get the opportunity to see some of the local natural
buildings. AND you get to help build one of our structures!!!!!
As with the Permaculture Workshop, all meals and materials
are provided. Lodging is camping (byot!) or on the floor of the yurt with your
fellow workshoppers. Please use the $100 ADD A CHILD! perk for each child if
you will need childcare for the week. 

Wouldn't this be fun to build?!
$1200 ONE WEEK FOR FOUR IN THE YURT WITH THREE ADVENTURES!
Don’t feel like doing work trade on your vacation? We get that! Come stay in
the yurt while work is being done at the resort and get a tremendous discount!
Furnishings and amenities will vary depending on when you come. This means you
may or may not have fancy stuff. Once it gets close to time for you to come, we
will let you know what the furnishings situation is so you can plan
appropriately. If you are more than 4 in your clan (we get that too!), just do
the $100 add-on for each additional child. Breakfast will be provided. You are
welcome to buy food and use the kitchen for lunch or eat over in the village
with any number of amazing cooks for $5 or $6. Dinner at the resort is $10 per
adult. Kids eat free. Again, you’re always welcome to head over to the village
or into neighboring towns to eat as well. 
This perk also includes 3 adventures! Adventures available
will, again, vary depending on what stage of evolution we are in. Possibilities
include: Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with
local guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate
making facility, Snorkeling at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local guides,
Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides,
Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer,
Emmeth Young. SCUBA will be available for certain weeks but WILL cost extra.
Please email us to schedule your stay and be sure to let us
know if you’re wanting to SCUBA dive. 

  
$1500 EARLY BIRD SPECIAL!! ONE WEEK IN THE LUXURY CABANA FOR
FOUR WITH THREE ADVENTURES! Are you holding out for the steam showers,
whirlpool tub, and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know.
We’re excited too! Never again will you see this super duper low price. There
will only be three of these, so jump on it before the price goes up! This is
seven nights with three adventures for four people. 
The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis.
Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds, as well as lovely
local furnishings and artwork. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom with
steam shower and whirlpool tub. The cabana will have a kitchenette with a small
fridge, small stove, coffee maker, espresso machine, and soda stream, as well
as a small living room area. Add some rocking chairs, hammocks, and your very
own beach cabana right on the sand, and you have the perfect paradise. 
This includes breakfast. You are welcome to buy food and eat
lunch or dinner in your room. Basics will be stocked when you arrive. Dinner at
Neverland Beach is $12 per person. You are also welcome to head over to Monkey
River Town and eat with any number of amazing cooks over there. For an extra
fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d
like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.  
This also includes three adventures. Possibilities include:
Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local
guides, Snorkeling or Diving at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local
guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making
facility, Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan
guides, Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master
drummer, Emmeth Young.
This also includes the vast onsite activities and toys!!! If
you didn’t read it above, here’s our toy list: natural pool, kayaks, water
trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t
call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf, tree houses, art supplies, video games
and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads
of books, table tennis, air hockey, billiards table, and dart board.



$2000 MIDDLE BIRD SPECIAL! ONE WEEK IN THE LUXURY CABANA FOR
4 WITH 5 ADVENTURES! Did you miss the $1500 level? Don’t feel too bad! It won’t
be this low again either, and this one comes with five adventures instead of
three! There are only 5 at this contribution level, so don’t delay!  
Are you holding out for the steam showers, whirlpool tub,
and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know. We’re excited
too! 
The luxury cabana will be your very own Caribbean Oasis.
Each of the two bedrooms will have King Size Hanging Beds, as well as lovely
local furnishings and artwork. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom with
steam shower and whirlpool tub. The cabana will have a kitchenette with a small
fridge, small stove, coffee maker, espresso machine, and soda stream, as well
as a small living room area. Add some rocking chairs, hammocks, and your very
own beach cabana right on the sand, and you have the perfect paradise. 
This includes breakfast. You are welcome to buy food and eat
lunch or dinner in your room. Basics will be stocked when you arrive. Dinner at
Neverland Beach is $12 per person. You are also welcome to head over to Monkey
River Town and eat with any number of amazing cooks over there. For an extra
fee, we will also boat or drive you up to Placencia for the evening if you’d
like to eat at any of the many restaurants there.   
This also includes five adventures. Possibilities include:
Boat Trips up the Monkey River with local guides, Jungle Hikes with local
guides, Snorkeling or Diving at nearby cayes, Cave Adventures with local
guides, Chocolate Tours (!) of a Mayan owned cacao farm and chocolate making facility,
Birding with local guides, Tours of Mayan Ruins with local Mayan guides,
Fishing with local fishermen, and Drum Lessons with local master drummer,
Emmeth Young.
AND it includes the vast onsite activities and toys!!! If
you didn’t read it above, here’s our toy list: natural pool, kayaks, water
trampoline, other water toys, land trampoline, volleyball net, soccer (don’t
call it that here!) goals, Frisbee golf, tree houses, art supplies, video games
and other media toys, music (recorded and instruments), basketball court, loads
of books, table tennis, air hockey, billiards table, and dart board.

CABANA FOR FOUR WITH FIVE ADVENTURES! So, you missed the week for $1500 and the
week for $2000? Now you feel kinda sad. We get that. STILL! Even at $2500, it’s
a steal for a two bedroom cabana with all the amenities, on site activities and
5 adventures for 4. And it won’t be this low ever again! There are
five of these available as well.
Are you holding out for the steam showers, whirlpool tub,
and hanging bed? NOT TO MENTION THE WATER TRAMPOLINE! I know. We’re excited
too!

$6000 NEVERLAND WEDDING AND HONEYMOON! Well, it won’t be
the first wedding because the Neverland Dad and I never actually had a real
wedding, so we get to do it first! It’s still going to be amazing, though! We
will provide a minister (or perhaps a scurvy dog boat captain), a bouquet,
decorations, chairs, food, and alcohol for you, your spouse-to-be and 10
guests. Please know we are not set up at this time to house that many people,
so your guests will need to stay either in Monkey River Town or Placencia.
We will also provide boat or vehicle transportation for your guests to the
wedding. AND you get one week in the Luxury Cabana with five adventures. See
above perks for more info about our cabana, adventures, meal plan, and onsite
activities. Your guests are welcome to come play at the resort for the week you
are with us! Sounds like a good time, right?! 


$15,000 EARLYBIRD!!!!! ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE
LUXURY CABANA. SEVEN NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR!: Are you
foreseeing wanting to be here for a week every year for the rest of your life?
One lucky person will get to do that for $15,000. That gets to be a REALLY
incredible deal pretty quickly! 
Read through the above perks for more info on our luxury
cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There’s only one at
this contribution level, so jump on it! 
$25,000 ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! SEVEN
NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR! (2) So, you missed the $15,000 super ultra
mega deal. This is still a super, duper deal. By your seventh visit, you’re
breaking even. Everything after that is cake! 

Again, read through the above perks for more info on adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There
are two at this contribution level, but still. You should be quick!
$50,000 ONE WEEK A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA! SEVEN
NIGHTS, FIVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR! I know. You missed the super deals.
Still! Thirteen years and you are breaking even! AND you’re doing such a
wonderful thing helping us in such a huge way to get such an AMAZING project
started!
And again, read through above perks on cabana stays for more
info on adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There are five at this
contribution level, and then there will be no more!


$30,000 EARLYBIRD!!!! TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE
LUXURY CABANA! FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR FOR AS LONG AS
YOU’RE HERE! If you’re more into two weeks of vacation a year, this is your
deal! You are getting free vacations after a mere four years. 
Read through the above perks for more info on our luxury
cabanas, adventures, food deals, and onsite activities. There’s only one at
this contribution level, so jump on it! 
$50,000 TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA!
FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR FOR AS LONG AS YOU SHALL LIVE! I know it’s not the earlybird deal, but don’t beat yourself up! There was
only one! You’re still getting to free vacation time by year seven, and that’s
not so bad!
And again, read through the above perks for individual weeks
in the luxury cabanas for more info about our cabanas, adventures, food deals,
and onsite activities. There are two at this contribution level. They will be available when the $30,000 deal is gone.
$100,000 TWO WEEKS A YEAR FOR LIFE IN THE LUXURY CABANA!
FOURTEEN NIGHTS, TWELVE ADVENTURES, EVERY YEAR SO LONG AS YOU KEEP BREATHING!
(5) Since you missed the super deals and we feel bad for you, we’re going to
name a building after you. And we will always refer to you as Hook, Pan, or
Tinkerbell when you come to visit (mostly your choice, but we may have an
opinion here). AND you’re still breaking even after thirteen visits with us
(did you know thirteen is considered lucky by the Mayans?). 
One last time, read through the above perks for individual
weeks in the luxury cabanas for more info about our cabanas, adventures, food
deals, and onsite activities. There will be five at this level of contribution.
You will never see this deal again!!! These will be available when the $50,000 deals are gone.   
REFERRALS: You really, really, really wanna come play but
just don’t have the money? Create an Indiegogo account and refer as many
friends as you can possibly think of to our campaign. If the total
contributions from people you refer exceeds $3000 and also exceeds everyone
else’s referral total, you will get a one week stay for four in the luxury
cabana with five adventures. You’re on your own for airfare! Please be sure you
are referring people from your Indiegogo account because it doesn’t count otherwise!
THANKS FOR READING ALL THE WAY!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

With these funds we will be able to cover the expenses of:  

  1. Synogogue furniture: Bima (the podium or platform in a synagogue from which the Torah is read), Ner Tamid (a light that hangs above the ark in the synagogue and is symbolic of the presence of God) and Bookcases = $6400 
  2. New Prayer books, Siddurim & Chumashim  = $4600
  3. Ark for the Torah, made from special Hawaiian Koa wood = $7,500
  4. Torah dedication ceremony expenses; completing the Torah with the scribe, escorting the Torah on the main strip, Alii Drive, to the synagogue, concert, festive meal, and more! Expenses are high as Hawaii means shipping everything in! = $6,500 
  5. Chabad Synagogue renovations! = $12,500 
  6. Fundraising Costs; Indiegogo & processing fees =  $3000 
  • For your very generous donations, we have beautiful honors as "perks". Please see the "perks" section.
  • ALL funds received will go towards the Torah, dedication ceremony and Synagogue remodeling. We are confidant that by partnering up with YOU, we can hit our goal! 


The Impact

  • We are truly excited about this big & bold project! Let me tell you why: We look at this as creating a new home! While Chabad doesn't need money or space to be loving, welcoming and meet new Jewish people (everything we've been doing until now), it doesn't compare to having a beautiful location, with your OWN TORAH, prayer books and a proper Shul, synagogue, setup. There is much to be said for all of that.
  • After six years of Chabad moving from location to location, we finally have a long term place. This was a big first step we made a few months ago. And now we are ready for the next step; to make it a place that is attractive (ie renovations), Synagogue worthy (ie Torah & Ark) and user-friendly! (ie Prayer Books, so all who come in can actually participate & understand the reading of the Torah!)
  • Some may read this and think; they are a synagogue on a remote island...NEXT! The truth is; the world is a small place and all Jews are responsible for each other. In our small corner of the globe we have welcomed visitors from all over the world; as fas as Israel, and everywhere in between. We have hosted and helped troubled teens who come to Hawaii searching for inner peace. We have hosted people from large Jewish communities who thanked us for connecting them with their roots in ways they never can back at home! We have embraced our local community; many of whom thank us for reconnecting them to their Judaism after decades of separation! There are endless stories to share. The point is; we are all connected. And can all be a part of its GROWTH!

Challenges

  • There are a few challenges specific to our case. Namely the cost of EVERYTHING in Hawaii (except for surf, sun and Aloha spirit!) is always much more; we are an island and mostly everything is shipped in! This is even more so with Kosher & Jewish needs. Therefore all our activities, especially those on a larger scale, require much fundraising efforts. We always make the effort, becuase the reward (Chabad's outreach work!) is at least ten-fold! Nonetheless, the EFFORT must be made. And collaborative effort (like this campaign!) is SO MUCH MORE EFFECTIVE!
  • Another challenge is that while our community is GREAT in quality (ie the Big Island attracts large souls) we are SMALL in quantity. Our numbers are not that of a mainstream, large Jewish community, and therefore does not have the fundraising pool that larger communities have. So we need to be resourceful and creative. Indiegogo's community is a wonderful resource!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • ANY and EVERY amount helps us reach our goal! Please do not be discouraged by the set amounts, and contribute what you can. Next: 
  • Please share this campaign on ALL your Social Media outlets! Help spread the word; its a MITZVAH too!

story:
Why We Need Your Help

     Every year, the local river running between Gambibgo and Bolgatanga floods. Bolgatanga is a crucial location for trading food, water, and various other goods. During the dry season people can cross the dry river easily by foot. However during the wet season the river and surrounding area becomes covered with water making it impossible to pass. Despite the flooding, people continue to try and cross, putting their lives at danger.  People die every year this way and the implantation of the new bridge is the ultimate solution to ensure the safety of the local community members and for annual acces to Bolgatanga for trading and work. We need your help to make this life saving bridge a reality! 

Your Impact

  • You will directly impact the economic opportunities of the local community.
  • You will help a developing world develop valuable infrastructure.
  • You will help save lives.
  • You will be providing safe travel for approximately 1,000,000 crossings for people over the course of a year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word about fighting the flood - even if you cannot contribute monetarily, you can help share our cause! 

    We are a team of three student civil engineers from Santa Clara University, traveling down to Ghana, Africa to design and construct this bridge in connection with the Ghana Municipal Government and every single donation means a lot to us and makes everything we are trying to do possible. Thank You!


Please note that although we are really trying to build this bridge if we do not raise enough funds, all of the raised funds will be donated to the village to be used for the upkeep of homes or other necessities. 


Please be sure to check out the gallery tab for more pictures and videos!
