story:
What is MyVitale?


MyVitale is the most powerful virtual personal trainer in the market. Based upon extremely powerful algorithms, MyVitale generates millions of personalized workouts adapted to everyone for almost any goal (sports, health, fitness, etc...). MyVitale app is available on Apple Store and Google Play and can be used on all kinds of devices.

MyVitale, as a workout planner, has been in the market for one year, and now we want to develop the very important part of nutrition planning. Being healthy and fit is a matter of staying physically active, as well as eating a balanced diet. That is why we need to design and develop the nutrition planner to round up our product.


Who we are?

We are a passionate team located in Pamplona, Spain, including physical activity graduates, medical doctors, and software engineers. We started working on this project at the end of 2.012, following our deep relation with the Health & Fitness industry, professional athletes coaching, and the sanitary experience of our medical doctors.


What We Need & What You Get


So far, many users are quite happy with what MyVitale is offering them on the workout planning side, but we receive huge demand for nutrition advice. In order to be able to apply the needed resources to this area, we are offering you very important discounts on our workout planner, and free nutrition coaching once it is completed.

On top of all that, we give you a beautiful opportunity to help the members of the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations, thanks to our "Buy 1 Give 1" campaign. MyVitale will give away as many workout plans to the Association members as perks bought by funders on Indiegogo.

We plan on needing 60.000 dollars to bring to the team a nutritionist, a software engineer and an expert endocrinology adviser for a period of 8 to 10 months. Altogether with our existing team, these new resources, will make it possible to get our intelligent nutrition system integrated within MyVitale.


Our Unique Perks


We are offering you huge discounts on our Personal Trainer App. We also offer two very special trips to get to know us, the Vitale team. We are located in Pamplona, world famous for the San Fermín Fiesta, and the running of the bulls in the streets. This takes place in July. Pamplona is also crossed by the St. James Way (Route of Santiago de Compostela) with its impressive 800 kms long spanish branch. We want to train you for these unique activities, and share a part of our culture with you.



Training:


Super Early Birds

1 year MyVitale subscription, plus 1 year nutrition planning, when released, $19
3 years MyVitale subscription, plus 3 years nutrition planning, when released, $44
5 years MyVitale subscription, plus 5 years nutrition planning, when released, $69
Lifelong MyVitale subscription, plus lifelong nutrition planning, when released, $149

Remember, all perks are associated to the "Buy 1 Give 1" program for the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations.


Early Birds

1 year MyVitale subscription, plus 1 year nutrition planning, when released, $24
3 years MyVitale subscription, plus 3 years nutrition planning, when released, $64
5 years MyVitale subscription, plus 5 years nutrition planning, when released, $99
Lifelong MyVitale subscription, plus lifelong nutrition planning, when released, $199

Remember, all perks are associated to the "Buy 1 Give 1" program for the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations.


Proud MyVitale Supporter

1 year MyVitale subscription, plus 1 year nutrition planning, when released, $29
3 years MyVitale subscription, plus 3 years nutrition planning, when released, $79
5 years MyVitale subscription, plus 5 years nutrition planning, when released, $129
Lifelong MyVitale subscription, plus lifelong nutrition planning, when released, $299

Remember, all perks are associated to the "Buy 1 Give 1" program for the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations.



Special Perks:


St. James Way. Bike trip (Hostel)

Vitale offers you a 14 day trip through the St. James Way, bike riding, all inclusive (specific training program, hostel accomodation, bike rental, breakfast, insurance, your bagage moved every stage from depart to arrival, etc...) $1,500

St. James Way. Bike trip (3-4 star Hotel)
Same trip as above, all inclusive, (specific training program, hotel accomodation, bike rental, breakfast, insurance, your bagage moved every stage, from depart to arrival, etc...) but lodging at 3 or 4 star hotels, and including dinners. $3,000


St James Way in Navarra
St James Way (General info)


Combined San Fermín - San Sebastián - Marqués de Riscal


A unique experience in july (7th to 12th). San Fermín Fiesta. Top class accomodations, best restaurants, VIP events, for 3 days, plus 1 day and night at Frank Gehry's Hotel and winery Marqués de Riscal, with its unique wine based Spa, plus a day and night in San Sebastián the beautiful Athlantic Ocean city. Dinner at one of the 3 stars Michelin reaturants. Visiting its famous museums and signature tapas bars. The Vitale team will be honoured to share with you their hometown atmosphere. $7,500.

Hotel María Cristina (San Sebastián)
Hotel Marqués de Riscal
San Fermin (General info)


Try MyVitale now, and start your new life!


You can explore MyVitale right now, either at www.myvitale.com, or downloading at:


Go find out what MyVitale is all about, and how powerful it is. Experience it by yourself with our free trial period. You will join the thousands of users that are already benefiting from MyVitale. More than 100 health clubs in Spain and countries like France and Portugal, are already using our app. But now, through this Indiegogo campaign, we want to introduce our state of the art prescription app to the individual users.

Train like the experts, and get the best results. And help us make MyVitale a better tool to be able to help people in a broader way, caring for their health in a holistic way, caring about their nutrition.

As said before, Vitale has reached an agreement with the  Osteoporosis and Fbromialgya Associations. For every training program bought during this campaing we will generate another one for the same lenght of time, for free, to be used by their associates. Osteoporisis is a cronic disease that improves dramatically with physical exercise, and especially with weight training, which very few patients know. Fibromialgya patients, also benefit from physical activity, and pool exercising in particular. MyVitale has designed specific programs for persons suffering from these diseases, and want to share with you this unique opportunity to help.


Other Ways You Can Help


If you don't feel like working out, but still you want to help us and the Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations, please tell your friends about MyVitale and this Indiegogo campaign, so we can help them get fit, reach their goals,  and feel better and happier!!.

Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!!
story_txt:
What is MyVitale? MyVitale is the most powerful virtual personal trainer in the market. Based upon extremely powerful algorithms, MyVitale generates millions of personalized workouts adapted to everyone  for almost any goal (sports, health, fitness, etc...). MyVitale app is available on Apple Store and Google Play and can be used on all kinds of devices.
MyVitale, as a workout planner, has been in the market for one year, and now we want to develop the very important part of nutrition planning. Being healthy and fit is a matter of staying physically active, as well as eating a balanced diet. That is why we need to design and develop the nutrition planner to round up our product.Who we are?We are a passionate team located in Pamplona, Spain, including physical activity graduates, medical doctors, and software engineers. We started working on this project at the end of 2.012, following our deep relation with the Health & Fitness industry, professional athletes coaching, and the sanitary experience of our medical doctors.
What We Need & What You GetSo far, many users are quite happy with what MyVitale is offering them on the workout planning side, but we receive huge demand for nutrition advice.  In order to be able to apply the needed resources to this area, we are offering you very important discounts on our workout planner, and free nutrition coaching once it is completed. 
On top of all that, we give you a  beautiful opportunity to help the members of the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations, thanks to our "Buy 1 Give 1" campaign. MyVitale will give away as many workout plans to the Association members as perks bought by funders on Indiegogo. We plan on needing 60.000 dollars to bring to the team  a nutritionist, a software engineer and an expert endocrinology adviser for a period of 8 to 10 months. Altogether with our existing team, these new resources, will make it possible to get our intelligent nutrition system integrated within MyVitale. 
Our Unique Perks
We are offering you huge discounts on our Personal Trainer App. We also offer two very special trips to get to know us, the Vitale team. We are located in Pamplona, world famous for the San Fermín Fiesta, and the running of the bulls in the streets. This takes place in July.  Pamplona is also crossed by the St. James Way (Route of Santiago de Compostela) with its impressive 800 kms long spanish branch. We want to train you for these unique activities, and share a part of our culture with you.

Remember, all perks are associated to the "Buy 1 Give 1" program for the National Osteoporosis and Fibromialgya Associations.

story:
Change the world with food, this is our mission.

Thousands of farmers in the Philippines work for months but are unable to find people willing to purchase their produce. These factors often leave farmers with very little earnings to live a life with dignity. Many rural farmers are often subject to the country's fickle weather, transportation challenges, and middlemen taking advantage of their need to earn from their harvests.

(Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

We've heard stories of farmers getting as little as 3,000 PHP or around 70 USD for farm labor worth three months! Because of these challenges, it is not uncommon hearing accounts of Filipino farmers abandoning their lands to look for other ways of earning a living.

Good Food Community is a Community Shared Agriculture (CSA) program founded in the Philippines in 2011.  We exist to ensure that farmers get their fair share so they can live a comfortable life and to promote sustainable methods of farming to feed communities and to help the environment. (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

We are about growing a society that nourishes everyone—you, the farmers, the land and generations to come. The multiple crises of our age serve as an invitation to evolve a new system and culture—one that puts the planet and people first. We believe this is possible through Community Shared Agriculture.

What is CSA?

Community Shared Agriculture is a sustainable alternative distribution system that supports smallholder organic farming by subscribing to prepaid, local and seasonal vegetables delivered weekly to your community.  (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

The CSA business model provides farmers with a stable demand and guarantees subscribers with a share of the harvest every week.

CSA also enables farmers to plan ahead and grow what is needed for a specific number of subscribers who have put their trust in the farmers by paying for the produce upfront. 

 (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

We coordinate a network of over sixty (60) smallholder partner farmers from the provinces of Benguet, Mt. Province, and Tarlac to provide fresh produce weekly to our subscribers. As of this campaign, we are supplying over ninety (90) subscribers in Metro Manila.

The Project

Taking care of our partner farmers is of utmost importance to us. We want to help them form meaningful relationships with the people they feed and be agents of change and beacons of hope in their respective communities.

Our goal is to restore dignity to the profession of farming and empower farmers to innovate, be creative, and excel in their craft.

 (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

Be part of our advocacy by pledging support to our farmers’ Learning & Accreditation (L&A) Program.

The L&A Program will provide Good Food Community partner farmers with the necessary tools, life skills, and practical knowledge to sustain their own farms; manage their own agribusinesses; and positively influence their communities by living a sustainable lifestyle and being an agent of change.

The program includes the following activities:

·  Farmer Support Activities

- provision of useful farm equipment and tools (i.e. water drums, pH meters, digital weighing scales, etc.)

- workshops and seminars on seed saving, germination techniques, soil health,  natural pest control, and permaculture design

- educational trips to organic farms and demo sites

 (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)


·  Entrepreneurial Development

- workshops on farm management

- seminars on financial planning and basic accounting

·  And Advocacy Workshops

- how to set up a local CSA and Farmers' Markets

- family nutrition and meal-planning

- cooking with locally-grown vegetables

- environmental stewardship

 (Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)


Other Ways You Can Help

We are also in need of the following items to help us preserve the quality of our produce and improve our logistics and delivery system:

1) A chest freezer

2) A refrigerator

3) An air conditioner for our vegetable storage space and packing area

4) A salad spinner for drying leafy vegetables

(Photo credit: Yummy Magazine)

With your kind donations we can equip more farmers to practice organic farming and advocate Community Shared Agriculture in the Philippines.

Be part of the community and lets change the world with food!

Meet the Faces Behind Your Food


Good Food Community is a community of advocates, mindful consumers, young professionals, entrepreneurs, volunteers, and organic farmers composed of CEO and founder, Charlene Tan; operations manager, Ernest Barreiro; organic vegetable farmer and customer support manager, Paulo Sandoval; yoga instructor and marketing manager, Micah Lima; organic vegetable farmer and farmer support manager, Jabez Flores; organic rice farmers and Transition Philippines partners, Gwyneth Williams and Danny Buddhakorola with Sara Kaserer and Timi Manching; packing and delivery team, Drei Castillo, Eric Go, and Eros Valerio; the farmers of COFPC in Capas, Tarlac; La Organica in La Trinidad, Benguet; ECP in Bauko, Mt. Province; Nu Wave Farmers in Laguna; and our partner vendors at Good Food Sundays. 



Note: PERKS are redeemable after the Indiegogo campaign period.

story:
We are a small family run business.  My husband an I get up in the wee hours of the morning and bake our hearts out six days a week to supply our store.  We make pies, cakes, tarts, croissants, eclairs, scones, a selection of sandwiches and savory items, etc.  We sell exclusively Maine made products, everything from yogurt and kimchi to soap and grass fed meat, all with an emphasis on supporting local farmers and small businesses.

I live and work in a small coastal town that has undergone a lot of change in the last year, change that has left people wondering what kind of town we really want to be.  I want a town that gathers around art, and music, and good food.  This will be a place to do that.  Our store currently occupies a small street level space, with very limited seating.  We are taking over the space above our store to convert it into a dining area, but we need help to get there.  The floors, about a hundred years old and covered in layers of carpet and dust, are being redone, and the walls are being painted, and now we need to fill the space.  That is where we need your help.  We need tables, chairs, shelving, plates, cups, flatware, a sound system, etc.

The goal is to have a beautiful, comfortable place, where people can meet to enjoy our pastries and lunches, featuring local meats and organic produce, have an organic locally roasted cup of coffee, and be a part of the community.  We want to host local musicians, be a place for artists and crafters to do demonstrations, have storytimes, lectures, knitting clubs....  The possibilities are vast, and the need in our town is great.


From the bottom of my heart I want to thank you for reading this.  If you can contribute, my sincerest thanks.  If you cannot, thank you for taking the time, and please help spread the word.

story:
A unique concept bringing elevated food to a take-away café and event space.


SOO N developed from small beginnings. What started as an earnest desire to share good food has developed into a food concept encompassing catering, jam/pantry retail, and event services.  With a background in fashion and fine arts, Saehee Cho endeavors to create food that engages with her artistic practice, sustainable food efforts, and seasonal flavors.  SOO N is interested in the entire scope and process of food making---from engaging with local farmers to meticulous menu planning; SOO N understands food as more than The Plate.

With the support of friends and believers in meaningful food, SOO N is looking to open a multi-function kitchen space : a take-away café by day and event space by night.  We want to host workshops and lectures.  We want to host cooking classes and make a creative space centered around food.  

Most of all, we want to feed you.  Think : Convenient market fresh lunches, the perfect warm pastry with your morning coffee, a quick dessert between errands . Think : Finger sandwiches with soft cheeses and stone fruit, big family style bowls of herb-y rice salad, the most seasonal fruit served with honeycomb and lavender yogurt.

Along with private funds, we will strategically allocate the $30,000 towards signing a lease on a commercial kitchen and event space in Los Angeles, furnishing the venue and creating a community space that seeks to not only feed but nourish.  



SOO N is a specialty food concept that hosts pop-up dinners, sells pantry products and caters special events. We need your help to open a brick-and-mortar take-away restaurant and event space in the heart of Los Angeles.

Our food has an emphasis on seasonal market ingredients--hand-picked, slow-cooked, and presented with the utmost care to create a meal that is both beautiful and delicious.

Each dish tells a story and every ingredient is chosen with care and precision from farmers and vendors that contribute to a sense of community that SOO N regards as a fundamental principle.




We are asking a lot from you, so we want to give back and say thank you by offering some amazing perks!

For $15  you can receive a digital copy of a Hand Drawn Recipe from our Kitchen


For $25 you will receive a printed Hand Drawn Recipe from our Kitchen
















There are inherent risks to opening any place of business. That’s why we have strategically gained momentum in other areas, including wholesale business and event catering. We are now confident in our abilities and are ready to take on a new challenge. Opening a brick-and-mortar space will allow us to create direct relationships with our supporters. It will give us a chance to create a dialogue on a more personal level to effectively cater a menu that provides exactly what our customers want. It will also give us the ability to take on additional events. With increased kitchen space and a permanent venue, we can host private events, workshops, tastings and classes, ultimately bringing people together to strengthen the sense of community in Los Angeles over an incredible meal. We will always strive to create a lasting impression that goes beyond a meal, celebrating creativity, community and good company.


SOO N has a big dream. With this money, you will have a hand in creating a space that you can visit and enjoy yourself. Along with private funding, this $30,000 will be contributing to:

·  Signing a lease on a commercial kitchen and event space in Los Angeles.

·  Purchasing industrial kitchen tools and appliances.

·  Creating a space that embodies the SOO N atmosphere, but has the ability to change with each event held at our venue.

·  Investing in tables, chairs, cutlery and linens.

·  Continuing to purchase high-quality ingredients from our local famers and market vendors, to provide our ever-changing, seasonal menus.

·  Providing a place for creative workshops, food & wine tastings and fantastic cooking classes.


We have experienced the greatest successes thus far by word-of-mouth. Informing the people around you of this exciting new venture is more than we could ask. SOO N products are also available for purchase on our website, and we are truly grateful for our loyal supporters. Lastly, we thank you for your support in promoting SOO N on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and all social media outlets.

story:
This started for me December 1st, 2005, ‘World AIDS Day’ when I suddenly realized I needed to find some of the most impoverished people in the world, leave my privileged life as a successful artist for a couple years, and go to Africa to do whatever I could to serve fellow human beings in their time of need. My intention was and still is to fearlessly thank the universe for always giving me what I truly need, and to have more of the wonders life has to offer, as I truly believe the more one gives - the more one gets!

I enrolled into a program with a nonprofit organization that trained me as a volunteer to use teaching, doing, and being the living example as a way of promoting positive changes that can be achieved by taking action. As volunteers we live together in the same community as the people who we together come up with solutions for the different situations one experiences living in poverty. We fill positions in schools, orphanages, or development projects with NGOs, and we share our experiences and build friendships with those who we help realize their worth. I took a position in a Teacher’s Training College in Mozambique for a year to provide me with practice to all I had come to learn and understand about poverty in a developing country during my training. Mozambique being one of the poorest countries (# 15 up from the poorest) is struggling to train much needed primary school teachers, builders, and farmers to help push the country into a more progressive future and get their foot onto the first rail of the economic ladder of growth.

It really is true that to teach one how to fish rather than to just give him a fish is a more sustainable way to empower people so that they have tools to lift themselves up out of poverty by their own efforts and improve their situation, but the ugly reality of extreme poverty is more complicated. People who are living without one or more of the basics we all need for a dignified life like; food, water, clothes, shelter, health and sanitation service, medical facilities, or access to education, have a very difficult time thinking and planning for the future when they are striving to get through another day constantly vulnerable to the next crisis.

My year in Mozambique was life changing for me, and my couple of years commitment to do what I can for others less fortunate than myself turned into a decade - now more determined and committed than ever. When I returned to the USA after my practice year at the Teacher’s Training College I started working for the non-profit organization that ran the program I had completed, and I started training the new volunteers. My students went to Mozambique, Belize, Malawi, and Zambia where they worked and contributed in the communities where they lived. It was a fulltime occupation running a boarding school/ training center and it was also very fulfilling, and a good place for me to continue to study, investigate, and prepare myself for what I am doing now.

Last year it became time for me to move back to Mozambique and commit myself in a much bigger way in the struggle that so many people have every day of their lives, and to use everything I’ve learned to contribute and initiate more positive changes. During a trip to Mozambique in 2012 I visited several schools and projects to meet with the leaders and make plans for my student’s practice periods, and I also had the opportunity to visit a friend who was working on a banana farm. The farm ‘Jacaranda’ was started up by a group of humanitarians who believe that by organizing and working together it is possible to create a better world by addressing injustices such as extreme poverty. The farm is located in the remote bush of northern Mozambique and the majority of workers who constitute the Jacaranda community and leadership have previous experiences in developmental projects such as AIDS education for prevention and teaching, while some of the workers are fresh from getting a degree in agriculture. The work they were doing and the way they were living really touched something in me and the idea of joining them would not leave me, so here I have completed 11 months of my 5 year agreement.

We are 32 people living on the farm and in addition we are hosting students from agriculture schools in groups of 5 to 10. We are located between the village of Napito and the Lurio River and we employ about 50 people full and part time from the surrounding communities. Being part of a socially conscious collective farm is very powerful in a country that can lack so much hope for so many people, and it is a great model and example of a very effective way for people to work together and improve their quality of life. I am the only person living on the farm who is not from Mozambique, and I am extremely grateful for having this opportunity. There is so much that I can do here in the nearby community of Napito with your help, and the support from the people who live here.

The money I am raising is to be used for upgrading the education and improve access to health service in Napito, and host activities in the community center over the next 4 years.

·  Build a new primary school that will serve as a community center - There are two government teachers in Napito but the school and resources are in great need.

·  Provide reliable transport to members of the community for emergency and scheduled trips to the hospital, and to bring locally produced goods and crafts to markets.   

·  Have the community center full of activities such as; courses, movies, classes, clubs, and workshops with actions such as building latrines, growing vegetables, exercise, yoga, and creating art, together with the educators who are working on the farm and the community of Napito.

·  Have an inventory of emergency medications for malaria, diarrhea, and dehydration.

I have been journaling about my experience and work in Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/anthony.nugent.77) as a way to communicate with my family, friends and anyone else who has an interest and it would be much appreciated and of great service to share this with your family and friends. I thank you in advance for coming here and reading about my plans for using our money to build something positive in our world that will impact the lives of the beautiful people who live in the village of Napito, Mozambique and beyond, and I invite and encourage you to come for a visit and be part of the activities.
story_txt:
This started for me December 1st, 2005, ‘World
AIDS Day’ when I suddenly realized I needed to find some of the most impoverished
people in the world, leave my privileged life as a successful artist for a
couple years, and go to Africa to do whatever I could to serve fellow human beings
in their time of need. My intention was and still is to fearlessly thank the
universe for always giving me what I truly need, and to have more of the
wonders life has to offer, as I truly believe the more one gives - the more one
gets!
I enrolled into a program with a nonprofit organization that
trained me as a volunteer to use teaching, doing, and being the living example as
a way of promoting positive changes that can be achieved by taking action. As
volunteers we live together in the same community as the people who we together
come up with solutions for the different situations one experiences living in poverty.

story:
Hurts So Good was launched in July 2014 with the hopes that we could launch not only a great tasting hot sauce in a time where hot sauces are one of the 10 fastest growing industries in America, but to also launch one of the cleanest Hot Sauces in America at a time where we can rarely be certain that the foods we are eating are not hurting us more than helping us. We have invested greatly into the gospel with our lives over the last 10 years and are believing that "Hurts So Good" is our return. We have worked expressly hard driving this new product over the past 11 months but find ourselves falling short in our goal to reach the masses. We have sold over 1750 bottles of our sauces in just one store in Atlanta Georgia over a ten month period. Those numbers are just unheard of for a specialty grocery product. Where we fall short is in getting these great sauces before the masses. We proved in Atlanta that if they taste it they will love it! That's where we need help! Advertising is difficult for a new company no matter how great the product. We will be getting into Bi-Lo grocery stores in July as well as Atlanta Region Ingles Groceries but we need to be able to promote heavily in order to get customers aware of "Hurts So Good" products as well as purchasing them to earn the right to keep the shelf space. We need help getting this great product to the public!  We have open communications with many of our largest groceries but we need to be sure we can meet the needs in an appropriate time frame.
Also we have two new favorites that our fans are waiting for us to produce, our Salsa Verdes are ready for FDA approval but this too cost money. Funding will allow us to get this new product FDA approved and produced.
Another goal is to locate a storage facility, purchase a delivery van which you can see in our photo archives, and also reach a point that we may be able to offer jobs to many in this area since work in East Tennessee is often difficult to find. We are growing but will soon need to expand in order to hire help. Currently the only thing that may hinder this project would be losing the chain groceries because we cannot meet the demand or properly advertise the product. Proper funding will also allow "Hurts So Good" to eventually lower costs across the board and get into more homes with the best Hot Sauce on the market today!

story:
We are a group that would like to do a really scary, really freaky, and terrifying haunted attraction for the people of Saint John NB and ticket sales from this haunted attraction will go to the Canadian Mental Health Association. 

We are currently raising money to get this project off the ground, we need funds to pay for the rent for the month of October for the location, the build of the attraction itself, and any other costs that come along with getting the project started. That's where you come in. 

There are a number of perks involved with donating to our campaign as you can see. So please help us to help the city of Saint John get freaked out in the weeks leading up to Halloween and in raising money and awareness for the Canadian Mental Health Association.

story:
What Drives Me

This start up was inspired by one time meeting of an elder woman who gave me advice that I didn't understand at the time, but made sense later in my life. As a healthcare professional that has been in the senior living industry for 10 years, I believe that our society underutilizes our elders in their vast knowledge. Miraldis Assisted Living LLC would provide individualized care with activities of daily living, meals, and companionship while maintaining as much independence as possible. The staff helps maintain independence thru a unique training module , which allows our elders to retain their dignity, which traditional senior living facilities can sometimes overlook. Let's give the elders in our society the quality of life they deserve.

What Makes Miraldis Different

I have developed the “See Me” Training Program, This program trains staff on safe, modified independent techniques for ADL’s, being able to recognizing functional decline, strategies for ease of life transitions, fosters encouragement for modified independence, and sensitivity training to see our elders for the people they are.....

Mission Statement

It is the mission of Assisted Living Homes LLC to proficiently care for seniors with limited functional disabilities by maintaining their highest quality of life in a safe residential environment.

Fund Today!!!

Your help at any level brings Miraldis Assisted Living one step closer to providing the quality of life care that the elders in our society deserve.

Seed funds will be used as follows:
Legally Establishing LLC Structure
Marketing/Promotion
Property Development
Staff Training Materials

story:
Our Story

Marigny Social Club offers unique, curated events, showcasing meals that are meant to be shared and enjoyed.


By helping Marigny Social Club take our operation to the next level, you’ll get to be part of an interactive fine dining experience that’s different from any other night out.


Marigny Social Club events feature menus with unexpected interpretations of traditional Southern flavors. In addition, we offer a Southern solution to meet a San Franciscan need: a meal that stands out among a crowded field of creative cuisine because it’s prepared thoughtfully, specifically for you, with the intention of inspiring social connection.


Marigny Social Club was founded in 2015 by Chef Caleb Cook, who moved to San Francisco in 2013. Caleb has been cooking professionally for 20 years. He trained under Chef Susan Spicer in New Orleans before opening St. Lawrence, in the French Quarter, in 2012. He loves working in San Francisco because of the city’s appreciation for unique food experiences. In a city where it’s so easy to enjoy a fantastic meal, Caleb noticed an opportunity: to provide innovative and accessible experiences that go beyond just exceptional food and presentation to connect diners to each other in a memorable way.  


Caleb’s vision to found Marigny Social Club has attracted other hospitality professionals in the Bay Area and beyond, whose combined expertise and personalities have made Marigny Social Club events so successful. Almost everyone who attends one of our events comes back again, and it’s those people who make Marigny Social Club special. Guests sit at a communal table, eat together, and enjoy conversation and ambiance that complements the food and theme.


What We Need



If successful, this campaign will fund our expansion to meet the already high demand for imaginative, supper club style events in San Francisco, including a year’s rental of a commercial kitchen, caterer permits, insurance, and other infrastructure costs. This campaign and its rewards include a presale for our forthcoming events calendar.


Our hope, and the primary goal of this campaign, is to pre-sell a percentage of seats for our 2016 events, and concentrate the season’s revenue in a way that allows us to make infrastructure improvements now.


What You Get 


Supporters of Marigny Social Club get the first chance to take part in our events and projects for 2016. We hope you’ll give us a try! Sample some of our favorite flavors, in the form of either jam or pickles, or be a part of one (or more) of our theme dinners. For larger donations, we’ll bring the party to you and your friends with catering for large and small events. All our rewards make great gifts. Share and enjoy!


Impact 


Marigny Social Club supports, and is supported by, a thriving community of diners. We’re lucky to be well-loved in the Bay Area and elsewhere, and we’re excited to spread the word and grow further. Your participation in this crowdfunding presale will allow us to scale our operation to meet the demand for innovative food events.


In San Francisco, the price of a restaurant meal often goes disproportionately to pay for real estate overhead. Marigny Social Club has significantly lower overhead expenses than a traditional restaurant, and your support goes directly towards allowing us to plan and execute better events — events you’ll be the first to attend. Your presale ticket price is highly competitive relative to a comparable meal in a restaurant, and more of it goes to the professionals who make it happen.


Marigny Social Club follows in the footsteps of a small number of similar ventures in San Francisco, who have generally enjoyed great success. Businesses like Marigny Social Club, once established, often sell out their events weeks in advance. Furthermore, this model fosters the financial livelihood and creative vision of food and beverage professionals in a way that makes it both timely and culturally significant in a city that so values fine dining.


Risks 


Because Marigny Social Club has demonstrated significant momentum in the market, and because of its low overhead and infrastructure costs, it avoids many of the potential risks and challenges associated with other food businesses like restaurants.


Potential delay in finding a suitable kitchen space is a possible challenge. Permitting can also be delayed by local government, which would result in an adjusted timeline for our events calendar.



Other Ways to Help


Your support means the world to us, financial or otherwise. Even if you can’t contribute to this campaign, we hope you’ll give us a shot and see what we have to offer. Visit one of our upcoming brunch events at Asiento, or share our information with a friend!

story:
Visit our website here!

www.abouit.eu

 

¿Que harías si conocieras las consecuencias del uso de tu desodorante en tu salud y el medio ambiente? ¿Seguirías bebiendo tu refresco habitual si supieras exactamente las consecuencias del E-320? ¿O del E-951, del E-133, del E-621 o del E-220...? ¿Cómo actuarías si supieras del trato abusivo que ejerce tu marca favorita a sus trabajadores?

En Abouit te ofrecemos la información necesaria para que evalúes las consecuencias de tus compras para tu salud, el medio ambiente, y para la sociedad en su conjunto.

 

 

What would you do if you knew the consequences on your health and on the environment of your deodorant? Would you still drink your favourite soft drink if you were aware of the consequences on your health of the E-320? ¿or the E-951, the E-133, the E-621...? How would you react if you knew how your favourite brand treats its employees? 

Abouit offers you the information you need to help you find healthy, green, & ethical products.

 

 

 

Descripción / Description 
 

Abouit es un comparador ético de productos de consumo. Dónde los productos no sólo son comparados por su precio. Sino que también se los compara por el impacto medioambiental que generan, por la política de responsabilidad social corporativa de la empresa que los fabrica y la que los comercializa, y por el impacto en la salud que tiene en quienes lo consumen.
story_txt:
Visit our website here!www.abouit.eu ¿Que harías si conocieras las consecuencias del uso de tu desodorante en tu salud y el medio ambiente? ¿Seguirías bebiendo tu refresco habitual si supieras exactamente las consecuencias del E-320? ¿O del E-951, del E-133, del E-621 o del E-220...? ¿Cómo actuarías si supieras del trato abusivo que ejerce tu marca favorita a sus trabajadores?En Abouit te ofrecemos la información necesaria para que evalúes las consecuencias de tus compras para tu salud, el medio ambiente, y para la sociedad en su conjunto.  What would you do if you knew the consequences on your health and on the environment of your deodorant? Would you still drink your favourite soft drink if you were aware of the consequences on your health of the E-320? ¿or the E-951, the E-133, the E-621...? How would you react if you knew how your favourite brand treats its employees? Abouit offers you the information you need to help you find healthy, green, & ethical products.   
Descripción / Description  Abouit es un comparador ético de productos de consumo. Dónde los productos no sólo son comparados por su precio. Sino que también se los compara por el impacto medioambiental que generan, por la política de responsabilidad social corporativa de la empresa que los fabrica y la que los comercializa, y por el impacto en la salud que tiene en quienes lo consumen.
 Abouit is an ethical comparison shopping website which rates consumer products. We rate products not only by price. But also by their impact on the Environment, by the Corporative Social Responsibility of the company which produces and sells them, and by the impact they have on the Health of those ones who consume them. 
 
 

 
¿Para que necesitamos el dinero? / 
Why do we need money?
Queremos ofrecer más análisis de productos, mucha más información sobre todos ellos y todos sus puntos (argumentos, causas de las puntuaciones, ejemplos, certificados, etc…)
Hasta ahora, nos hemos basado en información sumamente rigurosa, pero pública. Sólo analizada según unos pocos parámetros de los que constan nuestras metodologías. Y pretendemos poder acceder a la información necesaria cómo para poder analizar a los productos desde todas las perspectivas y parámetros hasta los que queremos llegar.Ayúdanos a poder acceder y analizar más parámetros para los 3 balances principales de Abouit. Para poder ofrecer una información que cubra los 360º de cada uno de los temas/balances.Utilizaremos parte de los recursos para desarrollar el prototipo la App. Y todas las personas que contribuyan a la campaña serán Beta-Testers de la App dos meses antes de su lanzamiento.
 
 
We want to offer more analysis of more products and more information about them. 
Right now we've based our ratings on rigorous public information. Our methodologies pretend to go far beyond. To achieve this we need to access to deeper information to be able to analyze products in every single aspect.
Help us to get access and analyze more parameters of the 3 main indicators of Abouit.
if we overcome the initial quantity we are asking for we will use the resources to develop our mobile app. ¿Cómo lo harémos? / 
How will we do it?
 

  
Abouit es una plataforma multi-device. Una App móvil y una Website de fácil navegación dónde el usuario podrá acceder a la información de los productos analizados por Abouit de una forma clara e intuitiva. Y podrá comprarlos si lo desea, y en un futuro, un porcentage de la compra del producto efectuada en la mayoría de los e-commerce que comparemos sus productos, irá destinado a una ONG a elección del usuario.
Además a través de la App también se fomentará y potenciará una red social de consumidores responsables, permitirá a los usuarios consultar los productos con solo escanear su código de barras. Y ofreceremos recetas en las que dedicaremos especial atención a los utensilios utilizados en la cocción de los alimentos para reducir las migraciones de productos nocivos. Y a la vez, ofreceremos herramientas para no comprar más alimentos de los que se van a poder consumir.
 
Abouit is a multi-device platform. An App and Website easy to use where the user has access to information of products analysed by Abouit in an easy and intuitive way.
Using the App the user will also be able to join a community of responsible consumers and access to the product information by only scanning its bar-code.
 
 
 
 
  
  
 
 

Metodologías únicas / Unique methodologies

 
Las puntuaciones de los productos se elaborarán a partir de metodologías únicas realizadas por instituciones, ONG's, y centros de investigación de referencia en cada uno de sus ámbitos de acción, para que puedas saber de la forma más completa posible sus efectos en el medio ambiente, en la sociedad, y en la salud.  
We elaborate product ratings using unique scientific methodologies made by Institutions, NGOs, and research centres which are amongst the most important on their scopes. All for you to know more about the impact they have on the environment, the society and on your health.  

Para el análisis de las políticas de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa contamos con la experiencia, la independencia y el rigor de Economistas Sin  Fronteras. Quiénes son la entidad con más experiencia y prestigio en España a la hora de hacer este tipo de estudios. Además los análisis de RSC de las empresas están diseñados según estándares mundiales como ISO, GRI, OSHAS y la matriz de la Economía del Bien Común. 
 
 
To implement the Corporative Social Responsibility analysis we have the expertise, the independence and rigour of different experts and NGOs like Economists Without Borders (Spain). Who are the entity with more experience and prestige in Southern Europe doing this sort of evaluations. The CSR analysis we use were designed based on worldwide standards like ISO, GRO, OSHAS amongst other.

   
Para el análisis del Impacto Medioambiental de los productos trabajamos con el ICTA (Instituto de Ciencia y Tecnologías Ambientales) adscrito a la Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona y el tercer centro de referencia a nivel mundial en el estudio de impactos medioambientales de actividades humanas. Quiénes estudiarán el ciclo de vida completo de los productos que analizarán. Con tal de alcanzar el máximo rigor y exigencia a la hora de puntuar éste impacto medioambiental del producto también se considerarán factores como huella de carbono, huella hídrica, consumo energético, material utilizados y eco-diseño del producto.
 
To calculate the Impact on the Environment of the products, we work together with ICTA(Institute of Environmental Sciences and Technologies) which is part of the Universitat Autónoma de Barcelona. It is the third centre in the world studying environmental impacts of human activities. They analyse the complete life cycle of the product. In order to reach the highest level of rigour and exigency when rating this environmental impact of products, we will also take in consideration factors like carbon footprint, water footprint, energy consumption, used materials and eco-design of the products.
   

Y, por último, para el análisis del Impacto en la Salud de los productos contamos con la experiencia y el rigor  de la Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona y la Universitat Rovira i Virgili. Además contamos con laboratorios fisico-químicos propios, para poder analizar producto por producto de una forma exhaustiva las características especificas de los alimentos y productos de cosmética. Estos laboratorios se encuentran en Mollet del Vallès y Vilanova i la Geltrú y están gestionados por nuestro socio comercial Inkemia. Para llevarlos a cabo se tendrán en cuenta aspectos nutricionales, riegos químicos(migrantes, contaminantes, compuestos presentes...) y  alérgenos entre otros. Éstos serán ponderados según su peligrosidad y sus potenciales consecuencias para los consumidores. Todo ello según las últimas investigaciones científicas más rigurosas e independientes. And the last one, the Impact on Health. To rate the products this way we have the expertise and rigour of the Universitat Autónoma de Barcelona and Universitat Rovira i Virgili. We use our own laboratories to evaluate the products with complete independence. This laboratories are in Vilanova i la Geltru (Barcelona) and are run by our commercial partner Inkemia. To evaluate this products we take in consideration nutritional factors, chemical risks (migrants, contaminants, compounds), and allergens. This aspects will be rated by their dangerousness and their potential consequences on the health of those who consume them.

story:
We all know the benefits and opportunities that come from being a sister of Sigma Delta Tau.  Being a sister of Sig Delt provides women with the opportunity to grow into their own, find a voice, and build a community. That being said, in order to have engaging, fun, or groundbreaking programs, the chapter depends highly on dues. However, the chapter recognizes that not every women has the financial means to pay this substantial fee. As this wonderful group of women continues to expand, we are spearheading rallies, planning bigger events to accommodate our size, and planning larger scale programs forcing us to raise our new member dues. Financial needs should never be a burden to achieving this sisterhood, but ultimately prevent many girls from joining Greek Life. 

Help us start a movement to allow every women to find their family. The executive board of the Gamma Delta chapter has decided to create a New Member Scholarship fund to subsidize the cost of joining our chapter for at least one new member that demonstrates financial need. Now we are looking to you. Sigma Delta Tau provide each and everyone one of you with something unique. This is your opportunity to empower a new generation of strong women to have the same family, community, and power of their voice that you experienced in college and beyond. Sisterhood is more than four years. 

#CrΣΔΤingopportunity

story:
Estelle Servanin, 38 ans, souffre de fibromyalgie sévère, encépholomyélite myalgique sévère (fatigue chronique) et hypersensibilité environnementale.

Elle a des réactions excessives, qui s’apparentent à des allergies à des contaminants de toutes sortes, comme les moisissures, les parfums, les cigarettes et l’exposition au rayonnement électromagnétique.

Considérée comme un cas extrême, Estelle Servanin est confinée chez elle depuis trois ans. Elle ne peut pas travailler et reçoit des prestations de l’aide sociale.

Elle lutte depuis un long moment pour faire reconnaître ses droits afin d'obtenir des équipements et des soins nécessaires à sa survie et pour améliorer sa condition de vie.

Cependant, Le ministère de l'Emploi et de la Solidarité sociale refusent de lui payer ce dont elle a besoin, car au Québec, l'hypersensibilité environnementale n'est pas reconnue comme une maladie. Pourtant, en Nouvelle-Écosse et en Ontario, l'hypersensibilité environnementale est reconnue comme telle et elle est prise en charge par le système de santé. De plus cette condition est reconnue par la Charte des droits et libertés canadienne.

Ayant été touché par son histoire qui a fait l'objet d'un reportage à l'émission La Facture du 24 février 2015 ( http://ici.radio-canada.ca/tele/la-facture/2014... avons décidé de lui offrir de l'aide en faisant une campagne de financement dans le but d'amasser suffisamment de fonds pour couvrir les divers équipements et soins qu'elle a besoin de façon assez urgente et pour ses besoins pour la prochaine année, le temps que ses recours devant les divers instances gouvernementales soient entendus, ce qui peut prendre des mois voir même des années, sans savoir si elle gagnera sa cause.

Il est inconcevable et inhumain qu'un Gouvernement laisse tomber Estelle (comme il le fait avec bien d'autres citoyens dans le besoin) alors qu'elle souffre et qu'elle doit prendre le peu d'énergie qu'elle a pour se battre pour sa survie et ses droits.

SVP, aidez-nous à atteindre notre objectif en appuyant financièrement ou en dons d'équipements qui peuvent lui être utiles.

Toutes les sommes recueillis serviront aux achats et aux dépenses suivantes:

- un concentrateur d'oxygène portable; 

- achat d'un médicament soit le MTHF qui coûte

450 $ par mois (non couvert);

-échangeur d'air avec filtres spécialisés pour l'hypersensibilité environnementale

- matelas spécialisé;

- rideaux et matériaux de blindage contre les radio-fréquences;

- traitement en ostéopathie à domicile;

- soins médicaux en clinique environnementale;

- suppléments alimentaires et médicinales;

- filtres à eau ;

- sofa spécialisé pour l'hypersensibilité environnementale;

- nourriture biologique et sans gluten

- etc.

NOTE 1: Tous les besoins d'Estelle sont appuyés par des médecins et prescrits par ceux-ci; vérification faite et preuves à l'appui.

NOTE 2: Si vous avez une entreprise spécialisée et vous désirez faire un don d'équipement, de nourriture, de suppléments, etc., contactez-nous pour prendre les arrangements.

TOUS LES DONS SONT ACCEPTÉS!

Merci de tout coeur!

Linda MacCulloch et Denise Thiffault, organisatrices de la campagne

Pour des dons autres qu'en argent, contactez-nous par courriel à l'adresse suivante: lmacculloch2014@gmail.com

PHOTO: Radio-Canada émission La Facture

story:
GAIA'S GARDEN LOVE FOOD


           Bed & Breakfast + Organic Cafe


                 MOTHER EARTH WISDOM INSPIRED.
     (lee nuestra version en español al final del texto)

Gaia's Garden Love Food is a worker owned Bed & Breakfast & Organic Cafe in the Heart of Santa Teresa, Costa Rica

Once Opened we will offer all organic plant based meals, cold pressed juices, in house blended apothecary teas, superfood elixirs, smoothies and abundance of other treats; while also offering cleansing programs + workshops to the community.

WE are currently fundraising for start up cost, to open our doors for October 2015.

We are doing what it takes to make sure the community of Santa Teresa & visitors, can enjoy high vibrational, organic meals, On the Go.


"WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR ANY CONTRIBUTION THAT YOU MAKE. CHECK OUT THE GIFTS WE ARE OFFERING IN RETURN FOR YOUR SUPPORT."

Our Vision.
We all share passion for local, organic healthy food products, that have the potential of  enhancing the lifestyle of its costumers (including all forms of health & well being)
Creation.
Gaia's Garden Love Food produces a variety of plant based food products including freshly prepared soups, salads & wraps, hot & cold super food elxirs, smoothies, fresh cold pressed juices, herbal tea blends & cold pressed coffee drinks, raw vegan desserts & snacks, Fresh baked goods, fresh pasta, fresh seeds & nut milk, granola & healthy  energy balls & bars.
We are always looking  outside for inspiration!!!

                  ♡ LOVE FOR THE EARTH = LOVE FOR ALL ♡

Our love for Gaias's roots deeply into her nourishing soil, nurturing the seeds to grow the food that give us essential energy we need to thrive as vibrant human beings. We deeply believe that food cultivated and prepared with love and respect for the environment, people and animals; not only tastes amazing, but carries a high vitality- kind of “love vibration” to it. So if the saying: “you are what you eat”, is right (it really is), then by eating this food, you truly are being fueled by LOVE! It’s all about reciprocity - we give love to the Earth and the Earth gives love back to us! When we are fueled by love, we have the capacity to live radiant, fulfilling lives and inspire others to do the same. It’s a love-feedback-loop of awesomeness that can change the world.

From the bottom of our hearts and the roots of Gaia,THANK YOU so much for your love and support and for contributing to a reality of LOVE for all beings and the planet. 
GAIA LOVES YOU!



GAIA'S GARDEN LOVE FOOD es un Bed & Breakfast y Cafe Orgánico en el corazón de Santa teresa, Costa Rica.
Una vez abierto serviremos todo orgánico, comidas a base de plantas, jugos prensados en frío, tés saludables mezclados & preparados  aquí mismo, batidos y una abundante variedad de snacks; también ofreceremos programas de limpieza/ayunos a base de jugos de vegetales, frutas, hierbas y raíces sagradas. Organizaremos talleres de permacultura para la comunidad & tendremos nuestra propia huerta In Situ.
ESTAMOS EN EL PROCESO DE JUNTAR FONDOS PARA EL ARRANQUE INICIAL, PARA ABRIR NUESTRAS PUERTAS EN OCTUBRE 2015. Estamos haciendo lo necesario para asegurarnos que la comunidad de Santa Teresa & sus visitantes puedan disfrutar de comidas orgánicas con alta vibración en su paso por Gaia's Garden.
ESTAMOS MUY AGRADECIDOS POR CUALQUIER CONTRIBUCION QUE PUEDAN HACER. CHEQUEEN NUESTROS REGALOS, ES NUESTRA RETRIBUCION POR SER NUESTRO SOPORTE.

                           ♡AMOR X LA TIERRA=AMOR X TODOS♡
NUESTRO AMOR POR LAS RAICES DE LA TIERRA VAN MUY PROFUNDO EN SU SUELO NUTRITIVO. NUTRIR LAS SEMILLAS PARA CULTIVAR LOS ALIMENTOS QUE NOS DAN LA ENERGIA ESCENCIAL QUE NECESITAMOS PARA PROSPERAR COMO SERES HUMANOS VIVOS. ESTAMOS PROFUNDAMENTE CONVENCIDOS DE QUE LOS ALIMENTOS CULTIVADOS Y PREPARADOS CON AMOR & RESPETO POR EL MEDIO AMBIENTE, LAS PERSONAS & LOS ANIMALES; NO SOLO TIENEN UN SABOR INCREIBLE SINO QUE CON LLEVA UN ALTO GRADO DE VITALIDAD, "DE VIBRACION DE AMOR". ASI QUE SI EL DICHO "ERES LO QUE COMES" ES CORRECTO...(LO QUE REALMENTE ES)ENTONCES CONSUMIENDO ESTA COMIDA CONCIENTES,  REALMENTE ESTAN SIENDO LLENADOS DE AMOR!!! SE TRATA DE RECIPROCIDAD. LE DAMOS AMOR A LA TIERRA & LA TIERRA NOS LO DA DE VUELTA.
CUANDO ESTAMOS ALIMENTADOS POR AMOR, TENEMOS LA CAPACIDAD DE VIVIR RADIANTES, DE TENER VIDAS COMPLETAS E INSIPIRAR A OTROS A DESENVOLVERSE DE LA MISMA FORMA.  ES UNA CADENA DE AMOR DE RETROALIMENTACION DE GENIALIDAD  QUE PUEDE CAMBIAR EL MUNDO.

DESDE EL FONDO DE NUESTROS CORAZONES Y LAS RAICES DE GAIA, MUCHAS GRACIAS POR SU AMOR, SU APOYO Y POR CONTRIBUIR A UNA REALIDAD DE AMOR POR TODOS LOS SERES & EL PLANETA.
                                                 GAIA=TIERRA
                                          GARDEN=JARDIN

                                          GARDEN=JARDIN

story:
Our wearable art looks like silver and gold jewelry, but they're actually temporary tattoos inspired by Haitian traditions, easily applied with water.

        


Ritual Art Tattoos stay on your skin for 4 to 6 days, or you can simply remove them with baby oil.  

They're the perfect accessory for the beach, pool, festivals or a night out and will be a huge trend this summer!


 Each sheet will retail for $25. Get 2 for $30 today by selecting your contribution and perk to the right.

Are YOU festival ready? We include free worldwide shipping, including Haiti and the UK.


                              

Not only will you receive XL sheets of Haitian-inspired  gold and silver tattoos, you also will launch Ritual Art as a company. It's time to help us spread unique beauty that gives back. 


A portion of every Ritual Art sale will given to our partners who provide access to clean water and jobs for Haitian women. Ritual Art is excited to partner with SIMBI and Aqua Haiti to make wearable art with a social impact!

SIMBI Inc. currently includes a clothing line, and a hair accessory line and each piece is hand made in Haiti. Each bracelet sold purifies 1 gallon of water/day. Clean water is the key to save lives, improve lives, and empower lives and hopefully eradicate the cholera outbreak that surfaced in Haiti several years ago.


So, are you ready to join the ritual?

It's time to get YOUR sheets of the first-ever Ritual Art Temporary Tattoos! Each  8x10" sheet includes over 15 temp tattoos inspired by Haitian veve symbols.

 Make them your own and show the world the unique beauty Haiti inspires. Show us how you wear your Ritual Art on Instagram and Facebook with #jointheritual 

Welcome to the Ritual

Here's exactly what we need funding for and what you will get as a contributor:

  • We need to raise $10,000 in 40 days. The funding you provide will go towards printing stunning Haitian-inspired temporary tattoos in silver and gold, like the ones shown in the pitch video and photos here. 

    •                        


  • We also need to cover the cost of  promotion, operation costs, photography, Indigogo's 9% fees, and to launch Ritual Art as a company in Canada and Haiti. 

  • By pre-ordering the tattoos at discounted, pre-market prices you will get to be an angel investor who is paid in one-of-a-kind wearable art.
  • Select your perk and we will send you Ritual Art Tattoos in time for summer.
       

    Fun fact! Custom silver and gold metallic tattoos like the ones we want to make are 5xs more expensive to print than regular temporary tattoos. Production gets more pricey as the page size increases.

    In order to bring you the most beauty, we will print on 8x10"  sheets rather than smaller 5x7" used by other companies. Let's make it happen, together!


    Meet the team

    Hello there! I'm Amanacer, the Canadian-born, Haitian-raised artist and designer of Ritual Art.

    Here's the skinny.

                                       

    Since the age of seven when my family relocated from Canada to Port-au-Prince, I have been grateful to be nourished and formed by Haiti's rich culture (dance, art, music, language, voodoo, you name it). 

    I'm passionate about art and social development, especially when they're combined in an original (sexy) product like wearable art. After painting in oil and mixed media for 20 years, I'm ready to transform my Haitian-inspired art into silver and gold temporary tattoos, like nothing the world has seen before. Unless you haven't noticed, it's called Ritual Art!

    This is Sebastian. He's an engineer by day and Ritual Art's graphic design guru by night. He handles the business side of this business while I (Amanacer) get to manage the creative front. Together, with your help, we are ready to unleash the magic of our collaboration on the world.

    Meet Cyandra! The first Ritual Art Ambassador and our model-muse featured in the upcoming Spring | Summer 2015 Lookbook. 

    Here's a behind the scenes moment from out pitch video compiled by the talented duo Danyel Tremblay and Kamara Morozuk. Check it out to see the team in full action, bringing this dream to life.


                    

     What's next?

If we don't reach our entire $10,000 goal the funds will be used to send you  as many reward tattoos as possible, and to support the important work of SIMBI and Aqua Haiti in providing jobs and clean water to Haitian communities.

The Impact

  • Pre-order the premiere collection today and for the first time you will be able to show off metallic temp tattoos that are not Aztek, Navaho or Egyptian symbols but rather inspired by current Haitian traditions.

  • Amanacer (Emily) spent her childhood and teenage years in Haiti and has been painting for 20 years, influenced by the artists and mentors she grew up with. This Ritual Art project will deliver Amanacer's exclusive Haitian-inspired designs to the world, celebrating Haiti through the very new and very sensual medium: silver and gold temporary tattoos. 

  • Through parters SIMBI and Aqua Haiti, Ritual Art will spread style, beauty and have a positive social impact on Haitian communities. These sister Haitian organizations were established by two Haitian friends after the 2010 earthquake, to expand access to clean water and provide economic opportunities for Haitian women and we are excited to be able to contribute to their important work. Get your temp tattoos and make it happen!


Risks & Challenges

Like you, we value  transparency and want to follow where our money goes! The Ritual Art team expects the unexpected when it comes to facing challenges along the way. Whether it's extra costs for product distribution or time crunches in getting the product to you this summer in time for festival season. We are dedicated to finding creative, effective solutions to each and every hurdle that may  pop up and guarantee we will keep an open line of communication with you, our backers, to let you know the latest.

Other Ways You Can Join the Ritual

One of the best ways you can contribute is spreading our story to your friends and across your personal network:

  • Please continue spreading the beauty and make some noise about this  one-of-a-kind campaign in your networks.
  • It's easy to use the Indiegogo share tools! Please send an email with the link to five friends, share our story on FB or whatever you're into :)
  • Ask to become a Ritual Art Ambassador and/or tag your photos with #jointheritual

Meet the Ritual Art Ambassadors

Riva Nyri Precil

Riva Nyri Precil is half Haitian and half Irish/Russian. She was born in Brooklyn, New York and moved to Haiti at the age of 5, where she resided for 10 years. While in Haiti, Riva was exposed to traditional Haitian music and culture, which greatly influenced her eclectic music and fashion palette. She studied acting, Haitian folkloric and modern dance, and art and sculpture. 

Riva can be found teaching Haitian folkloric dance classes to minority children in Public Schools in Brooklyn. She also wrote a children's book in Haitian Creole entitled "Anaelle ak Lasiren" which will be available in late 2015. She currently resides in Brooklyn, New York and recently released her debut solo album "Perle De Culture" which is a fusion of traditional Haitian songs, soul, R&B, African tones, and jazz elements available here. You can find her jewelry designs here at LoveNyri.com
She is excited to join Cyandra and the other Ritual Art Ambassadors who are spreading the unique beauty Haiti inspires! 

The Ritual Art team is so excited you came by and we hope you feel the love as this dream comes true. Hallelujah. Ayibobo. 

Thank you for getting on board and showing off your Ritual Art temp tattoos! Mesi. Nou apresye sipo nou anpil!

Photo credits: Kamara Morozuk and images courtesy of SIMBI Inc.

water.          


Ritual Art Tattoos stay on your skin for 4 to 6 days, or you can simply remove them with baby oil.  
They're the perfect accessory for the beach, pool, festivals or a night out and will be a huge trend this summer!



 Each sheet will retail for $25. Get 2 for $30 today by selecting your contribution and perk to the right.

Are YOU festival ready? We include free worldwide shipping, including Haiti and the UK. 

                               


Not only will you receive XL sheets of Haitian-inspired  gold and silver tattoos, you also will launch Ritual Art as a company. It's time to help us spread unique beauty that gives back. 

A portion of every Ritual Art sale will given to our partners who provide access to clean water and jobs for Haitian women. Ritual Art is excited to partner with SIMBI and Aqua Haiti to make wearable art with a social impact!

eradicate the cholera outbreak that surfaced in Haiti several years ago.

story:
What We're All About

We have always been surrounded by small businesses and entrepreneurs. They are our parents, friends, aunts and uncles. We learn from them every day, from how they pour their passion into their businesses, and from their hard work and energy. They support our communities. Now we want to help support them!

We are MíByz, a home-grown startup in Hamilton, Ontario. When we talk to small business owners and managers (often our friends and family), we hear about common challenges they all face. Almost every time we think, "We can help with that." And now we're going to by offering fun, effective, and affordable elearning solutions for those same owners and managers, as well as their employees!

We have already started our website. Most of it is waiting for our launch date (we want to start releasing beta courses this summer), but you can still check it out!

What We Need & What You Get

We don't want to make just any courses. We want to make interactive and engaging elearning tools that go beyond theory, and help learners apply concepts to their own businesses. To do this, we need to purchase Articulate Storyline 2, which is special software for elearning development that will help us create real solutions for real people! Most of the funds we get here will help realize that goal. The rest of it will help kickstart our online marketing communications so that the world knows that we are here to help.

The Impact

Our management courses will focus on topics such as:

  • Retail space optimization
  • Selecting a product mix
  • Finding and hiring good employees
  • Developing a business strategy
  • Writing an orientation and training manual
  • Strategic pricing and promotions
We also want to make mini-modules for small business employees. These could include:
  • How to engage a customer
  • Customer accessibility
  • Professional acumen
  • Closing a sale
And more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help, but can't contribute? You can still be a part of making our vision a reality! Share this campaign with your friends and family; help spread the word!

Thank you so much for your help! We couldn't do it without you.

story:
We want to provide affordable web hosting and website creation

For the past two years my team and I, based out of Toronto, have created and hosted websites for businesses and individuals. In that brief time, website design has progressed more than it has in the past ten years. We believe that a vast number of websites would benefit substantially from an upgrade to a modern standard that better suits their brands and identities.

To that end we are rebranding and relaunching our company as EdgeFox, a provider of web hosting and website creation services. We aim to create high-impact and high-caliber websites while maintaining affordability for our clients. Our team believes that your brand deserves a website that will match your brand's quality. We specialize in upgrading obsolete websites into modern ones, and for those who do not already have a website, we offer full service website creation and hosting that will be up to the modern standard.

We offer a better solution for businesses and individuals than other web hosts since our relationship doesn't end when you buy hosting. We follow through with our clients and offer to assist you by creating your websites for you without the unneeded stress of having to do it yourself. At EdgeFox, our relationship doesn't end when you buy a hosting package.

For our launch, we are raising money to pay for new web designs, new software, and a new server provider.

  • Will you help us in time for our  launch in April? 
  • You will help us bring affordable, high-caliber web hosting and web design to the world.
  • You will help us offer our services to a diverse group of clients including non-profits, corporations, small businesses, and individuals.

What We Need

We need $7,500 to have the ability to afford new hosting space for our clients, to purchase the rights to a diverse number of designs and tools, as well as supply ourselves with the software we need in order to be an effective platform for hosting. Here is the breakdown:

Hosting Space - $4,000
Designs and Tools - $2,000
Software - $1,500

Any additional funding will go toward marketing, development, and offering promotions for potential clients. Part of our funding will come from private investment, and the rest we're hoping you will help us with.


What You'll Get

We have a series of items lined up to offer as part of the incentive to contribute to our campaign, including shirts, USB sticks, posters, and free hosting for one year. 


$15 - UNLIMITED HOSTING - ONE MONTH | A $15 donation gets you one month's worth of shared hosting on our servers and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$25 - EDGEFOX 8GB USB STICK | A $25 donation gets you a sweet EdgeFox USB stick with 8 GB of storage and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$35 - EDGEFOX SHIRT | A $35 donation gets you a screen printed t-shirt, so that you can show your support for EdgeFox, and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$45 - EDGEFOX POSTER | A $45 donation gets you a quality printed 24x36" poster with our logo on it and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$55 - EDGEFOX SHIRT & USB STICK | A $55 donation gets you a screen printed t-shirt, the 8 GB USB stick from the first perk and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$85 - EDGEFOX SHIRT, USB STICK & POSTER | An $85 donation gets you a screen printed t-shirt, the 8 GB USB stick, our branded poster and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$100 - UNLIMITED HOSTING - ONE YEAR | A $100 donation gets you an entire year's worth of shared web hosting on our servers and an official EdgeFox lanyard.


$500 - BECOME A WEB GURU | A $500 donation gets you a screen printed t-shirt, the 8 GB USB stick, our branded poster and an official EdgeFox lanyard. You will receive one year of shared hosting on our servers. It also gives you the option to have your name and/or business listed on our website as a supporter of our business venture. Also, you will receive a signed and personalized letter from the CEO.




Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any spare cash today? Please help us spread the word by: 

  • Sharing our campaign with other on social media.  
  • Share this link to your email, facebook, twitter, instagram or by word of mouth.

story:
These Kids Deserve to Get Education, Food & Health.
 You can help them by giving two minutes of your busy life and donating as low as $1 USD to this noble cause. But that's totally your choice. If you can't donate money just help them by spreading the message by sharing the webpage.
Remember even a One Dollar Can Make a Difference to Their Life.

Your donation will give these kids FOOD, Education, Shelter, Career

We do not just want to donate some food to these kids and leave them in their situation, but beside giving food we want to give these kids a guardian who will help them to stand on their legs and become educated and independent and create a chain of helping hands to help other kids like them.

We hope you understand the needs of these kids.

Please help these Kids by Donating a little amount and sharing this page with your friend.
