story:
Click Here for English


Mi nombre es Alfonsina Maldonado, soy atleta paralímpica en la disciplina de adiestramiento ecuestre. Estoy convencida que todos los sueños son alcanzables por muchas barreras que haya en el camino. Hoy entreno para llegar a Río 2016.

Te invito a conocerme...

Nací en Florida, Uruguay el 9 de diciembre de 1984. Seis meses después, el 1ero de mayo de 1985 cambiaría mi vida para siempre: la habitación donde dormía mientras mi familia cenaba con amigos se incendió. 

Al ser un día de tormenta, no había electricidad en la casa en ese momento, por lo que mi madre dejó una vela encendida cerca de mi cuna, sin pensar en lo que sucedería después. La vela cayó al suelo prendiendo fuego a todo lo que había alrededor incluyendo mi cuna. Cuando oyeron mi llanto, ya estaba en llamas. Rápidamente me llevaron mis padres a Urgencias en el Hospital Militar de Montevideo para salvar mi vida. Estuve 32 días en coma y no había esperanza de vida alguna. La quemadura era de primer grado pero abarcaba todo el lado izquierdo de mi cuerpo y cabeza, tanto así que perdí la mano izquierda. Días después de despertar del coma, pasé a “la burbuja” donde viví un año y medio y posteriormente en la Unidad de Quemados del mismo hospital hasta mis 5 años, ya que estaba en un coma inducido, que es un tratamiento para quemados.                         

A partir de esta edad comencé a hacer lo que se puede llamar vida normal, es decir, empecé mis estudios en la Escuela Rural número 105, Costas de Arias, en Florida, cerca de mi casa. Mi vida se dividía entre hospitales, mi casa y la escuela. Crecí así, entre tratamientos, cirujanos, psicólogos, fisioterapeutas, hospitales… Mi única motivación para salir adelante eran los caballos. Tanto así que si los médicos o las enfermeras que no me hablaban de caballos no me dejaba hacer nada. Siempre decía a mi cirujano, el Doctor Arcos, que de grande sería una gran amazona y que representaría a mi país, a lo que él respondía con compadecencia.

Terminé mis estudios de Secundaria en la misma escuela y para cursar Bachillerato me trasladé a Florida. Fue allí donde empezaron los problemas: me sentía observada, juzgada, sentía rabia por la gente que se quejaba por tonterías y empecé a valorar lo que es la vida, el dolor y la enseñanza que puedes transmitir con tu incapacidad. Empecé a ser consciente de todo por lo que había pasado en mi vida y a valorarla, a quererme, a aceptarme a mí misma y a mi discapacidad, a entender que era algo que no tenía solución y que me acompañaría toda la vida. Descubrí que puedes ayudar a mucha gente siendo un ejemplo de superación personal así que dedicaba mi tiempo libre a la lucha de mis propios sueños, retándome a mí misma y demostrando que todo se puede si hay voluntad.

Me gradué de Bachillerato en la Escuela de Avicultura de Florida con el título de Técnico Agropecuario. Después empecé la carrera de Veterinaria en la Universidad de la República de Uruguay pero no era lo que yo esperaba así que comencé a estudiar Gastronomía y paralelamente hacía un curso en la Escuela de Equitación del Ejército Uruguayo para ser instructora de Equinoterapia. Cada vez me daba cuenta que lo que yo quería de verdad era montar a caballo para cumplir mis metas, contrariamente a lo que todos los de mi alrededor me decían. Nunca creyeron que fuese capaz de llegar donde quería llegar: ser una amazona paralímpica internacional y representar a mi país. Así que decidí dejarlo todo y tomar un avión a Europa, a cumplir mis sueños.
           
Al principio me costó encontrar trabajo, ya que no me creían capaz de sobrellevar todas las tareas (que eran casi puramente físicas). Poco a poco me fui ganando la confianza y el cariño de la gente en Cataluña. Trabajé en la Hípica Raúl Llorens Vila en Olot, en el club privado Mas Caterina en Madremaña, con Claire van Gelder en Equipassió cerca de San Feliu de Guixols y posteriormente en la Yeguada del Lago en Caldes de Malavella durante 5 años. Es allí donde conocí a Fandango, mi campeón.

Empecé a entrenar con Fandango para los Juegos Olímpicos Londres 2012. Mi sueño estaba a punto de cumplirse con la ayuda de mis entrenadores Álvaro Almiñana Poquet y Linda Swande, y varios sponsors tanto uruguayos como europeos. Pero llegar a los Juegos Olímpicos no fue tan fácil, el nivel era altísimo y mi entrenamiento comenzó tarde aunque la falta de recursos económicos era el factor principal. Hicimos todo lo posible y más y aún así nos quedamos a dos puntos de clasificar para el Ranking.

Actualmente, gracias a  mi  perseverancia  por alcanzar mis metas, me he ganado el cariño de la gente de mi país y de muchos otros, no sólo como deportista, sino también como mujer emprendedora. He aparecido en varios medios de comunicación (radio, televisión, revistas, periódicos, notas informativas, noticias internacionales, etc.) y también en trabajos de imagen alguna vez, con los cuales quiero transmitir un mensaje: que la perfección no existe y que la belleza natural de una mujer se basa en su esencia y es eterna. Ahora estoy trabajando en diferentes proyectos  y participo en campañas mostrando otra imagen de la belleza femenina. Estoy dando charlas honorariamente en todo el país tratando de que mi ejemplo sirva a otros, esto es sumamente gratificante.

Gracias a que no he dejado de prepararme  y cuento con uno de los mejores entrenadores del mundo, Francisco Cancella de Abreu.  Esta vez tengo mucha fe de clasificar para los Juegos Olímpicos Río de Janeiro 2016, ya que cuento con un equipo de personas llenas de luz. Quiero seguir luchando por mis sueños y seguir sirviendo de inspiración para los demás.

Competir a nivel olímpico en la modalidad Dressage exige una armonía completa entre amazona y caballo. Ocho meses atrás comencé mi trabajo con ZigZag, un caballo con el que compartíamos, con solo mirarnos, la conciencia de un propósito ganador. Debido a una inesperada lesión, ZigZag no podrá competir más.

Quizás algunas personas piensen que este deporte es elitista, pero no lo es. La prueba de ello es mi propia experiencia de vida.

El caballo es uno de los íconos de la Patria Gaucha y de muchísimas historias que atraviesan todos los estamentos sociales, sin exclusión.

Ahora necesito un caballo nuevo, capaz de imbuirse en el objetivo de ser campeón olímpico y traer esta medalla para Uruguay y el resto de Latinoamérica.

Este caballo llevará también el emblema del “sí se puede“, la visión de que la discapacidad es una oportunidad, que la belleza va de la mano de los valores y que, sin trabajar duro, no es posible lograr un medioambiente sustentable.

Espero tu ayuda.



I'm Alfonsina Maldonado and I’m a Paralympic Athlete for the equestrian dressage discipline. I’m absolutely convinced that every dream can be achieved no matter how many barriers there are on the path. Now I’m training for Rio 2016.

I invite you to get to know me…

I was born in Florida, Uruguay, December 9th 1984. Six months later, May 1st 1985, my life will hardly change forever. The room where I was sleeping while my family was having dinner with some friends, caught fire. It was a stormy day and there was no electricity in the house, so my mum left a candle in my bedroom near my cot,  without ever imagine what may happened next. The candle fell on to the floor and burned everything around me, including my cot. When they heard my crying, I was already burned. My parents took me as fast as possible to the emergency at the Army Hospital of Montevideo in order to save my life.

I have been thirty two days in coma and there was no hope at all. The burnings were of first grade and they spanned through my body's left side including my head. They were so severe, that I lost my left hand.

A few days after waking up from the coma, I went into what I call the “bubble”, where I lived a year and a half; after this I was moved to the Burned Unit in the same hospital until I was five years old. For all these time I was in an induced coma for almost 5 years, receiving special treatment. From that moment on, I started doing what I we can call a normal life, that means beginning my studies at the Rural School number 105 “Costas de Arias”, which is located in Florida, nearby my house.

My life was divided between hospitals, home and school. I grew up like that, between treatments, surgeons, psychologist, physiotherapist and hospitals. My only motivation to go ahead were horses. So much so that if doctors or nurses didn´t talk to me about horses, I didn´t let myself being treated at all. I remember I always said to my surgeon, doctor Arcos, that when I grow up I'm going to be a great rider and that I´m going to represent my country; towards these he always gave me a petty answer.  

I finished my secondary studies in the same school, but I obtain my bachelor degree in a different school in Florida. It was right there were my problems began; I felt myself observed and judged, and couldn´t stand people complaining about foolishness; all these helped me to start valuing life itself, the pain and all the things I could learn and transmit from my disability. I became conscious of all I have been through in my life and I valued it, I started loving myself, accepting myself and my disability. I understood that it was something impossible to solve and that it was going to be with me for the rest of my life so I realized that I could help a lot of people by being an example of improvement and I decided to dedicate my spare time on fighting for my own dreams, challenging myself and showing people that everything is possible if there is a will.

I graduated from high school at the Florida School of Poultry under the title of Agricultural Technical. Later on I began studying Veterinary Medicine at the public university of Uruguay but it didn't turned out to be what I have expected so I started studying Gastronomy and at the same time I did a course at the Uruguayan riding army school for equine instructor; This only helped me realize that I needed to reach my goals. Nobody around me believed I was able to reach what I wanted: being an International Paralympic Amazon and representing my country. So I decided to quit everything and took a plane to Spain, to make my dreams come true. 

At first, it was very hard to find work because no one thought I was capable of doing all the stuff, which requires a lot of physical effort, but bit by bit I started gaining the confidence and affection of the people in Catalonia. I worked in Raúl Llorens Vila´s riding club located in Olot. After that I worked at a private club called Mas Caterina in Madremaña, also I laboured with Claire van Gelder at “Equipassio” near San Feliu de Guixols and finally I worked at the “Yeguada del Lago” in Caldes de Malavella for five years. Here I met Fandango, my champion.  


I started training with Fandango for the Olympics Games of London 2012. My dream was about to become true with the aid of my trainers Álvaro Almiñana Poquet and Linda Swande, and also with the help of many European and Uruguayan sponsors. But getting to the  Olympic Games wasn´t easy. There was a really high level and my training started too late; although the main problem was not that, but the lack of economical resources. We did everything we could and more, but that wasn´t enough and we stayed out of the ranking by two points. 

Currently, due to my perseverance to reach my goals, I have gained the affection of people from my country and from others, and not just because of being a sportswoman, but for being also a hardworking woman. I have appeared in the media many times (radio, magazines, local and international newspapers, local and international news, etc.). My image has also appeared in some advertising campaigns because I want to spread a message: perfection doesn´t exist, the natural beauty of a woman is based on her essence and it is eternal. 

I am now working in many projects and taking part in different campaigns in order to show another image of the female beauty. I also lecture honorary among all my country trying to help people with my own story, and it is extremely rewarding.

Because I have never stopped preparing myself and I count now with one of the bests trainer in the world, Francisco Cancella de Abreu, and also with the horse Ziguezague, which belongs to the biggest Lusitanian horses breeders of the world for the discipline of dressage, this time I have great faith to classify to the Olympic Games in Río de Janeiro 2016.  I count with a great team build up with people full of light. I want to keep on fighting for my dreams and to remain being an inspiration for others.

Click Here for English 




Mi nombre es Alfonsina
Maldonado, soy atleta paralímpica en la disciplina de adiestramiento ecuestre. Estoy convencida que todos los sueños son
alcanzables por muchas barreras
que haya en el camino. Hoy entreno para
llegar a Río 2016.
Te invito a conocerme...
Nací en Florida, Uruguay el 9 de
  diciembre de 1984. Seis meses después, el 1ero de mayo de 1985 cambiaría mi
  vida para siempre: la habitación donde dormía mientras mi familia cenaba con
  amigos se incendió. 

  Al ser un día de tormenta, no había electricidad en la casa en ese momento,
  por lo que mi madre dejó una vela encendida cerca de mi cuna, sin pensar en
  lo que sucedería después. La vela cayó al suelo prendiendo fuego a todo lo
  que había alrededor incluyendo mi cuna. Cuando oyeron mi llanto, ya estaba en
  llamas. Rápidamente me llevaron mis padres a Urgencias en el Hospital Militar
  de Montevideo para salvar mi vida. Estuve 32 días en coma y no había esperanza
  de vida alguna. La quemadura era de primer grado pero abarcaba todo el lado
  izquierdo de mi cuerpo y cabeza, tanto así que perdí la mano izquierda. Días
  después de despertar del coma, pasé a “la burbuja” donde viví un año y medio
  y posteriormente en la Unidad de Quemados del mismo hospital hasta mis 5
  años, ya que estaba en un coma inducido, que es un tratamiento para quemados.                         

A partir de esta edad comencé a hacer lo que se puede llamar vida
  normal, es decir, empecé mis estudios en la Escuela Rural número 105, Costas
  de Arias, en Florida, cerca de mi casa. Mi vida se dividía entre hospitales,
  mi casa y la escuela. Crecí así, entre tratamientos, cirujanos, psicólogos,
  fisioterapeutas, hospitales… Mi única motivación para salir adelante eran los
  caballos. Tanto así que si los médicos o las enfermeras que no me hablaban de
  caballos no me dejaba hacer nada. Siempre decía a mi cirujano, el Doctor
  Arcos, que de grande sería una gran amazona y que representaría a mi país, a
  lo que él respondía con compadecencia.

  Terminé mis estudios de Secundaria en la misma escuela y para cursar
  Bachillerato me trasladé a Florida. Fue allí donde empezaron los problemas:
  me sentía observada, juzgada, sentía rabia por la gente que se quejaba por
  tonterías y empecé a valorar lo que es la vida, el dolor y la enseñanza que
  puedes transmitir con tu incapacidad. Empecé a ser consciente de todo por lo
  que había pasado en mi vida y a valorarla, a quererme, a aceptarme a mí misma
  y a mi discapacidad, a entender que era algo que no tenía solución y que me
  acompañaría toda la vida. Descubrí que puedes ayudar a mucha gente siendo un
  ejemplo de superación personal así que dedicaba mi tiempo libre a la lucha de
  mis propios sueños, retándome a mí misma y demostrando que todo se puede si
  hay voluntad.












Me gradué de Bachillerato en la Escuela de Avicultura de Florida con
  el título de Técnico Agropecuario. Después empecé la carrera de Veterinaria
  en la Universidad de la República de Uruguay pero no era lo que yo esperaba
  así que comencé a estudiar Gastronomía y paralelamente hacía un curso en la
  Escuela de Equitación del Ejército Uruguayo para ser instructora de
  Equinoterapia. Cada vez me daba cuenta que lo que yo quería de verdad era
  montar a caballo para cumplir mis metas, contrariamente a lo que todos los de
  mi alrededor me decían. Nunca creyeron que fuese capaz de llegar donde quería
  llegar: ser una amazona paralímpica internacional y representar a mi país.
  Así que decidí dejarlo todo y tomar un avión a Europa, a cumplir mis sueños.
             
  Al principio me costó encontrar trabajo, ya que no me creían capaz de
  sobrellevar todas las tareas (que eran casi puramente físicas). Poco a poco
  me fui ganando la confianza y el cariño de la gente en Cataluña. Trabajé en
  la Hípica Raúl Llorens Vila en Olot, en el club privado Mas Caterina en
  Madremaña, con Claire van Gelder en Equipassió cerca de San Feliu de Guixols
  y posteriormente en la Yeguada del Lago en Caldes de Malavella durante 5
  años. Es allí donde conocí a Fandango, mi campeón.



Empecé a entrenar con Fandango para los Juegos Olímpicos Londres 2012.
  Mi sueño estaba a punto de cumplirse con la ayuda de mis entrenadores Álvaro
  Almiñana Poquet y Linda Swande, y varios sponsors tanto uruguayos como
  europeos. Pero llegar a los Juegos Olímpicos no fue tan fácil, el nivel era
  altísimo y mi entrenamiento comenzó tarde aunque la falta de recursos
  económicos era el factor principal. Hicimos todo lo posible y más y aún así
  nos quedamos a dos puntos de clasificar para el Ranking.

  Actualmente, gracias a  mi  perseverancia  por alcanzar mis
  metas, me he ganado el cariño de la gente de mi país y de muchos otros, no
  sólo como deportista, sino también como mujer emprendedora. He aparecido en
  varios medios de comunicación (radio, televisión, revistas, periódicos, notas
  informativas, noticias internacionales, etc.) y también en trabajos de imagen
  alguna vez, con los cuales quiero transmitir un mensaje: que la perfección no
  existe y que la belleza natural de una mujer se basa en su esencia y es
  eterna. Ahora estoy trabajando en diferentes proyectos  y participo en
  campañas mostrando otra imagen de la belleza femenina. Estoy dando charlas
  honorariamente en todo el país tratando de que mi ejemplo sirva a otros, esto
  es sumamente gratificante.
  
 








Gracias a que no he dejado de prepararme  y cuento con uno de los
  mejores entrenadores del mundo, Francisco Cancella de Abreu.  Esta vez tengo mucha fe de
  clasificar para los Juegos Olímpicos Río de Janeiro 2016, ya que cuento con
  un equipo de personas llenas de luz. Quiero seguir luchando por mis sueños y
  seguir sirviendo de inspiración para los demás.

story:
LET'S RAISE MONEY TO HELP CHANGE THE LIVES OF MANY.
Many women in Nepal marry very young, so that by the age of 20 they already have several children and no chance of receiving any professional training. The more children they have, the higher the risk of abandonment by their husbands and without qualifications they find it extremely difficult to earn a living for themselves and their children. Many end up on the street where they resort to begging. In order to offer a better future to these women and their children, ROKPA has been providing training opportunities since 1996. At the ROKPA Women's Workshop, the women are taught to design, sew and produce useful textiles. Thanks to this they are able to work and earn a decent wage, saving them from a life on the street and enabling their children to go to school.


My name is Nicole Rice and I met ROKPA when I was first in Nepal in 2014.  This organization touched my heart and I am back here now for three months volunteering at the ROKPA Women's Workshop to help in any way I can.

All monies donated in this fundraiser will go to buying more looms so that the women can make their own fabric.  Money raised will also go to purchasing more sewing machines and tables to work on, needles, thread, buttons and everything else required.  Every cent that you donate will go to ROKPA. 

What makes the ROKPA Women's Workshop even more amazing is that all profits from the sales of the products made are actually given to the ROKPA Children's Home that is located next to the workshop.  The more money we raise, the more women and children we can help get off the streets and change their lives and the lives of future generations.

Please help where you can. Share this fundraiser on your social accounts. Donate when you can. Donations of $5 or $10 add up, so please do not think that too little is not enough, but please give what you can.  All amounts are greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

story:
A Treasured Saratoga Landmark Coming Back to Life

On Friday, June 26th, 2015, exactly 100 years from its original dedication, the Spirit of Life and the Spencer Trask Memorial will be rededicated as part of the Centennial Celebration of Saratoga Springs, NY. The Saratoga Springs Preservation Foundation and the City of Saratoga Springs are restoring this iconic site in Congress Park back to its original glory, and we need your help with the final touches. The bronze statue will be conserved by professionals, the masonry has been stabilized, the diseased trees have been removed, and the landscape design plan is ready for construction. 

More than 90% of the funding required has been raised and the restoration work is underway. Here is your chance to help finish the job and secure the future of this Memorial that has both local and national significance.

Last 10% to go. Give your support, get special perks!

With the final $20,000 left to be raised, the Memorial is on the verge of completing its transformation and welcoming summer in Saratoga Springs. To be a part of this restoration effort and to get a special "perk" for your contribution, choose your giving level and donate now.
Additional donations beyond those necessary for the project will be placed in a fund to support future maintenance of the Memorial. 

Why, and why now?
Saratoga Springs has many treasured community spaces, but few are as well-recognized and beloved as the Spirit of Life and Spencer Trask Memorial created by collaborators sculptor Daniel Chester French and architect Henry Bacon, both of Lincoln Memorial fame, along with landscape architect Charles Leavitt, Jr. 

The current campaign to restore this defining symbol of the city was launched in 2011, and is now in its final weeks. With your help, the restored Memorial will:

  • highlight the importance of history and nationally significant public art in the city located in Congress Park, a National Historic Landmark.
  • reflect the pride of the Saratoga Springs community as it cherishes history, public parks, and public art.
  • provide a beautiful setting for many more weddings, graduations, family outings, and memorable moments.

Other Ways You Can Help

If making a donation is not an option, you can still help!

  • Send your photos of the Memorial for the archives- photos@saratogapreservation.org.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign to friends who love Saratoga Springs.
  • Donate your time as a volunteer with the Saratoga Springs Preservation Foundation and its special events.

Together, we can Restore the Spirit of Life in Saratoga Springs!

Saratoga Springs has many treasured community spaces, but few are as well-recognized and beloved as the Spirit of Life and Spencer Trask Memorial created by collaborators sculptor Daniel Chester French and architect Henry Bacon, both of Lincoln Memorial fame, along with landscape architect Charles Leavitt, Jr. 
The current campaign to restore this defining symbol of the city was launched in 2011, and is now in its final weeks. With your help, the restored Memorial will:  highlight the importance of history and nationally significant public art in the city located in Congress Park, a National Historic Landmark. reflect the pride of the Saratoga Springs community as it cherishes history, public parks, and public art.
provide a beautiful setting for many more weddings, graduations, family outings, and memorable moments. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If making a donation is not an option, you can still help!  Send your photos of the Memorial for the archives- photos@saratogapreservation.org.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign to friends who love Saratoga Springs. Donate your time as a volunteer with the Saratoga Springs Preservation Foundation and its special events.   Together, we can Restore the Spirit of Life in Saratoga Springs!

story:
Hi! I'm Leah.

I'm a graphic designer and writer who lives on Cape Breton Island. (That's on the East Coast of Canada, in case you've never heard of our beautiful island before. Come visit!)

For three years I wrote a popular blog called "Dream Big Cape Breton," promoting our island as a great place to live. I also run a Facebook group of over 1000 members of the same name (feel free to join it!). Through these media, I've helped hundreds of local businesses and organizations by promoting them and the community, and I've helped thousands of people feel positive about where we live.

Now I want to "Dream Big" for myself. I want to take a 6-month business-development program called "It's Business Time," and at the end I will have a functioning business doing graphic design, copywriting, and social media consulting. You can read more about the program on this post of my blog, and watch the video here. The program is the brainchild of Tiffany Han, Michelle Ward and Erin Cassidy, who are all powerhouse female entrepreneurs living in the US. I've worked with Tiffany Han before and had great success! And Michelle and Erin are both amazing at what they do too. And, most excitingly, I've applied to the program and been accepted! There are only ten spots, so that's pretty great.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need $5298 USD to pay for this program. That is roughly equal to $6658 CAD. However, I've made the goal of this campaign a bit higher to account for the fees that IndieGogo, PayPal and credit cards charge.
  • Perks: I'm offering Design Credit, as well as some other unique, fun perks in case you're not in need of my Graphic Design services. You can check out my design portfolio here and if you have any questions at all about what it's like to work with me and what we can make happen for you, email me: leahcnoble@gmail.com
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, that's OK. I still get the funds that are raised and it will still go towards my program. I'll just find other ways to fund the rest!
  • If I happen to go over the goal, I'll pay the money forward to other local creative entrepreneurs.
  • I'll be blogging on my new website all through the program, too, so you can follow along and learn what I'm learning about getting your dream business happening!

What's The Impact?

Cape Breton Island needs all the young people and entrepreneurs it can get! I'm committed to making my life here, using my economic activity to be roots in the soil, as it were, to help keep this place alive, to keep the soil from washing away. I want to have my own business in order to help other small business owners, especially women, to make their own dreams come true. I want to teach what I will be learning through this program, to others, and help them with their logos, branding and social media needs. 

  • I believe in community and in doing what we can with what we have. Supporting me means supporting a future entrepreneur of Cape Breton. 
  • In the past, I've raised funds for my class to attend the Creative Economy conference, through an art auction. It was a success!
  • I've also been a freelance designer since I began design school, and have continued to take on clients to build my business even while employed full-time.

Risks & Challenges

It's true that there are risks. I may not reach the total goal. However, I believe that with my broad network of connections both on the island and across the continent, with my history of volunteering in the community and working hard towards a goal, with my good time management and realistic goal setting (and reaching!), that I have the tools I need to make this a success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, that's OK! You can still help me out by:

  • Sharing the campaign on your own social media.
  • Telling a friend.
  • Are you a videographer? You could help me make a video for the campaign.

Thanks so much! I'm so incredibly grateful.

story:
Greetings!

My name is Hannah. My life's passion is to create a specialty reptile store and community resource. It will be a place where anyone interested in reptiles is welcomed! A huge variety of high quality reptiles will be offered and all of the supplies needed to care for them. Expertise is a main focus so that every question asked will be answered. Aside from the store aspect, Reptilia Den will give hands-on educational presentations. I've seen how much a little time and information is all it takes to dispel fear and I love introducing people to the wonders of the reptile world!


What Reptilia Den needs and what you get from me

I am asking for $40,000 to cover start up costs. With your help I will be able to acquire the storefront, enclosures and equipment for the animals, shelving, rodent rack systems, and stock. I also need financing to handle setting up the space. That includes putting up or taking down walls, a public restroom, heating and cooling needs, electrical specifications, store fixtures (i.e. lighting, countertops, register). It's a very long list that just keeps going!

In return I am offering various levels of discounts, free presentations, and apparel. If you'd like something that you don't see listed, ask me! I'm absolutely more than happy to work with you in order to show my appreciation. If you'd like to donate more than what's outlined we can tailor perks just for you!

And what happens if I don't reach my goal? I will be pursuing other avenues but all funds raised here will go toward the opening of Reptilia Den regardless.


The impact

Reptiles get an unfair reputation here in the desert. With all of the misconceptions and fear floating around, both humans and animals suffer for it. We live in close quarters with reptiles and many of us see them everyday. Our community needs something like this. Reptilia Den will be a hub for information and understanding. Where enthusiasts can find camaraderie, parents can be put at ease, children can find wonder, and pets can go home with the perfect new families with all the information they need.

Having owned a similar business, I know this works! I know how to handle the challenges that owning a business can present. It is also my hope that my children will find inspiration in watching Reptilia Den prosper.


Other ways you can help

Can't contribute personally? You can still help! Please share the story of Reptilia Den on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or word of mouth. Every ounce gets us closer to success! I am also looking at adopting friendly reptiles that are in need of a new home. After a vet check and plenty of time to acclimate, these will become future stars of educational visits. They will receive special attention in my own home.

And a thousand times thank you!

This endeavor means the world to me. A thousand times thank you! :)

story:
Update:

Almost Valentines Day and we are in need of your love... Help u to show these kids how much they mean to us and to the world!!

Day 3: we have reached $1000 - that's 5% of our target!! Thank you for the support! We are overwhelmed by your love :)

Konoto Children's Centre

The Lonely Road Foundation is building an Early Childhood Development Centre called the Konoto Children's Centre. It will service over 200 kids aged 0 to 5 years old, from a rural community called Ga-Dikgale in the Northern part of South Africa.

The name of the centre comes from the legendary queen of the Dikgale clan, who fought oppression and injustice by giving her people hope in a time of despair.

Childhood Development Centres in rural areas go without adequate sanitation, running water and power. They function on extremely limited resources. We can change the lives of the children in Ga-Dikgale for the better. With your generous donations we will be able to store, clean and prepare healthy food, in hygienic conditions, for all 200 children. All the necessary facilities and utensils, such as stoves, fridges and freezers, are included. This, together with running water and ablution facilities, will raise the standards and will be a first for childcare in the area.

The cost to build the whole Centre: $120 000
Our target to start construction: $20 000

If you can imagine a life without sanitation, running water and power then you can imagine the lives of the orphaned and vulnerable children of Ga-Dikgale. We are going to change that paradigm for good.

Join us as we… "Raise our Kids" in a way that ensures they feel loved, respected and belong!

You, your family, friends and colleagues can donate any amount from $20 over the next 45 days. For only $100 a child, we can make their dreams a reality.

In return for your generosity, you will receive anything from a personalised “Thank you message” directly from one of the children to your own personal message on the “Angels of Love” wall. There are also copies of The Lonely Road Book and different sized prints by acclaimed photographer John Ross which were shot in the community.

With your help, we will build the first of five sections of the Children's Centre. In the long term, the Children's Centre will change the lives of thousands of children for many years to come!

What are the Other Ways You Can Help?

We understand if you're not in a position to support our cause financially. You could play your part by sending this appeal out to 10 of your family, friends and colleagues. Give them the opportunity to get involved in changing people's lives.

  • Please pass this on to 10 of your friends
  • Use the IndieGogo share tools to spread the word easily
  • Visit us on Facebook and like our page to stay in touch
  • Visit our website www.thelonelyroad.org and see what's happening

Give a child a life worth living!

story:
My name is Joe Scott and I am a resident of Prince Edward County. In late June 2014, a small microburst passed through the Wellington area of Prince Edward County and destroyed our barn.

This farmstead was established circa 1840 and can be seen featured in the publication Settlers Dream. The limestone farmhouse was home to the miller that ran a gristmill located here, once referred to as Hubbsville. My maternal grandfather purchased this farm approximately 75 years ago. Since that time, this 100 acre parcel has functioned as a small beef cattle operation. My 90 year old mother still lives in the farmhouse and I have continued to run a 30 head beef hobby farm.


I am committed to resurrecting the barn again to honour the historical value and heritage of this property. However, this is a very costly endeavour and unfortunately no insurance payout was provided. Any support you are able to provide is truly appreciated.

story:
Hello!

 My name is Phyllis and I have been a team member with Whole Foods Market for the past 7 years. Over that time I have been involved with helping raise funds for Whole Planet Foundation.
Whole Planet Foundation is the non-profit side of Whole Foods. 100% of the money raised goes to help fund microcredit loans.
These loans help people pull themselves out of poverty. 
This year I get the opportunity to apply for a team member volunteer trip through Whole Foods to meet the individuals that have received these loans.  
I will also be doing a community service project in the area we visit and get to see firsthand where we source some of our products.

 

How does your donation help me?

 Whole Foods pays for a large part of this trip. The team members that are chosen are in charge of funding their own plane tickets and shots.

This is where I need your help!

My top destinations include Africa, Costa Rica, and India. Most expenses I can cover on my own but for these farther destinations I do need some assistance to be able to go.   

What do I get out this volunteer trip?

When choosing my destinations I wanted to pick places where I could bring the most back with me. I see this as an experience to not only expand my life but to bring it home and enrich the lives of others with what I've learned. There are a few goals that I have for when I come back from my trip:
  • Provide training for other team members in my store.
  • Tie my new knowledge of products and the Whole Planet Foundation into free demos throughout our store. 
  • Have a "meet and greet" event with customers to show pictures, tell stories from the trip, and answer any questions that they may have.
  • Host cooking classes built around the region that I visit. These classes will be delicious and informative.  

 

What do you get out of helping me?

 I want to take you on this journey with me. Any time that I travel I always come back with photos, tips, and inspiration to try new things.

For my perks I'm utilizing the things that I'm good at: 

  • I always take photos when I travel. You will get access to these photos and the opportunity to have me print them out in high quality to send to you. There will plenty to choose from and you can pick and choose your prints. Some examples of things I'll focus on are landscapes, close ups of details/designs , portraits of the people I meet, and everyday life. One perk even includes a hardbound photo book that I will put together with recipes and photos.

                  

  • I have a small jewelry business called Bomb de Fleur. I use upcycled materials to make items that are inspired by travel, nature, and vintage nostalgia. I will be making jewelry from photos, rocks, fabrics, and anything else I can round up to bring home with me. These items will get turned into one of a kind pieces of jewelry for you to take with you to remember our story. You have the chance to preorder one of these pieces before I go. When I return I will put together an album of all my finished work and those who preordered will get to choose the piece they like best.

                      

  • One perk level includes a Good Juju bracelet of your choice. You will get your choice of pearl, black jasper, or an amazonite bead. Wear these bracelets for a little extra luck, clarity, or a simple reminder of what you helped me accomplish!

                           

 

  • I will document my travels on a facebook page where you can follow me. You will get access to images and stories from my trip. You will get to see the impact that microcredit loans have and share this with the people you know!

What if I don't get selected to go on a trip?

If for some reason I don't get selected go on a trip you have 2 options:

1: we can figure out a way to refund you your donation

2: we can donate the amount of money that I raised to the Whole Planet Foundation and still do some good with the money.

Thank you for taking the time to read this. Thank you for taking a moment to consider donating to my trip. Thank you for any amount that you might be able to send my way.
Please pass this on to people you know that might like to share my journey with me!

I can't wait to share my experience with all of you.

story:
ehCanadaTravel.com - #CrowdfundCanada


"It’s interactive, fun, unique, helpful and 100% Canadian, that’s just the beginning of ehCanadaTravel.com"

More Testimonials

"Book a Vacation, Not Just a Room"





eh Canada Travel & Adventure was founded by the brother team of Colin & Greg Girard (affectionately referred to as the "eh Team"). Colin, a website designer and search engine optimizer by trade, is the architect of the website. Greg, once an international marketing director, is responsible for sales, marketing and promotions. Today,  the Girard Brothers have welcomed 6 additional Tourism Ambassadors to the "eh Team"

"It has been a wild ride, an eye opening experience finding out that tourism in Canada is a Government funded monopoly. Trying to plan my own adventure vacations – proved frustrating. I was continually jumping from one website to another, seeking out information about Canadian travel destinations and adventures with little success. I had to learn new navigation systems with every website. It was like having to learn a new language over and over again." Greg Girard - co founder.

Seeing the lack of unique content in tourism the Brothers decided - enough is enough - and took matters into their own hands. They left the suit and tie world and took up a new mission - to give Canada tourism a fun personality and allow people to play a part in creating Canada's brand.

The "eh Team" Brothers started with 1 community website located in Sidney, BC, Canada. Then they spent the next 5 years developing their tourism brand throughout Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. The Brothers were encouraged by their participating advertisers to expand... and so they did. 

The next 6 years the Girard Brothers traveled the highways and back-country roads of Canada from Tofino, British Columbia to Inuvik, Northwest Territories to Cape Spear, Newfoundland collecting data, videos and photos for their national project. They arrived back in British Columbia 1.5 years ago and began building out the first National Canadian booking, planning and content contribution travel and adventure website. Now expansion is in their sights with your help.

The ehCanadaTravel.com is now the LARGEST travel and adventure booking, planning & interactive website in Western and Northern Canada... and the FASTEST GROWING website in Canada!  Pending the success of this crowdfunding campaign, the big reveal - the official launch - is scheduled for the spring/summer of 2016. The goal... to create Canada's FIRST coast-to-coast-to-coast travel and adventure booking, planning and interactive website connecting travelers, businesses, communities, provinces, territories and an entire country on one URL - ehCanadaTravel.com.

Producing a tourism website in Canada is financially challenging in an industry heavily dominated by Government associations and big corporations. Building our website from scratch is necessary due to the fact that we are in no way Government, nor do we want to be. Most of the information online is political, bland, bias, database driven and includes very little original content and interactivity. Hence why we need your help to :

  • acquire website developers to assist us in building out the rest of the website more efficiently so you can participate in building Canada's brand faster;
  • train and grow our sales team so to educate the industry that their is life beyond Government tourism and acquire more participating businesses;
  • upgrade and purchase new equipment and software so to be more efficient, effective and to stay ahead of the fast changing pace of technology;
  • pay down borrowed funds from corporations.

With $28,000 we will complete our expansion across the country and therefore provide travelers a tourism website enabling them to BOOK, PLAN & RESEARCH entire vacations THROUGHOUT all of Canada with confidence. With your help we plan to add stretch goals of $50,000 (acquiring a larger office space and create a sales call center) and $75,000 (increasing our budgets for improved marketing, transportation and attending trade shows).

We have put together a great selection of 15 + Thank You Prizes to help make your decision easier and to show our appreciation for your support.
Check out the Thank You Prizing to the right. We have prizes starting at $2 and higher suited for all types of Canadians, travelers and tourism businesses.

ehCanadaTravel.com is fortunate to already have a development budget derived from the revenues of their growing list of advertising clients however the pace of their future success is more effectively achievable through additional financial support.

In taking on a large scale project of this sort our intention has always been to get this website in front of as large an audience as possible so to appeal to a broader range of travelers coming to Canada. Of course, we have had to consider financial limitations at every stage of the project to date and as a result we have developed a website set largely within our means and at a development pace matching a 2 brother level of output.

With Western and Northern Canada complete, pending some fine tuning, the website is planned to be completed within a reasonable period of time however with this first wave of funding & additional financial support we will undoubtedly be able to launch the website sooner. Everybody wins!

Why Crowdfunding?

What started as a personal passion, ehCanadaTravel.com has evolved into a product that has created so many adventures and memories for it's users. With ehCanadaTravel.com 2.0 finally here, the exciting thing about the coming months and years is building on the platform and furthering the awareness of tourism in Canada. We can't wait to see what we accomplish together. 

Since Colin first demonstrated a unique and personal approach to travel online, we realized that building great tourism technology is within our collective reach. We have the ability to hire top web developers for product creation and we also want to allow users to be part of the process. You, our current clients and travelers from around the world have really inspired us and we have learnt so much about tourism, website design, target markets and the needs of travelers. We applied this to ehCanadaTravel.com to create fun, interactive, easy-to-use features. We then tweaked and perfected the concepts, building countless prototypes to make it traveler friendly and bring together the best ideas to create the next generation of tourism in Canada.

We want you to be the first to get involved in creating your country online and we want you to share your feedback and comments. With your help, we will be able to create a unique and personalized website with the people of Canada for the people coming to Canada.

Why not go to banks, Government or big business for funding? We are not interested in holding hands with entities with goals which do not match ours. Besides we want to keep it real and maintain 100% of creative control or else we would become just another political tourism website. 

We appreciate all backers to this project and are excited to create Canada's first 100% coast-to-coast-to-coast, privately operated, booking, planning, researching and interactive travel & adventure website! We have the skills, knowledge and motivation to create Canada, but are lacking the necessary staff, space and equipment for operating at a maximum level of efficiency. It is time for Canada to have a new, fresh voice talking tourism minus the politics while keeping our Canadian personality intact, but we need your help. So if you like what you see please back "eh Canada Travel" today.

The success of this phase of funding depends heavily on getting the word out. Please Share!

This is not the time for Canadians to be polite, in fact, your blunt insistence on funding us is appreciated.
story_txt:
ehCanadaTravel.com - #CrowdfundCanada


"It’s interactive, fun, unique, helpful and 100% Canadian, that’s just the beginning of ehCanadaTravel.com"



More Testimonials

"Book a Vacation, Not Just a Room"








eh Canada Travel & Adventure was founded by the brother team of Colin & Greg Girard (affectionately referred to as the "eh Team"). Colin, a website designer and search engine optimizer by trade, is the architect of the website. Greg, once an international marketing director, is responsible for sales, marketing and promotions. Today,  the Girard Brothers have welcomed 6 additional Tourism Ambassadors to the "eh Team"
"It has been a wild ride, an eye opening experience finding out that  tourism in Canada is a Government funded monopoly. Trying to plan my own adventure vacations – proved frustrating. I was  continually jumping from one website to another, seeking out information about Canadian travel destinations and adventures with little success. I had to learn new navigation systems with every website.   It was like having to learn a new language over and over again." Greg Girard - co founder.
Seeing the lack of unique content in tourism the Brothers decided - enough is enough - and took matters into their own hands. They left the suit and tie world and took up a new mission - to give Canada tourism a fun personality and allow people to play a part in creating Canada's brand.

 
The "eh Team" Brothers started with 1 community website located in Sidney, BC, Canada. Then they spent the next 5 years developing their tourism brand throughout Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. The Brothers were encouraged by their participating advertisers to expand... and so they did. The next 6 years the Girard Brothers traveled the highways and back-country roads of Canada from Tofino, British Columbia to Inuvik, Northwest Territories to Cape Spear, Newfoundland  collecting data, videos and photos for their national project. They arrived back in British Columbia 1.5 years ago and began building out the first National Canadian booking, planning and content contribution travel and adventure website. Now expansion is in their sights with your help.

The ehCanadaTravel.com is now the LARGEST travel and adventure booking, planning & interactive website in Western and Northern Canada... and the FASTEST GROWING website in Canada!  Pending the success of this crowdfunding campaign, the big reveal - the official launch - is scheduled for the spring/summer of 2016. The goal... to create Canada's FIRST coast-to-coast-to-coast travel and adventure booking, planning and interactive website connecting travelers, businesses, communities, provinces, territories and an entire country on one URL - ehCanadaTravel.com.



Producing a tourism website in Canada is financially challenging in an industry heavily dominated by Government associations and big corporations. Building our website from scratch is necessary due to the fact that we are in no way Government, nor do we want to be. Most of the information online is political, bland, bias, database driven and includes very little original content and interactivity. Hence why we need your help to :
acquire website developers to assist us in building out the rest of the website more efficiently so you can participate in building Canada's brand faster;
train and grow our sales team so to educate the industry that their is life beyond Government tourism and acquire more participating businesses;
upgrade and purchase new equipment and software so to be more efficient, effective and to stay ahead of the fast changing pace of technology;

pay down borrowed funds from corporations.


 With $28,000 we will complete our expansion across the country and therefore provide travelers a tourism website enabling them to BOOK, PLAN & RESEARCH entire vacations THROUGHOUT all of Canada with confidence. With your help we plan to add stretch goals of $50,000 (acquiring a larger office space and create a sales call center) and $75,000 (increasing our budgets for improved marketing, transportation and attending trade shows).

story:
We pledge to donate 5% of all funds we collect through this campaign to Lung Cancer Research Foundation http://www.lungcancerresearchfoundation.org 


All perks are available with BEFORE and AFTER CHRISTMAS option


What is "SlavicBeauty.net" and why are we here? 

       My name is Katya Luniova. My husband and I are the owners of SlavicBeauty.net, a small internet business that sells mini dairy equipment for hobby farmers, homesteaders and small dairy farms. Our small cream separator has been a popular item since we started selling it in 2006. SlavicBeauty.net has been successfully and steadily growing. We added small butter churns and recently we added mini milkers—complete systems for milking cows, goats and sheep.  Please read more information on our products below.

       The reason I am here is because our business desperately needs a boost. SlavicBeauty is trying to stay afloat and develop at the same pace while we are paying for my dad's cancer treatments.

Since spring 2015 we took a little bit over $40000 towards my father's treatment from our business budget.

My dad's and mom's monthly pension is $120 per month combined

Our family couldn't afford the treatment otherwise except for my business. It was our only choice.

There was no other alternative for my father to receive proper treatment. 

I had to take the money out of the business and put it towards the treatment to help my father.

This created the funds shortage that keeps our business from developing at the same pace 

Your contribution could help us turn things around and bounce back.

As perks we offer our cream separators and milking machines at discounted prices.

Any voluntarily no perk contribution is very much appreciated and can be added through "contribute now" button


The Story

       In March 2015, my dad, Mykola Lunov, was diagnosed with stage IIIB lung cancer. My dad has always been there for me. He has always been loving and caring. When you grow up like this, you often take such things for granted. You do not even realize how lucky you are till you are an adult and see that there are, unfortunately, other examples.

     My mom and dad live in Ukraine. Both are retired now, but my mom was an engineer and my dad was an architect. They get a monthly pension that equals about USD 60 each. There is no health insurance in Ukraine because health care is supposedly free, but, of course, it is not! Moreover, Ukrainian medical care, unfortunately, is not progressive enough to often treat such an advanced form of cancer successfully. 

When I took my dad for his doctor's appointment last spring, I saw fear in his eyes that I had never seen before. It was so hard seeing him so scared, helpless and lost. I knew this was the time for me to be there for him! My husband and I did the research and decided to take him to Germany for his cancer treatments. Germany is close enough to Ukraine and offers excellent medical care. 

It is all in German, but I highlighted the diagnosis


    My dad has been so strong in his fight with cancer. He has been through 4 cycles of chemo and 34 rounds of radiation. He is up for his post treatment checkup on November 10th.  At times, it has been really tough, but overall, it has been a positive experience. Most importantly, I do not see the fear anymore in his eyes! He is relaxed and he trusts his doctors. He feels protected. His fight is not over yet and we do not know what lies ahead, but seeing him so relaxed and positive is really worth all the effort. 



What We Need and What You Get

        Here is our deal:  We offer our cream separators and mini milkers at discounted prices as perks. All perks are available with BEFORE and AFTER CHRISTMAS delivery option. You will get our cream separator or a milker at a great price and help our business to turn things around and bounce back.

      All our cream separators come with a one-year warranty and our milkers have a one-and-a-half-year warranty. We take pride in providing the best customer service possible even after your warranty expires. All the spare parts for cream separators and milkers are in stock in our warehouse in Michigan and can be delivered within days.

        People usually imagine large, industrial units when they hear the word "cream separator."  Our units are more of a kitchen appliance, easy to clean and operate. 

 One does not even need a cow or a goat. "Cream Line" milk is available from small farms throughout the US. It is not considered raw, since it is pasteurized, but it is perfect for separation since it is not homogenized. Our cream separator is fun, easy and useful! And what a conversation piece! That tasty butter your friends just had at dinner…imagine telling them you have made it yourself.

         Check out this video below, where I show how to use the unit in our small, urban kitchen 

         

It is very easy to make your own cream with our cream separator. It is perfect for goat's milk too! 


As perks, we offer two electric cream separators: Model # 19 and Model # 18

Both models process up to 26 Gal of milk per hour. The difference is the material the units are made out of.

First option is the model # 19, which is featured in the video above.  

The parts of the cream separator are made out of impact-resistant food grade PBA-free polycarbonate and feature a number of advantages, such as the following:

Increased electrical safety

Not subject to corrosion

Easy to clean

 The perk price includes UPS ground shipping within 48 states. Shipping to Alaska, Hawaii is $20 for a cream separator and $ 90 for a milking machine. Canada is the same price as AL and HI.  We ship worldwide and have 220+-20V units. Please contact us for details and shipping quote.

Perk # 1 Have to have your mini cream separator # 19 before Christmas? Get it for $189 and we guarantee delivery on or before December 23, 2015. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states. 

Perk # 2 Willing to wait longer and get your mini cream separator # 19 in mid-January, 2016? Get it for $167 FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states.

 

Model # 19 

https://www.slavicbeauty.net/cream-separator-80lh-electric-plastic-model-19


Model # 19, parts

Another option is Model # 18. All parts of this unit are made out of food-grade aluminum. This is for people who prefer metal units.

Perk # 3   Would you like to have the cream separator # 18 before Christmas? Get it for $268. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states

Perk # 4 Do not mind waiting till mid-January 2016 and save more? Get your cream separator #18 at the special price of $239, which includes UPS ground shipping to 48 states.


Model #18. 

https://www.slavicbeauty.net/cream-separator-80lh-metal-model-18


Parts of Model # 18


If you prefer manual cream separator instead of electric, just let us know in your comments.

We can substitute model # 19 with model # 07 (metal and plastic parts)

and model # 18 with model # 09 (all metal).


Model # 07.  https://www.slavicbeauty.net/cream-separator-80-100lh-manual-model-07

Claim your perk of # 19 and let us know you prefer a manual unit. We will send you model # 07.

 Need an all-metal unit but manual? Let us know and we will send you model # 09. It is just like the one on the photo above but with all metal parts. 

     

SlavicBeauty mini milkers are easy to use and navigate. They come complete and ready to use. Just plug them in and start milking! The bucket is made out of food-grade stainless steel, grade 304L. The milkers have the vacuum pump with a flow rate of 180/200L per hour and are powered by a heavy duty 0.75hp electric motor.

 Taking your cows or goats to shows? SlavicBeauty mini milking system is perfect for show time! It is small enough to fit in your truck for transportation and will provide quick and quality milking for your show animals. 

Have cows or goats and looking to make the milking process easier? Try our milker and enjoy the quality and quick milking process!

We offer the following two models as perks:

 Mini Milker Stainless Steel Bucket 5.3 Gal. 

Specifications:

Engine Power: 0.75Hp/0.55kW

Milking Capacity: 1x 10-12 Cows

Bucket Size: 20L/ 5.3 US Gal

Bucket Material: Food-Grade Stainless Steel (grade 304L)

Claw Type: 160 cc

Vacuum Pump: 70'

Pump Flowrate: 180L/min

Pulsator: 40/60

Speed: 1450 rpm/min

Milk hose: Silicone food grade

Supply Voltage: 120 volt

As a perk, we offer a model for cows. Need milker for goats or sheep? Please let us know and we will send you one instead.


Mini Milker Stainless Steel Bucket 5.3 Gal for Cows. Model 600/BR MINI Comes with free extras: 4 silicone liners, brushes, other extras

https://www.slavicbeauty.net/mini-milking-machine-for-cows-stainless-steel-120v-complete-systemfree-extras


 Mini Milker Stainless Steel Bucket 5.3 Gal for Goats. 

https://www.slavicbeauty.net/mini-milking-machine-120v-complete-free-extras-5-3-gal-for-2-goats-simult


Perk #5 Would like to have your Mini Milker 5.3 Gal before the holidays? Get it for the discounted price of $1119 and we guarantee delivery on or before December 23, 2015. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states. 

Perk #6 Willing to save more and do not mind waiting for your Mini Milker 5.3 Gal till mid-January 2016? Get it at the incredible price of $999. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states. 

Another model of our featured milkers is Mini Milker Stainless Steel Bucket 10.4 Gal for 2x Cows Simultaneously. It has a larger stainless steel bucket, vacuum tank and an extra wheel for better mobility.

Specifications:

Engine Power: 0.75Hp/0.55kW

Milking Capacity: 2x 10-12 Cows

Bucket Size: 40L/ 10.5 US Gal

Bucket Material: Food Grade Stainless Steel (grade 304L)

Claw Type: 160 cc

Vacuum Pump: 70'/75'

Pump Flowrate: 180-200 L/min

Pulsator: 40/60

Speed: 1450 rpm/min

Vacuum tank capacity: 22L

Milk hose: Silicone food grade

Supply Voltage: 120 volt

  

       

Mini Milker Stainless Steel Bucket 10.4 Gal for 2x Cows  https://www.slavicbeauty.net/stainless-steel-milking-machine-10-5-gal-for-cows-120v-2x-milking-free-extras

If you get this perk but prefer milker for goats, we offer the same model, set up for 4 goats simultaneously.


Perk #7 In a hurry to get your Milker 10.4 Gal before the holidays? Get it for the special price of $1299 and we guarantee delivery on or before December 23, 2015. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states. 

Perk #8 Willing to save more and do not mind waiting for your Milking Unit 10.4Gal till mid-January 2016? Get it at the incredible price of $1179. FREE UPS ground shipping within 48 states. 


Where the Funds Will Go

     We calculated that we would be able to afford the treatment. We also realized it would take a toll on our business in the long run. My friend suggested I do crowdfunding a while ago, but I felt quite shy and uncertain. We invest most of our profit back into our business in order for it to grow and develop.  We participate in such shows as World Dairy Expo Madison, WI, ExpoTier (Germany) and others. We constantly look for new products our customers might find interesting. All the medical bills have created a financial shortage. We have a lot of plans and new ideas but not enough funds to fulfill all of them. We could slow down and let the business grow back slowly to where it was before, but this brings the ultimate fear of not being able to afford my father's future medical treatments should he need any (I hope he will not!).

      We have to stock up our warehouses, one in the USA and one in Europe, as the holiday season approaches. We have to make prepayments for the participation in EuroTier, a large expo in Germany, and World Dairy Expo in Madison, WI. Place an advertisement in The Grit magazine, as our promotion campaign. These are the things we usually do but cannot fully afford at this time. We will also donate 5% of all funds we collect to this campaign to Lung Cancer Research Foundation http://www.lungcancerresearchfoundation.org

to help them in their work to fight this horrible disease.

Risks and Challenges

      There are really no risks to you. We already have a fully functioning business, we just need a boost to keep it going at the same pace. We chose the flexible funding plan, and even if we do not reach out goal, we will still be able to fulfill all the perks in the promised time as all the products are in the warehouse already. 

 Gratitude

     Regardless of your decision to participate, we thank you for your attention! Get your cream separator and enjoy fresh cream and butter! Try one of our milkers and see what a difference it makes and how much time it saves! Not ready yet? Just a like or share on Facebook or a tweet or a retweet on Twitter is a great help for us too. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about our campaign! 

Thank you! We wish you and your loved ones health and happiness, because this is what everything really comes down to!

Perk

get your Milker 10.4 Gal before the holidays? Get it for the special price of
$1299 and we guarantee delivery on or before December 23, 2015. FREE UPS ground
shipping within 48 states. 
Perk
#8 Willing to
save more and do not mind waiting for your Milking Unit 10.4Gal till mid-January
2016? Get it at the incredible price of $1179. FREE UPS ground shipping within
48 states. 




Where the Funds Will Go
     We calculated that we would be able to afford the
treatment. We also realized it would take a toll on our business in the long
run. My friend suggested I do crowdfunding a while ago, but I felt quite shy
and uncertain. We invest most of our profit back into our business in
order for it to grow and develop.  We participate in such shows as World
Dairy Expo Madison, WI, ExpoTier (Germany) and others. We constantly look for
new products our customers might find interesting. All the medical bills have created
a financial shortage. We have a lot of plans and new ideas but not enough funds
to fulfill all of them. We could slow down and let the business grow back
slowly to where it was before, but this brings the ultimate fear of not being
able to afford my father's future medical treatments should he need any (I hope
he will not!).
   
  We have to stock up our warehouses, one in the USA and one in Europe, as
the holiday season approaches. We have to make prepayments for the
participation in EuroTier, a large expo in Germany, and World Dairy Expo in
Madison, WI. Place an advertisement in The
Grit magazine, as our promotion campaign. These are the things we usually
do but cannot fully afford at this time. We will also donate 5% of all funds we collect to this campaign
to Lung Cancer Research Foundation http://www.lungcancerresearchfoundation.org
to help them in
their work to fight this horrible disease.


Risks and Challenges
   
  There are really no risks to you. We already have a fully functioning
business, we just need a boost to keep it going at the same pace. We chose the
flexible funding plan, and even if we do not reach out goal, we will still be
able to fulfill all the perks in the promised time as all the products are in
the warehouse already. 
 Gratitude
   
 Regardless of your decision to participate, we thank you for your
attention! Get your cream separator and enjoy fresh cream and butter! Try one
of our milkers and see what a difference it makes and how much time it saves!
Not ready yet? Just a like or share on Facebook or a tweet or a retweet on
Twitter is a great help for us too. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to
tell your friends about our campaign! 
Thank you! We wish
you and your loved ones health and happiness, because this is what everything really comes down to!

story:
Short Summary

'How 2 for Entrepreneurs' is a global community of entrepreneurs that posts free 'How 2' style tutorials and webinars, in order to help other entrepreneurs navigate modern entrepreneurial challenges. 

Topics range from how 2 build online businesses, to how invest in property, to how to read balance sheets. 

The founder of 'How 2 for Entrepreneurs', Lauren Fleiser, has been an entrepreneur since the age of 12. 

Knowing the challenges, it is her vision to provide an online platform where she can encourage her existing community of  entrepreneurs to keep educating each other through powerful free 'How 2' style tutorials , free webinars and paid for 'How 2' style online training programs. 

Lauren wants to educate the entrepreneurs in her community through practical, step-by-step tutorials and training programs that are designed to help entrepreneurs shorten their learning curves and get real results. 

What We Need & What You Get

Lauren would ultimately like to see this community grow to 100 000 entrepreneurs over the next two years.

In order to grow this community, Lauren please needs your help to spread the word. 

All contributions, no matter how big or small, will go towards the marketing of this website in order to get the word out. 

Marketing spend will go towards paid for mailers and ads to be sent out to large, established entrepreneurial forums to let people know about www.how2forentrepreneurs.com and get as many entrepreneurs as possible to subscribe to receive the free tutorials and webinars. 

Our free webinars are used to promote the paid for, online training, designed specifically for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs, to ensure a genuine entrepreneurial perspective.

The Impact

The website and community has been running for 1 year. The model has already been proven on a small scale. 

The free community of entrepreneurs already interacts heavily with the free content, and has a proven track record of filling in lead forms and signing up for webinars. 

Lauren has successfully set up one paid for online training product that has sold successfully to the community with several more products now in development.

Lauren needs your help on marketing spend to spread the word and get tens of thousands more entrepreneurs into this practical, learning community. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge with growing an online community is that you do need marketing spend in order to get to critical mass. 

This is why we need your help :-) 

We simply need to take our proven, smaller website and active community of entrepreneurs and scale it up. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please make as much noise as possible about www.how2forentrepreneurs.com and spread the word! Don't forget to share on Indiegogo.
